reviewText: The drill has plenty of power and comfortable to use. I'm having the same problem with changing speeds that others have written about, but it is more an annoyance than a deal-breaker. It takes a little fiddling to get it to shift from low to high, but no more than a couple of seconds worth. The impact driver is a fine little tool. It starts the screw fast before the impact kicks in (compared to a battery drill on low speed), but after driving a few screws I got used to it. It puts 3 1/2" screws into treated pine effortlessly. The driver is light enough to hang on my tool belt without hardly noticing it's there. The battery level light is handy as well. I would say this was money very well spent.2014 edit: four years later, hours of use, still going strong. Batteries still hold charge just fine. Drill is showing some wear, but still does the job. The mechanism that changes the drill from low to high speed smoothed out with age.

This was an extremely challenging installation.  I'm not the handiest of people by nature, but I have done my share of DIY projects, including aLithonia 2-head LED Security Light Motion-sensing Flood Light/floodlight Commercial/home Super Brightjust a few months ago (which was a piece of cake, and can't say enough good things about that light!).  This was a PIA from the get-go.  To start, there was a bad screw from Lithonia (I had to use myAlden 8440P Pro Grabit Broken Bolt and Damaged Screw Extractor 4 Piece Kitjust to get the faceplate screw out so I could do step 1!!!) and - at the end of it - I wasn't sure it was working (it is).  There's a photocell that's designed to stop this from turning on in daylight that makes it difficult to test until that night!Things were made harder by the fact that this was an eave mount: having the light upside down makes things a whole lot harder!  For one, screws kept falling out...  Wall mounts will be easier, I suspect.On the plus side, since I ended up calling support, I do have to say the lady was very nice and quite helpful.Other things that made this a challenging installation on my eave:1) Mounting screws were all wrong.2) It's quite heavy, since the bulb units are in it3) There's a front and a back (or an up and a down) since the photocell is only on one side.  This isn't quite clear when you're assembling the whole thing4) It's REALLY tough to see the recessed screws and the backplate connections.5) The wires are aluminum, so you might needIdeal Industries 30-065 A/Cu Wire Connector NutBut now that it's installed...  I'm growing to like it more.  The lights are BRIGHT white as anything to stare at, but don't really help in the golden yellow light of dusk or dawn.  On the other hand, in the middle of the night, my backyard patio is fully illuminated.  The 2-head light by the same firm is half the price and I think illuminates WAY better because of the diffusers.  Also, each head here is a little weaker: while the total number of lumens here is more than the other (2067 vs 1700), this one needs three heads to do it, so on a per head basis, the other is 850 per head to this one's 689.
5* TkU - this is the best way to stock up and combat the liberal, narrow minded, environmentalist approach to improving our world.

Next time I'll go with the large, prefer these gloves to be tight.EDIT:After using these gloves for a few days I'd like to revise my original review, they are a bit bigger than other gloves but also a bit thicker somehow it balances out for me and I like the way they fit. Use this for a 8 yrs old sears craftman belt drive garage door opener with purple learn button. The original remote is 315 mhz with 139.53879. It works perfect! and even better than the original remote!Setup is very easy, takes no more than 20 sec. First, use a toothpick or paper clip push into the small set up button hole on the side of the remote and the red light comes on, than push the learn button on the garage door opener unit. quickly press and hold and remote button for few sec. the garage door opener unit light will blink few times and the setup is done. I done all these steps about 6 inch away from the unit.Tested side by side with the original 315 remote comes with the unit. Maybe is new remote or battery is new, I think this 890max remote range is a bit better than the original one. also this 890max has a red light indicator when you pressed. the original don't. This is very useful when low battery and you can see the light is dim.For battery life, craftman remote can less very long. Last time I change the battery is about 3 or 4 years ago, and I use it everyday. Don't know about this 890max, only have it a month, but I am sure should be bit less cuz this remote has a led red light. if it can less for 3 years I will be happy.The original one at sears it just way over priced if it comes to replacement. 890max is smaller and cheaper and it work the same.
summary: work with 8 yrs old sears garage door opener

Long story short my friend has a computer that has a heat-sink switch issue. The heat-sink is in place, however the metal clip that holds it in place and closes a circuit is broken. This leads to intermittent startup issues for the computer. So using one of these we bypassed the faulty clip and closed the circuit. Just like that everything is working fine. Okay, so long story long I guess. Anyway, bottom line is these work as they should. Clips seem to have pretty good spring grip and everything else is just what you'd expect. Recommended!

This is quite simply the best miter saw stand available today.  The only other contenders for this title are possibly the Delta 36-136, the Trojan MS-2000, the Trojan TWC-35, and the Ridgid MS-UV.  So what makes the Bosch better than the also-rans?  Let me tell you:Delta 36-136 - This is a nice stand, but it was not sufficiently stable for my saw.  In addition, the wheels were flimsy and prone to getting stuck in mud.Ridgid MS-UV - This stand is good, however it does not setup as quickly as the Bosch, and storing a heavy saw on this stand when it is folded up takes up a lot of space.Trojan MS2000 - This stand is basically the Ridgid MS-UV on steroids, and is the closest contender to the Bosch.  It is heavy duty, but it does not set up as quickly as the Bosch, and it has the same storage issues as the Ridgid.Trojan TWC35 - This stand isn't a cart stand, so it isn't as portable, however, it is the sturdiest and most heavy duty of the stands.  If speed, elbow grease and storage space aren't issues, then it beats everything else.Bosch T4B - It's tougher than everything but the Trojan TWC35.  It sets up and breaks down faster than anything else out there.  You can store the whole system in the upright folded position, so it saves space.  It has great wheels, and a quick disconnect feature to remove the saw from the stand.  The only negative thing I can say about it is that it's made in China.*****Update (3/26/2009)*****I've had it about a year, and it's still going strong.  The only maintenance it has required is that I had to air up the tires.  One thing I haven't done yet but would recommend doing is considering replacing the inflatable rubber wheels with flat-free wheels.  Right now, I'm having to worry about running over nails and sharp objects which slows me down, and when the wheels go flat, this thing gets really difficult to move.

I bought one of these about a year ago for my basement. I wanted it for heating backup, and after using it all last winter I was thinking of getting a second one. I just had the opportunity to get this second one in exchange for my honest review, so I jumped on it. I am looking forward to using it in another area of my house.As stated above, we used the first one last winter in our basement. It is a full daylight basement with a fairly open floorplan, so it does not heat the entire basement on it's own. But we found that we used less propane in our fireplace when using the Dr. Heater. The electric bill wasn't much different at all, so I'm thinking less use of the blower on the fireplace helps make up for the little bit of electric the Dr. Heater uses.If you use it as intended (for smaller areas or as booster), it works great. We have also used the freestanding oil heaters and a few other types of stand alone heat sources. This one works the best for us in both heating efficiency and low running costs. Definitely five stars!

I bought these particular filters because I didn't want to spend $15, $17, $18 apiece on furnace filters. I immediately noticed that the filter element (screen) is extremely thin (with the accent on thin). The screen is made of very fine treads, like a spider web. You can easily see right through it. There is no way that these filters are going to trap minute particles. The cardboard frame is extremely thin. If you use too much force to install the filter, the frame will wilt like a wet paper bag. I bought 6 of these because of the price. I will keep them only because I don't feel like re-packing them and shipping them back. After this, I will spend the extra money on better filters. This is a classic case of, "You get what you don't pay for".
summary: You get what you don't pay for.

reviewText: I use 3M filtrette 600 14x30x1 in my townhouse's packaged AC unit for years. A box of 6 usually lasts for about one year.I used to buy these exact filters for $5-$7 at Lowes, but lately they went up in price significantly, so I look to Amazon to have deals on them.
summary: This is the filter of choice for me

reviewerName: Roger A. Knopf "makes sawdust in spare time"
reviewText: I hate cleaning my rain gutters.  Using the leaf blower creates a horrible mess everywhere, and using my bare hands usually results in cuts and scraps not to mention doing a pretty incomplete job.  This kit does a pretty good job of getting the stuff out of the gutters in a way that I can dump the leaves etc into a bin below my ladder. The scraper (or whatever they call it) is a little awkward to use but it does extend my reach so fewer moves of the ladder to get the leaves to me and out of the gutter.  It is pretty awkward close up so I end up using my hand to help get the leaves into the scoop.  The scoop is the real star of the show though, it gets a lot of leaves at once.I also like the Big Top downspout strainers.  I had actually gotten a few of these before and liked them so the included pair was a bonus.  I ended up getting more of them so I could put them on all my downspouts.  They will ultimately make up for the other slight deficiency of this kit - it doesn't provide any help for getting stuff out of the top of a clogged downspout. I resorted to my old standby - the curly end of a disassembled wire hanger - I just clear a bit of an opening and let water from the gutter clear the rest of the clog out. But preventing the clog is better, so now I have the Big Tops in place.
summary: Better than using a leaf blower or my bare hands

reviewText: I have several battery packs that I depend on to keep my cell phone and the kids' ipads charged when we're on the road or at the ball field.  I also use a 200 lumen tactical flashlight when I have to do farm chores in the dark.  This is the perfect combination of both, in a compact unit!I love the sleek design of the flashlight - like a large lipstick case.  The square shape keeps it from rolling when I set it down, and it fits comfortably in my hand.  I also like that the charger base is small and fits out of the way on the counter top.  The small LED light on the flashlight goes from red to green as it charges, and it flashes as the power gets low.  But the best part of all is the USB plug on the flashlight that allows the user to charge another device while away from home.  It even works while simultaneously using the flashlight.The only reason I didn't give this product 5 stars is because the beam from the flashlight can't be narrowed down to a spot like my tactical flashlight.  I'm also not sure I believe the "250 lumen" claim - it's bright but not as bright as my tactical light.
summary: Flashlight with a battery pack/charger - what a great idea!

I refinished a wood coffee table, and was looking for a high gloss top coat to preserve it. I stumbled upon this kit at my local crafts store and decided to give it a try. Very easy to mix and then apply--I would recommend using a cheap plastic spatula for easily spreading the product. Do not overly concern yourself with spreading it evenly, as the product is self leveling. I did take the advice of another reviewer about alleviating air bubbles utilizing a straw. Also, make sure that you apply in a dust free/lint free area as the product is very sticky. I also love the fact that the product has absolutely no odor. The thick, high gloss finish hardens to the touch within 24 hrs. and is ready to utilize in 72. Has a professional, high shine, waterproof look that can be utilized on countless surfaces.

reviewText: Can this device ever heat! I followed the instructions to the letter and the heater's pilot snapped right on and the thing lit up like a Christmas tree. It puts out intense heat for about 2 feet in front of the unit so one must be extremely careful when using the heater. I cannot speak of it's abilities with a large propane tank because I only use the 1 LB. bottles. Using them is as easy as changing a light bulb. I only purchased it as an indoor emergency heat source if I ever lose power during the winter. This heater could possibly save a life in that situation.  The unit trips off if it tips over or falls and it shuts down if the oxygen level in the room gets too low. That is what makes it safe for use indoors as long as the little bottles are used.  This heater can be very dangerous and even deadly if the instructions are not followed. When it is on the high setting, It feels like a burning fireplace! I would highly recommend this product for emergency use or any use for that matter that requires portable heat (camping,Tailgating, construction sites, etc.)Battery powered carbon monoxide detectors would be a wise precaution for emergency heat indoors.

Tried WD-40, Liquid wrench penetrating oil and finally found this product PB Blaster!  Today changed the Airflow sensor on my 1999 Lexus RX300 with the sensor underneath the vehicle exposed to the elements!  Sprayed the PB Blaster, waited a few minutes and I was able to unscrew the old sensor with ease!!  I was prepared to wait until the next day to remove the old sensor, but didn't have to.  Very impressive!!  Check out the picture attached in the images section.

reviewText: I'm no little person my self but I have had a few "big boys" use it too. I currently weigh about 240lb 5'-11" and when I got it I was around 270. Even back then it never once felt like it was going to slip, twist, break or be anything other then a rock steady step latter on every kind of level surface. Some of the people that used it I'm more then certain exceed it's weight limits even without the tools they where carrying. It's vary light, I can easily put it in the back of a van or put it in a corner with one arm (though I'm not a "weak" person ether :p). I can't emphasize enough of how sturdy it is, every thing about it is heavy duty yet still light. As other reviews have stated it is a bit narrow but it more then makes up for that in how confident I fell when I'm up on it.I'm really not one to make a statement like this, but if your a bigger person and need a 2 foot ladder that's never going to wobble on a flat surface (or even one that's not all that flat) and is light weight buy this one. Don't waste time comparing others, just get it... Lowes or home depot may be a better price, but I would easily pay around $50 if I wasn't able to get it from a store.P.S.I'm not to happy on the price of the two side (below) but every thing I said about this one is 100% true for this one as well. I don't own it but I have used one.Werner T372 Type1A 300-Pound Duty Rating Aluminum Twin Stepladder, 2-Foot
summary: It can take a big guy

First, paint is fine, color is the issue. There are two John Deere Yelllow's out there. The other is: Rust-Oleum Automotive 249275, which is more yellow and has less of a mustard/orange tint to it. In my case. (2011 John Deere X-500 Multi-Terrain tractor) the 249275 was a closer match. Story time. After I bought the tractor I bought a separate set of wheels on-line (for winter snow tires). The wheels were white, I put the snow tires on thses wheels and mounted the wheels on the tractor. When my farmer brother-in-law saw these white wheels on a John Dere tractor he told me it was sacrilege to put white wheels on a John Deere tracor. So, my mission was clear, I had to paint the wheels yellow. First I got a spray can of Rust-Oleum Yellow at Home Depot. Turned out way too orange. So I ordered the above 7443830 paint, was less orange, but still did not match my other legitimate John Deere yellow wheels. So then I found and bought the 249275 paint. Whala! Perfect match. The moral to the story here is  is that it apparently depends on the age of  your John Deere tractor (maybe other factors as well).

This is an amazingly bright LED flashlight! takes 4 18650 rechargeable Li-ion batteries. There is no dry cell option.The Sky Ray is light weight aluminum with silicone 'o' rings, along with a spare.I have several high output LED flashlights. The Sky Ray generates a wide area of 'yellow-white' illumination. The throw is not as far as some of my other flashlights, but the width of area illuminated is much greater. This no doubt is related to the shallow depth of the reflectors for the three LED lights.Total effect is similar to what you get with halogen flood-light portable lanterns, except in a much smaller, lighter package.So far, There is a high and low setting with the recessed switch, no strobe or 'SOS' though not sure how useful the additional settings are. Inside, the low setting is more than adequate to light up a room, especially when the Sky Ray is stood on it's end and the light is bounced off of a white ceiling
summary: Super bright flood light in your hand

reviewText: For the size this flaghlight kicks butt. It puts out an impressive amount of lumens for a little 1 battery light. Don't expect to use this in daylight, it's only for nighttime or in a dark area. Don't laugh, a lot of my coworkers need to use our lights during the day to get some better lighting in places like the corner of high ceilings that are already lit up. This light wont do it but the bigger brother PD32UE that I also bought will.

I agree with the other poster who said it was 'OK'.  It is really for lightweight jobs, nothing serious.  I've been using it to cut 20 gauge metal studs with it and it and the clutch slips constantly, under hardly any strain.  The paddle trigger is nice.  Maybe I should've gotten the Fuel model, even if it doesn't have the nice paddle trigger.
summary: For light jobs only - clutch slips too easily

reviewText: I purchased these tools to fill out my tool box, which I mostly use for Automobile repairs, but find that it makes sense to have a few high-quality saws around the house, to deal with the inevitable projects that come up.  I order from Amazon, with free shipping, and the tools arrived about a week later.  I've heard others complain about the packaging, but in my case, the packaging was perfect, and everything was packaged, as it should be, inside the box.When I opened the box, I was pleasantly surprised to also find a very well made carry bag, with roll-around wheels, and a rugged look and feel.The tools are simply the best, and even better than I anticipated.  Both the drill and the impact wrench come with LED lighting, to assist you if you're working in dark places.The drill and impact wrench have perfect rotational balance, and while the sawzall is a bit heavier than expected, it is most certainly bullet-proof, and able to cut just about anything.Great tools at a great price, what else needs to be said.
summary: Great tools at a great price

reviewText: When considering water filters, don't go by price alone. Not all water filters are the same and you should be aware of what these can and cannot do. Water filters are rated in microns. The rating goes from 0.5 to 5, and lower is better. These are fairly basic filters at 5 microns. That means the pores are relatively large and will only filter out anything larger than 5 microns, like sediments and chlorine. The Centers for Disease Control and other water filtration experts recommend filters that are 1 micron or less for protection against microbes and disease-causing organisms. If you live in an area with safe, reliable water, then perhaps this filter suits your needs. It removes "Chlorine Taste and Odor, Sand, Sediment, Silt, and Rust." That's it. It doesn't remove lead, mercury, or any other contaminants. A 5 micron filter will let water parasites, bacteria, cryptosporidium, giardia, pass through the pores.This fits in my GE SmartWater undersink water filtration system. I live in NYC where the water is reasonably clean (if I'm to believe the city's published water quality reports). For drinking water, I'll still use myPUR 2-Stage Water Pitcher Replacement Filter, 4-Pack. The stated duration of this product is 3 months but that, of course, depends on how much water you run through the system. Made in China.
summary: Inexpensive sediment filtration; good only if you have reliable drinking water

reviewText: blades all work great.  Works with the Makita LXMT02Z 18-Volt LXT Lithium-Ion Cordless Multi Tool. You can't get every angle with them but every 45 degrees is good enough
So good somebody walked off with mine.  Had to replace it.  Have three for different homes.  Key tip from a carpenter friend is to use same brand tape for all measurements.

Use this primarily for joist hangers and toe nailing in tight spots.  Small, easy to hold, uses little air, and drives 16d nails all the way.  If you don't have a palm nailer, get it.  You be glad to have it in the tool box.

These come as standard equipment on the M-18 2650 impact drivers, so i got used to using them.  I'm not a big fan of tools hanging from belts, but it turns out that this belt clip/holder is perfect for ladders with spanners or trays (too narrow for steps).  In several projects that required step ladders, I found these to work great.  Not one tool drop in a very long time.  I liked them so much on my 2650s that I added them to my 2601 and 2601 VSR Milwaukee drills.  These hooks attach to one of the two brass screw holes on the base of many M-18 tools right above the battery pack.  I've found the hooks to be perfect companions to the Milwaukee bit holders on the other side.  This pair has saved a lot of climbing up and down ladders.  Recommended.
summary: Terrific option for Milwaukee M-18 tools

reviewText: High quality hose.  Replaced one that split at the seams.  Not easy to extend out to the full length.  Feels solid, but the stretching from 60 to 84 inches isn't easy
i bought this belt for one reason. Whippings.  it gets the job done. i like the belt buckle it makes a distinct sound that adds to the whole corporal punishment thing.... a must have

I used to hard wire a 1500w wall heater.  I cut the receptacle end off and wired it to the heater in the junction box and now I can plug it in when I need heat.  Works great, good quality.

For those occasions when good, ol' fashionedDuck Brand brown duct tapewon't do the trick, this is an excellent, sturdy, and sticky product. It was recommended that I try using weatherseal around the frame of our door for soundproofing. We have had a serious noise problem, as our condo faces a loud common-area whose open space amplifies sound. Residents and foot-traffic generate noise that travels right into our unit. Since we were desperate for a modicum of peace & quiet, we thought we'd give this product a try. It was easy to apply around the door's frame; the silicone "wave" profile really does expand & contract to seal gaps. The brown color blends in unobtrusively. Now, there is a marked difference in the amount of noise-intrusion, for which I'm grateful. This M-D Building Products weatherseal provides an effective barrier not just to minimize dust and temperature variation, but against noise. Highly recommended!

All of Irwin's one-hand clamps are a superior product.  However, the Irwin Industrial Tools 2021450N Next Generation 50-Inch Bar Clamp and Spreader is at the top of the line for Irwin clamping products.  This clamp provides clamping pressure unsurpassed by any other.  I highly recommend this clamp to any serious woodworker.
Initially brighter than a 7 W nite light but they dim after a few months.Still usable bright but would have liked them to stay as they were when new.

reviewText: These things are just amazing. The best spade bits I've ever owned. They chew through all types of hard woods like butter. I was surprised at how much better they were compared to my other bit sets.
The unit is inexpensive and has been useful for several projects. The light and magnification combo worked very well. Recommended

This little instrument works as advertized and is easy to use. The downside is seeing just how poor the water quality is where I live. Below EPA minimum standards. We had been using a BodyGlove filter, but it only cut the bad stuff by half. A quick check of bottled water revealed nearly perfect water quality, so we are giving up on filters and sticking with bottled water.

reviewText: Previously I had a pair of Youngstown size small gloves.  They fit great but the finger tips wore out pretty fast.  I thought I'd try these out based on the good reviews & the price.  Mistake!I am floored by how poorly these are made.  The right hand pointer finger is not sewn correctly.  It twists so that at the top of the finger the seam is on the finger rather than along side the finger.  That seam will not last.  To add insult to injury these are huge!  I ordered a size small & a size small is what arrived.  I can wear another pair of gloves inside these gloves!  That is how big they are!  On top of that despite having a pair of gloves under this pair, the fingers are still too long & the gloves slide down my hand to my wrist making matters worse.  The elastic around the wrist is a joke.  Without the pair of gloves under these gloves the elastic hangs around my wrist, it doesn't even grip it.  It barely grips with another pair of gloves underneath.  I can literally bend the tips of the finger down they are so long.  The pinkie finger is crazy long.  They have padding but it could be a lot better.  I am going to save these for Winter use since I can fit gloves for warmth underneath.  Wearing them is uncomfortable due to the long fingers & constant need to pull the gloves up.  I don't want to use them, but I don't want to throw them out either.  I doubt they will hold up past one Winter so at least I wont have to suffer them too long.I was going to rate these 1 star, but they are better (for padding) then the Mechanics Wear brand which are ultra thin, too big & don't last.  So these are just barely better than them.  I just ordered another pair of Youngstown gloves.  I know they will wear out but at least they fit & have excellent padding & features geared towards women!  So far they are the best work gloves I have found.  I do a lot of hard work & my hand are very slender & small.  Gloves are an absolute necessity as my fine boned hands get injured darn near by looking at them.Do yourself a favor & get the Youngstown brand esp. if you have little hands.  They are made better, the seams are true.  They are not junk like these.

This Woodstock hammer has the ideal weight and feel for tacking and driving small nails.  The head is fixed securely, so it won't wobble annoyingly.  The handle is a nice length, too, with other hammers I use for similar applications not being long enough.  This handle length is just right.

Two things bothered me about this purchase. First, this light was advertised as a "buy together" with another similar light that qualified for free shipping under Amazon prime. But this light does not qualify for that since it's from another vendor, so I ended up paying about twice as much as I thought. Second, it is not as bright as the other similarly styled and priced cool blue or black flashlights I have bought from Amazon. The batteries are toss-out quality. Seems brighter with better quality batteries.Still, it's a good light for the car, taking very little space and fitting in tight glove comprtments with ease.
summary: not as bright as other 9-led lights

reviewText: I have an open dining and living area with one bank of five LED overhead lights (Home Depot EcoSmart) and another bank of two. Each bank is connected its own single pole dimmer switch and the two switches are right next to each other - in a corner nowhere near the couch or the stairs to head to bed.I chose to buy these switches for a few reasons:-My prior dimmers wouldn't hold a consistent brightness level-A dimmer switch with this level of functionality without the remote typically sells for about 2/3 of the price of these, so it was very little to pay for the "cool" factor and convenience-These are typically the last bright lights I shut off before I go to bed and it can make for a dark walk. I keep one of the remotes in that direction-I have a Logitech Harmony remote (any universal IR remote may work if programmed correctly)Other reviews have stated that if you have two switches next to each other, don't by the IR, by the RF version of these switches. That way you can control them independently. I decided to go with the IR, as I actually saw it as a benefit - here's why:-You can turn both on and off or dim simultaniously-Compatible with IR universal remotes-If you're sneaky, you can get the *majority* of configurations between two sets of lights. Since this switch has a "favorite" setting you can set your "favorites" as one of the dimmers being on and all the way up and the other being completely off. From there, if you dim the one that is on it remains the only light on, just dimmer. You can also brighten the one that is off without affecting the one that is already on, and then also dim both down.These switches met all of my expectations. Most importantly, they offer excellent and solid control of my LED lights - although I will caveat that the EcoSmart brand has been known to be more dimmer friendly than some others.One final note: these also come with a very nice wall plate, which is a nice bonus if you have an independent switch. I'll use them elsewhere in the house.
summary: Very happy with the two I purchased

reviewText: Great value on this one.  Mine is as accurate as my small Starrett.  Easy to read rule, the slide action is smooth and the yellow makes it easy to spot in the shop/job site (note: the amazon pic shows the rule as a black with yellow marks, but it is not.)  Keep the Starrett for reference and use this for day to day work, so you don't cry when you drop this one ;)

reviewText: it performs as expected. The only problem I had with it was the shutter. The shutter is definitely not a quality as the fan itself and I had to make some modifications to the linkage to get it to shut all the way when the fan is not in operation.For the price I couldn't be happier.
summary: it moves a lot of air

reviewText: This blade came with my BAHCO Bow Saw and was so impressive that I bought a second one.  I have used it daily for weeks cutting down Brazilian Pepper Trees along my property.  When I step back and look at everything that it cut down, I was impressed all over again.  If you know Pepper Trees, they tend to sprout out like a giant octopus and can have many trunks--some up to two feet in diameter.While I began with the smaller trees it wasn't long before I stepped it up and went for the big boys.  I never would have anticipated being able to cut through a two foot diameter tree with a bow saw, but the BAHCO almost made it easy.  You can use it either one or two handed and it simply continues to bite its way through the tree.  By the way, try to avoid checking how sharp the blade is by running your fingers over it. The blade is so sharp that you're bound to cut yourself with it.Normally I would use a chain saw to cut them down but my wetlands are so thick that I didn't feel safe using one in that environment.  The other potential problem is that Pepper Trees, because of how they grow, can snap back and jump off the stump depending on how the tree's weight is distributed and what other vegetation might be holding up the tree.So on the big ones I only cut about 95% of the way through and let the wind do the rest.  Spending  a hot afternoon being pinned to the mud with a tree trunk on top of me isn't my idea of fun.  Plus I would never hear the end of it from my wife.
summary: Simply The Best Saw Blade Ever!

reviewText: It comes in no packaging, but is well made.  Also the shield collar really works.  Without the collar (it slides off the end with force as it is held on by the magnet) the magnet will grab things from the side as well as the end.  Slide on the collar and it has almost no magnet attraction to the side at all.  Provides precise pickup of something you want among others you do not.  Magnet is quite strong too and telescopic rod is well made and fairly heavy.  Good product!

Why pay more when the cheapest you can find (for me, it was this) gets the job done just as well? Removed my watch bracelet with ease, recommended. I actually lost mine and will probably be getting a replacement one soon.

I have built a number of workbenches in the past using both stamped steel legs (usually with pre-fab HPL countertops) and lumber and none of them came out as good as the very solid and sturdy one I just put together this past weekend using this fabulous system. I'm in the process of outfitting a new 14x20 post-and-beam barn/woodshop and wanted workbenches across the entire 14' rear wall so I decided to give 2x4basics a try. I'm glad that I did as I could not be happier with my decision. Having someone to help would make it even easier but it's a very doable job by yourself. Simply cut your 2x4s to length, screw them into the legs (included screws work just fine), mount your shelves and top and you're in business! I used "premium" 2x4s from HD to make my 78"W x 25 5/8" D workbench with full depth bottom and half-depth middle shelves of 3/4" plywood. I added vertical 2x4s on the front at both ends and in the middle for mounting the doors that I plan to add after "enclosing" the sides and rear with masonite. Sealed and stained the 2x4s and plywood and finished them with clear polyurethane. My top is a 1 1/8" thick solid beech countertop from IKEA ($59) that I glued to the 2x4s with Liquid Nail and then screwed down from the bottom with 2 1/4" deck screws (sort of a belt and suspenders approach). I mounted the included clamps to the front legs (nice little bonus and very easy to install) and will put together the 2nd workbench this coming weekend and then enclose both and make and mount their cabinet doors. I'll be building some shelving on top of the workbenches using the included ShelfLinks brackets. All in all a very sturdy well-designed system that will result in workbenches and shelving that is second to none.
summary: Need workbench? It doesn't get any easier than this!

reviewText: good light

Great light on my ATV and only needed one. Floods the whole area and out far enough. No need to use stock lights as this LED saturates them to where I can't even til if the stock lights are on. Very bright and super white light not bluish like others. Strong tough housing and should last a lifetime.

I bought this mallet for use with my chisels.  Like another reviewer, I sanded the handle down when I got it.  The edges were a little too edgy for me so I just rounded them off a bit.  Then I hit my chisels with it.  It works.

reviewText: These are superior to the standard 'dot' bumpers in all ways.  The material is more pliable, and that combined with the raised center makes these far and away the best bumpers I've seen.  Highly recommended

I have this solar light for over 8 months now and had no problems what so ever and still workig great. since I got it, it has been outside on one side of my house to illuminate the trash cans. Only issue I've seen is in the winter which we don't get much round here (south Florida), the very few days we got a bit cold, it would work every other day, I guess due to the lack of Sun, this was about 2-3 weeks out of the year, the rest of the year it has been working great so if you live in a cold place where the Sun doesn't come out often, this may not work well for you.
Perfect replacement for a leaky and worn out toilet flapper. Takes 2 minutes to change. It 's been almost a year and it still looks new (no discoloration and the plastic is not deteriorating).

This is great, especially since ADT screwed up with Pulse app with the last update.  The log in bug makes the app no longer worth it if you have this.  Plus lights turn on and off INSTANTLY without that lag time for the packet to go from your phone to the router, from the router to the iHub, from the iHub to the device.  ADT has apparently discontinued this.  You'll have to watch You Tube to program it because the directions won't work.  But it's definitely worth the effort.  I got used to it after adding the second device.  I hear tell that you can also use it to set your thermostat to the home or away setting, but not fully integrate it since ADT stopped supporting it.  Well worth the cheap price and the effort.

Fair  price, quick ship. Nice finish on screws.  Pocket hole screws and jig make for a quick and hidden assembly of assorted frame assemblies and more. Be sure to use coarse for soft wood and fine thread for hardwood.

I purchased 2 of these to use with my Black & Decker WorkMate benches. They work fine. I'm not sure what I paid for them, but when I needed a couple more I found a similar knock-off item at my local Woodcraft store for about $11 a pair. The Jorgensen clamp is probably a bit better, but for the money I'm happy with the Woodcraft knock-off.

Great soldering iron for the price! It is perfect for any person looking to do small jobs or learning to solder. Myself, I use it to solder/repair circuit boards... You will need to buy smaller tips for that though!

This is a nice heavy duty knife.  The body and blade are very well made and feel really high end (especially since this knife is not that expensive compared to some).  The blade is sharp and cuts through most things with no problem, and the saw teeth at the bottom are super sharp and great for sawing.  The locking mechanism works perfectly for me (I have had no problem), just open the blade all the way and the piece in the handle pops inward to keep the blade out, than just push it to the side with your thumb and shut the blade.  I have not had an issue (if you do not push the blade open all the way it does not engage, but that is true of any knife).  The handle is nice (slick feeling, which is misleading since it looks like it would have a good grip), but the way the knife's handle is made it easily allows your hand to hold it tightly since it has finger grooves.  The blade is a good size and when shut fits nicely in your pocket or in a bag (I use it for keeping a knife on me when going for a long bike ride or hike, since you never know when you will need to a tool, and a knife is about the most useful tool).  The blade is sharp and can cut easily and it is well made so you can also use it for semi leverage (I would not put too much force as a lever, but it is useful when trying to get something open).In the end this is a nice looking knife, that is well made and works perfectly.  The blade is sharp and saw teeth get the job done.  The knife works perfectly and I have not had any issue, it is a great utility knife when out and about and has a good feel to it!
summary: Works great and feel well made

reviewText: It does the job.  It will hold a light on a bike and a gun.  It is easy to move from one gun to another.

Very easy to install. Perfect for our side gate entry. Illumination is soft cool glow rather than a bright glaring light but good enough to be able to recognize anyone entering from at least 2 to 5 meters away. Motion sensor works perfectly. Only works when it's very dark so it saves battery life.

Mid-weight knife with quality blade.  Solid feel to the handle and slip resistant.  The locking mechanism is substandard and flawed.  Takes practice to get it right, something that should not be necessary for a new knife

Our municipal water is horrible.  It smells like a swimming pool and is very hard.I purchased this unit from Costco not Amazon.  When I pulled it out of the box I started to think that it was going to be complicated to install.  The well written directions made it easy to install the unit.  All of the connections except for the water supply are quick connect which are secure and easy to make.After the unit was installed and I opened up the water supply I could hear the water gurgling and the waste of the RO running down the drain.  The directions call for draining the first tank of water which I did.  The second tank that we sampled was the best water I've ever had from home. It is far better than a Britta pitcher.  It has a crisp, clean taste without any chlorine smell.I let my kids sample the difference by trying 2 cups, one from the faucet, one from the filter.  My 9 year old son didn't even need to drink to tell the difference.  Once he took a taste of the unfiltered tap water, he pushed it away and said it was horrible. He hung on to the filtered water.Now we can refill reusable bottles and I don't have to haul cases of bottled water home.  It is better for the environment and much cheaper.  We are drinking more water rather than soda because it tastes good and is easy to get to.Another added benefit is that I put a tee in the connection as the instruction described and routed the water to my Samsung Fridge.  The Samsung water filters cost about $40 plus shipping from Amazon.  Now I can stop buying these filters every six months.  The quality of the water from the Watts filter is much better than the Samsung filter.The only negative part of the install is that the storage tank takes up a fair space under the sink.  The directions say that you can put the filter/storage up to 25 feet away with 1/4 inch line or further with a 3/8's line.  In reality the space under the sink was taken up with a bunch of junk that we never used and having good water at the sink is a much better use of the space.UPDATE 4-10: Someone contacted me through my Samsung fridge filter review and pointed out to me that Reverse Osmosis can waste a high ratio (1:3) to (1:5) of water make its final product.  You can hear the water running down the drain after you use the faucet.  The sound bothers my wife so I put the drain plug in as a mute.  I am considering running a line to my drip sprinkler system.

tired of constant battery replacement for cordless tools i was very happy to stumble upon this at one of the big box stores . it was the price of one cordless battery so what the heck.  belt clip fell off within minutes due to screw that vibrated loose,  very powerful and never runs out of juice  , lighter than my 18v nicad drivers , smells like it's burning up after heavy use like screwing off a deck, cord already showing signs of a poor internal connection and doesn't always contact  .  i expect that due to the overheating smell it will be a short life too.  next time i'll spend the extra bucks and get the makita that i'm sure will last foreever .  meanwhile porter cable has proven that they've become makers of cheap chinese crap .  what a downgrade from their previous reputation as a premium american made tool .

I love this item and keep purchasing more. The switch is only about a foot from the outlet... I would have preferred farther... but otherwise this item is of exceptional quality and seems very durable.

reviewText: This is simply the best multi-tool: compact, solid, and an excellent selection of rugged tools.  Particularly noteworthy: superb knives (straight and serrated), well-made sissors, a bit tool with interchangeable bits - it comes with a phillips head, but you can buy a set of 22 additional bits for just $20.  The Swiss Army SwissTool has many enthusiastic users, but I have both and definitely prefer the Leatherman:  the SwissTool is pretty, but the New Wave simply has better tools in every case.  (No comparison, in particular, for the blades!)Note that the New Wave, unlike the original Wave, DOES have all-locking tools!
summary: best multi-tool is this NEW Wave!

reviewText: I bought this cord to use in-between extension cords . The switch is close to the square end that has multiple outlets in it . I purchased this to be able to use outside to use my hedge trimmer.My hedges are very high, some over 15 feet. I attach my hedge trimmer to an extension pole, the on / off switch is located on the trimmer itself, thus I have to bring it down to me to turn off and on, issue with that is slipping, dropping or having to swing the pole down to reach it and it still running..not safe at all . Searched all local hardware stores Lowes, Ace hardware etc etc...No one had a cord with a built in switch . Wish it was longer, but this length will work as again i am placing it in-between extension cords anyway .It is heavy duty and is listed as inside use. I do not use when wet so it will work outside in my application.One just could not leave it outside as one would an outside listed cord that is designed for that application.Wonderful product and just wanted I needed.
broke after 1 month. leatherman replaced it and the 2nd one broke in the same place. again they replaced it and I gave it away.
summary: broke after 1 month. leatherman replaced it and the ...

reviewText: It really does look great, is quiet, and is very functional.  Even the electrician noted how nice the unit was and he had never seen one like it.However, like others noted, I don't understand why they would put their logo right, smack in the middle of the dome.  I know I can use nail polish remover to take it off, but it's like the people at Hunter had the following conversation,"Hey, Frank, how's it going?""Not so great Steve, we've been having a lot of trouble getting our latest marketing campaigns off the ground.  Our brand recognition is in the toilet.  Any ideas?"  (They're really into puns at Hunter - especially toilet ones.)"What would you say if I told you we could prominently display our logo in bathrooms across America?""How could we possibly do that?""Put our logo right in the middle of them and make sure that not one single picture of it on the Internet shows the logo, so people buy them without realizing how we ruined them.""GREAT IDEA!!!"*maniacal laugh**high five*Would have gotten 5 stars otherwise.
summary: Looks and works great, but WHY IS THERE A LOGO?

reviewText: The oscillating multi-tool is a good tool in a bind, tight corners, quick cuts, the trouble is the blades don't last, and the tool is far from perfect, it produces a lot of heat and noise.

I am impressed at how bright this PAR30 bulb is, without any appreciable heat build up. Most of my experience with PAR 30 has been with stage lighting, and the PAR30 bulbs we used there got VERY hot indeed. And unlike CFL bulbs, it doesn't need time to warm up.To check the dimming capability, I fit this bulb into my kitchen fixture. The dimming worked as promised, and with the design of the fixture,  I can't even really tell the difference in the light between this and my normal bulbs.This is a solid bulb that delivers good lighting performance.
summary: Dimmable + No Heatup + Immediate On = Win

reviewText: Easy to install.Love the look,it matches the rest of my house fixtures.Very quiet blower. With two 60 Watt bulbs the light is good aswell

High quality fixture, arrived earlier than promised and in perfect shape.  Throws great light into my cavernous home office with 60 watt bulbs; use 40 watts for more muted illumination.  Glass dome is very attractive, both lit and dark.  Name brand quality at a very good price.

It's much more reliable to set a table saw blade's cut angle (and to calibrate the blade to 90 degrees) with the Wixey than with a square, but the height gauge is easily supplanted by other, easier to use manual gauges, or height blocks.

These are so convenient to have on hand.  You get a nice variety of sizes.  The quality is good enough for most tasks and at this price, it's great avoid cleaning the brush when you are finished.

All my electrician co-workers envy my greenlee tap kit, and ask to borrow it all the time. One of the best new tool purchases I have made in a long time. I have owned this kit for a couple years and it has saved me a whole lot of time and difficulty. I haven't broken any bits yet, because I switch my drill to slow speed when I reach the tapping threads. I basically only use the 10-32 for grounding and will definitely buy replacement 10-32's when needed. Buy it!
