We got this for my wife, whose feet are almost always cold in our home office. This foot rest keeps her feet warm, and help her knees by providing some support at an angle for her feet.One note, the first one we ordered worked for about a week, then died.  Amazon replaced it and the new one has been working for a couple of months now without any issue.

I needed an easy way to move my Festool Systainer stacks in and out from under my workbenches where I keep them. These carts are just the thing. They are heavy duty and easy to push around. A lot easier than trying to bend down to get tools out from under my workbenches. I also use the stacks as miter saw extensions when needed.When you have a lot of power tools that come in proprietary plastic cases, you needto decide whether you want to deal with stacking them up somewhere and putting the tools in and out of them constantly, or just getting rid of them ( a lot of them just aren't worth the hassle). At least with Festool tools, the cases they come in (they call them Systainers) all have the same footprint, can stack evenly and lock together. You can even open the one in the middle of the stack without unstacking them! These carts are made for the Festool Systainers and work great. And don't worry about shipping damage, these things are indestructable!

I was rather torn whether to leave this light with a four star, or five star review.  At present I own two of them, loved my first one enough that when I saw a good deal on it, I had to have a second one just in case.The Pros;-Very durable.  I have dropped mine a few times from a height of a feet, biggest drop so far was about eight feet, onto concrete.  Didn't even flicker.  I have also dropped this light into water, and fished it out quickly, but it was submerged in about two feet of water with no problems at all.  The finish has taken a beating, but it's as good, or better than the finish I have seen on other lights.-Stupid bright.  Five years ago, 80 lumens, was basically the height of pocket flashlights.  This light puts them to shame.  The low power mode is 100 lumens.-Good throw, with plenty of flood for up close work.-Perfectly centered LED, and perfect reflector.  The hotspot is very even, and clean.-Tail cap switch - pure perfection.  Momentary on works well, nice soft feel to the switch, but with a subtle click and plenty of movement.  Tail stands so you can use it as a candle.-Equally good performance with surefire primaries, 3.7v 16340 rechargeables, and 18650.  I stick to 18650 for longer run time.The Cons;-Only two preset modes that are not adjustable.  High and Low.-Low mode is 100 lumens.  This is VERY bright for low mode, in fact it's already brighter than many cheap flashlights out there.-The belt clip.  It's an absolute joke.  I took mine off that tossed them in the garbage.  If you use it, you're asking to lose your nice light.Conclusion:Get it.  For the price (~$55) it's an unbeatable light.

I got the Milwaukee 48-22-2008 8 Piece Screwdriver Set to replace a more expensive set that I have been frustrated with for the past year because they did not grip the screws well. The Milwaukee screwdrivers have solved this problem nicely.  Screws that were stubborn before with the older set are easily removed with this new set.  They fit almost every size screw and do not slip out or strip the top screws, either.There are other favorable features.  The handles feel very comfortable and allow a great deal of torque when tightening or loosening a stubborn screw.  The markings on the top of each screwdriver allow for easy identification, and the wire stripper came in handy when I was replacing speaker wire.8 Screwdrivers Included: #1 and #2 ECX (4"), #1 and #2 Phillips (3", 4"), 1/4" and 5/16" Slotted (4", 6"), 3/16" Cabinet (3", 6")These screwdrivers feel very solid and durable.  They advertise that these have a shock resistant steel cap that provides extra durability when struck on the handle.  I am pleased with this set and highly recommend these Milwaukee screwdrivers for all needed repairs.

I've seen many folks replacing their sump pump every 5 or 10 years.  They pay 2/3 of what this costs each time.  Buy once, cry once.  Be done with it.  These are the top end of sump pumps.  You get what you pay for.

This 3M 8210Plus Particulate Respirator N95 was a very good purchase. Its quality gives me confidence. It also is very comfortable with no staples, yet stays intact on your face. I believe it says not intended for smells, but it looks like it can ward off smells because it's not very breathable & that's understandable. If needed i will just pull the bottom off my chin to gain more air for a second... then it's right back on by itself

I should have trusted the other reviews. You get what you pay for. This item is absolutely crap. Dented-in can that once the top came off it was off for good. I will be returning this P.O.S immediately. DO NOT BUT THIS!! Go for the other options available on this website. You will regret your decision if you purchase this piece of junk can. I sure did. What a piece of CRAP!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Didn't really consider these to be 'disposable' products, but that's what they've proven to be.  Initially I was very well pleased. They worked well, and looked good.  I mounted them to pillars on either side of my front entrance walkway.  These were mounted, by the way, about 12 inches above ground level, in full sunlight.They gave off good light for several hours each night, and I was pleased.Then, after about 3 months, one of them would start flickering intermittently, and then would eventually come on, but would not last as long as the other one.  Now, it doesn't come on at all, and the second one comes on for about an hour, when it does come on, and about half of the time, the second one doesn't come on either.These weren't expensive, but I was expecting longer-lasting results.  I've purchased other solar LED lights in the past, and I've found that very few of them will last more than one season.I may wind up having to going back to the more conventional low-voltage type of lighting, to achieve the long-lasting results I want.
summary: Were great for a few months.

reviewText: It's not pretty like the Wave or Charge but as a tool it gets the job done. Its lightweight and cheap($). The build is standard Leatherman quality. It's lack of gimmicks and ponderous tools makes this a working persons multitool and not useless heavy belt jewelry.  I appreciate that it has retained the longer and sturdier screw drivers. I know for a fact that the stubby drivers on other models will not have the reach for many tasks.
Very quiet, runs smooth, only problem is that I got too small a one,  have since ordered the bigger one and no complaints
Like I said, the name of this set says it all.  They're not kidding about "Everybit".  Everything you could possibly need is in this set, including the funky Apple screw bits.

This is my third sander, and it fits nicely between myDEWALT D26451K  Corded 3 Amp 5-Inch Random Orbit SanderandMakita 9920 8.8 Amp 3-Inch by 24-Inch Variable-Speed Belt Sander. I still prefer my DeWalt for the smaller jobs simply because this Bosch is a huge monster of a sander and gets you tired pretty quickly if you're having to support it. But the Bosch is a great go-to for finishing off the larger projects where a belt sander isn't a great option.The slide and clamp-locking system for the sanding sheets was very intuitive and easy to use. Having only used belts or velcro-backed sanding sheets, I was unsure of how to keep the sandpaper taut. The clamping system made it very easy to align the suction holes and keep the sheet nice and tight. The Bosch is compatible with adhesive sheets and includes a simple plastic punch plate to open up the air holes. It also doubles as a storage stand (I assume).What's in the box is pretty basic - the sander, the grip attachment, attachable dust bag, and vacuum tube adapter. As another reviewer mentioned, there is no case, but that wasn't much of an issue for me as only my DeWalt sander came with one. All-in-all, it's a sander.  So far so good. Good power, good suction, feels nice and solid, and has a nice long cord to reach all the corners. The translucent dust catcher was a nice touch, letting you see how much wood dust has accumulated, and when it's time to be emptied.
summary: Nice upgrade from an palm orbital, but not as monster as a belt

reviewText: works great on dry wall and you don't have to worry about it cutting your tool bag. big handle but being able to fold it is a big help.

Well, Streamlight missed the mark on this model. Nowhere in the product description do they tell you how difficult it is to operate. Press the switch once for high, then quickly twice for strobe and (I think) three times for low... and then to try to keep it on, press farther down. HA!  This isn't easy, folks, as the light is tiny, the finish is SLIPPERY and the switch is hard to depress.I can't imagine attempting to use the thing in an emergency.  Streamlight should put these ProTacs in the "Failed Ideas" file, issue recalls and refunds.I'm happy with the Streamlight JR LED, 85 lumens using 2 AA rechargeables or a Fenix E21 (new model has 170 lumens on high and a very useful 54 lumens on low).  A Fenix E11 uses one AA battery and is brighter than this ProTac, no strobe... but, how often is a strobe needed?Eventually these light designers will understand that the tail switches are for ON and OFF only, with the momentary on for signaling.  That's all.  Any other function or settings should be elsewhere.One last thing, the Streamlight rep. agreed the switches are difficult, I was told to "Bang it on the table."  Enough alredy...

I bought this jigsaw specifically for a DIY shelf I built to hold my PS3.  The wood I used for the shelf was from an old pallet, and this jigsaw cut through it without a hiccup.  The only thing I would point out is that the blade that comes with the jigsaw doesn't have a high number of teeth per inch (I think it's 6), so it left a pretty splintered cut.  Luckily I was going to sand it down before painting it anyway, but just be aware that you will need to buy a different blade with more teeth per inch if you want a more finished cut.Also, although I have only used this for cutting wood, I really appreciate the future value it has with the simple dial to select the type of material and/or cut.  It makes things simple for me.

This is a well-made nailer, and seems to be high-quality across the board.  The only caveat, is that it requires a larger capacity compressor.  My Hitachi framing nailer, worked fine running off my small Makita compressor.  This one would shoot a few nails fine, but then would only shoot part way in if the compressor was about to cycle on.  I bought the big Dewalt compressor, and now it works like a charm.

I have been using this unit for over a year (two of them actually) and find them to be reliable.  However, you have to be careful to push the slider ALL the way down to turn the off (past a "soft stop" in the slider).  It is as though they wanted a speedbump to keep the lights from going completely off.  Odd and a little annoying...

Every transformer and power strip is different. This pig tail cord is the solution for every problem. It would be great if you could plug right into your strip or UPS, but you have to lose an outlet most times.
I purchased these little book safes as a gift, and it was a hit. You can hardly notice where they are in the bookshelves where they landed.

I found my new favorite brand of hand tools with these channellocks.  Bought these and a pair of pliers and these cut wire so smooth.  Great quality, comfortable to use and very sharp.  For the price don't think they can be beat.

Not what I expected, but a good product nonetheless. These fit well on some fittings, and do not fit at all on others. I have a large variety of fittings for my 4" dust collection system, so this is not an issue. Not only would I recommend this product, but I bought more myself. Just keep in mind that they may, or may not fit your specific connections, depending on the type and brand you are using. They are not "generic" in nature, and don't fit well on every fitting. They do fit Rockler's "Dust Right" handle, and other "Dust Right" fittings very well.

These are typical LED bulbs with a ceramic neck and a glass bulb and a warm, yellowish light that is indeed roughly equivalent to a 60 watt incandescent bulb. They are a little smaller and closer in size to the old incandescent bulbs than the TCP-branded ones that I have been using.Electricity is expensive, so I switched to fluorescent bulbs years ago when they were still fairly expensive and still have a few of them. My personal preference is for bulbs with a much cooler or daylight-style output than these, but they are good for a bulb with a warm output. Stated color temperature is 2,700 K.I haven’t noticed any problems such as a delay when they are turned on or buzzing noises. They are manufactured for GE in China.They do have a five-year limited warranty and with a receipt and the UPC, GE will replace the bulb if it fails during that period. Stated life is 13.7 years when used three hours daily with a 120 volt electricity supply.Oddly enough, the package promises energy savings of $80 per bulb based on that expected life in English, but promises a higher energy savings of $90 in Spanish. For more enjoyment and greater efficiency, I would definitely suggest purchasing these bulbs in Spanish, rather than in English
summary: Warm LED bulb equivalent to 60 watt incandescent

reviewText: This 6W LED Candelabra bulb generates considerable light in a soft white color.  It's a little bigger than an incandescent bulb, but not so big to be a problem in most fixtures.  I withheld one star only because you can't dim these LED bulbs.  A digital dimmer that is set at anything but full brightness will cause this bulb to flash  wildly.  I have found an equivalent LED bulb that permits dimming, but its price is considerably more expensive.  Overall, a nice LED bulb for most applications.  Highly recommended.
summary: Nice Replacement for the Traditional Candelabra Bulb...

reviewText: It's a Wenger so it's made well. It's thin, small, and compact. As others have pointed out, the knife edge is a simple bevel grind so you can't sharpen it with one of those small handheld ceramic sharpeners. The nail file is OK as is the steel signal mirror, but honestly, I got this for the toothpick and tweezers. I have several knives, multi-tools, and even a Victorinox Swiss Army knife, but none of these has a toothpick and tweezers. For six bucks I'm happy to add this little guy to my EDC bag.

I bought this to ventilate a small 10x10 spare room/office. I planned on using it so occasional guests wouldn't have to go outside to smoke when it's cold, and also to help clear out warm air in early summer.Installation was pretty straightforward and while not whisper quiet, it doesn't sound like a tornado either. It's about the same sound level as a standard bathroom fan. It actually sounds like it would move a lot of air, but it doesn't.The fan's first test was during remodeling of the room to help clear out plaster dust after I skim coated and sanded the walls. The room was sealed off and while it did eventually clear out, it took a long time and most of the dust just settled to the floor.The second test was to light a cigarette and see if the smoke was pulled up toward the vent. The smoke just rose up as normal and didn't seem to be moving in the direction of the vent at all. Only when the cigarette was held just inches below the vent did the fan pull the smoke out. Seeing this I doubt that the fan would be much help in circulating any warm air out of the room.The fan was inexpensive so not too much lost but I will probably have to go with something bigger and more powerful. It seems like this fan might only be good for a very small closed off room such as a closet or very small laundry room.

Have it.  Love it.No problems with machining, paint or anything else.  Blade takes a wicked edge and holds it for a reasonable amount of time.  My only gripe is the mouth cant be closed any tighter than about 1/8".  So far this hasn't been a problem, but I suppose planing figured wood might not work so well.
This a lot of quality fuses for the price. Nice having some "backup" in the boat or vehicle. There are some lower quality ones out there, but these are what you expect from LittelFuse.

I originally gave this 5 stars as it is a good flashlight for the money.  It's not a SureFire, but it's a nice light for the price.Decent build quality, doesn't rattle, decent light distribution.  Comparing it directly to a SureFire E2L Outdoorsman, the first thing to note is that the Fenix beam pattern is much brighter in a smaller center, with a very distinct outer circle that is much wider.  The SureFire has a much more uniform beam distribution with a wider center and softer edges (much better light distribution)I bought this specifically for use at work where I use AA batteries in all devices (laser range finders, flashlights, cameras, etc), so I wanted an affordable "beater" flashlight that runs on AA batteries.  This flashlight does that perfectly.  I've only had it a few weeks, so I can't vouch for the long term durability, but it appears to be well-built.There isn't a significant difference between low and high beam settings, so don't pick it for the two light levels.  When you turn on the light with the tailcap pushbutton, it comes on in low power unless you twist the lens head and then it goes to higher power (noticably brighter but not a huge difference).  By comparison, the SureFire is almost like two flashlights (somewhat dim and then way brighter when you shift to high power).Bonus - it has a tailcap lanyard, which is nice in the field.  I wrap it around my wrist and am less likely to lose the light.  It also comes with a spare pushbotton rubber cover and a spare set of gaskets.Downside - the case is round and the light can easily roll away if you put it on an inclined surface.In summary, it's not a SureFire but just the fact that it compares to a SureFire is a plus.  Definitely not total junk.  I spent $32 on the Fenix and $120 on my SureFire.Extra bonus - the comic value of reading the poorly translated user manual.Update - it died on me - bad switch.  I eventually contacted Fenix, and the lady told me in broken english to clean the switch.  Not much help.  I don't think I'll be buying one of these again.  I have had much better reliability from Inova and Surefire, and the Inova is price-competitive with the Fenix.
summary: Nice flashlight for the money, until it died

reviewText: I got this for my very modest (read as novice) shop and I love it.  Paired with the Makita MAC700 they have proved to be unstoppable pair.  I have started and miraculously finished several projects and bookshelves around the house and have yet to have a single problem for about six months now.  I love it.

Before I ordered this, I really didn't have a clue as to it's function. Well after three weeks I am really quite pleased with it. Great price and even greater product. Had a couple of difficult moments at first trying to install. Had a leak at the tank. Finally figured that the ends need to go all the way up the fitting and in order to accomplish this I needed to put the ends of the hose into a glass of hot water so that the ends would expand enough to go all the way to the end of the nipple. After I got that out of the way the rest was very simple to accomplish. It's a definite keeper.

I almost didn't buy this item the first time around because the reviews were less than glowing. The biggest complaint seemed to be that the belt tightening lever was made of plastic and broke easily. I haven't experienced that problem at all. I bought the first one when it was on sale and quickly determined that when there's sanding to be done it's one of the first tools I reach for in the shop. The Sand-Devil takes a 3X21" sanding belt and changing between grits is extremely fast and easy and the belts seem to last forever. I use a rubber belt sander cleaner to clean the surface of dust buildup occasionally and I'm ready to go again. The size allows for a good grip and the variety of angles and shapes provided aids in reaching nooks and crannies. A friend came to the shop to help on a project and was quickly singing it's praises. I bought one for him as a gift and bought a second one to have in my own shop. I think they're great!
summary: Better than the reviews would indicate

reviewText: I bought this tool at Amazon over a year ago and Not a day goes by when I don't use the Bosch corner detailer and at least two of its attachments.  It is so valuable to my work that it sits on the corner of my workbench always plugged in and within reach.  I make fixtures,furnishings and jewelry boxes for art shows so I'm in my shop a lot. This tool offers variable speed and it seems as though no matter what the job one of the attachments will be perfect.  Some of the jewelry boxes I make are small 2 inch cubes.  The top of the box overlaps but also fits into the box.  To get it to fit I use a router but even the best router bits will sometimes leave shreds, slivers and rough spots.  Reach for the Bosch, the right attachment and voila..a smooth surface in seconds and I'm working with some very tight spaces. If there is a downside, and I think it is minor, it is the narrow sanding strips that fit on the smaller attachments.  They are outrageously expensive and don't last very long so I go to Harbor Freight and buy their generic hook and loop sanding discs and cut what I need at a fraction of the Bosch price. Also, it can get a little noisy, heavy and warm if you use it for ext4ended periods but now I'm really reaching for cons because there really aren't any.  Other than that, if you do any fine woodwork at all, you must have this tool.  From the time you get it you'll thank your lucky stars you bought one.  Yes, it is that good!
summary: Versatile and indispensable tool for finer woodwork

reviewText: good heavy duty extension cord . I will buy more of these cords when needed. I don't see anything negative about this extension cord
I bought this flashlight for work since I work graveyard shift and it is absolutely amazing, I could not be happier with it!

So far, this product is excellent. It works exactly how it was advertised and it was easy to install. I installed it in the master bathroom, the run from our tankless water heater was too far from the bathroom and it wasted too much water waiting for the hot water to arrive. But now we have hot water, almost instantly, to both of our sinks, it is great.

this product fell just a little short of being perfect.  First let me say it is stable, it has big steps cause I have big feet and don't feel comfortable on any other size steps.  I am 6'2  300 lbs and this more then holds me.  The other plus item it the holder on the top.  The one thing is that I think the feet could provide a little more grip and I wish the stool snapped into place like some of the others.  But none-the-less it is stable.

Hunter fans are a bit pricy, but they are high quality, reliable and well worth your purchase.  I have purchased three of these for my current home after owning Hunter brand fans in my previous home that were going strong after 10 years with no issues.  These fans are quiet, operate smoothly and installing isn't that difficult as long as you follow the instructions.  These fans will provide a long time of use and Hunter stands behind their fans as well with their warranty.The studio model here is a great deal compared to the box stores.

This was used to drop into my Surefire FI Defender which is similar to a 6p or 9p.  I also dropped it into my older 9p and it is amazing how bright the light is now.  I will say the only thing i see as a problem is the heat that is generated off of that much illumination.  When I had to have the light on for 3-4 minutes straight you can really feel the heat in the bezel of the light.  Especially when the bezel is metal.
i like this bender. had one before and lost it. works great and using a little lubricant with it makes it easy to bend pipe.

Talk about Big Boy Toys, this is it!  We live on the edge of a marsh and are having a blast shining this half way to kingdom come and seeing the creatures of the night. According to the description, the beam on high goes to 2240 ft. and I believe them. There's a "focus" feature as you would have on binoculars, that turns the beam from broad to pinpoint.  There is also a strobe feature (just for the fun of it, apparently).  The item itself is bigger than expected, and quite heavy with the 4 batteries inside, but comes with a shoulder strap.  While not advertised as a weapon, it does have a night stick vibe about it :)  Battery life remains to be seen, but they say 4 1/4 hours on high and a whopping 192 hours on low.  The case is impressive too.  All around a great flashlight.

I was suspicious of this impact driver being under powered; typically a name like GreenWorks would signify to me that this is an environmentally conscious company who's equipment is under powered for the sake of saving the environment.Really, though, no idea how I came to that conclusion. This thing is a BEAST! You've really got to invest in good screws with this baby or it'll strip 'em faster than... Well, you get the picture.I love love LOVE that it comes with two batteries so that you're never in a situation without power and you can always keep working.My first, and probably last, impact driver.
summary: GreenWorks G24 24V Impact Driver with Lithium-Ion Batteries

reviewText: I have used this stapler to repair upholstery several times with great success. I would tell anyonethat if you own a compressor this tool will, out perform any manual or electric T50 style staplerhands down any-day, anytime!!!!
This is an extremely accurate measuring tool.  Makes things just that much more accurate.  Helps my work.  I've ordered more of their products.
summary: Wish I would have thought of this!

reviewText: This is one of the most elegant and simple strings of lights that I’ve come across. The embedded LED lightbulbs are very small and unobtrusive, yet they are very bright. The 120 lightbulbs are strung together on a 20 ft long thin double copper wire that is lacquered but otherwise looks exposed. At first the idea of using what looked like a long exposed copper wire for decoration seemed odd and tacky, but when I put it on my front porch patio and turned on the lights I could immediately see that we had a winner. The lights were glimmering with crisp white color that very nicely matched the surrounding wire. They really work well in conjunction with each other.The advantages of using a solid copper wire instead of a regular electric connecting wire are numerous. Copper wire is very flexible, and yet it can be put into a fixed shape of one’s choosing. It can rigidly adhere to any structure or constraint that one puts it onto, and is thus very pliable and can serve many creative purposes. The lacquered finish also ensures that the lights can be used outdoors, and the solar panel power source lets you keep these lights on the year round. I’ve put these lights up for this year’s Christmas decoration, but I am seriously considering keeping them around for decorative purposes year round. These lights really add charm and character to your home's outdoors decorations. I would just recommend that you put them somewhere where they can be exposed to a lot of sunlight during the daytime hours.

This flashlight is tiny, lightweight, and bright. It's so small that you have to be careful with it because you could easily lose it. It makes a great keychain light although I often clip it to my pants to make sure I always have it with me. It uses one AAA battery which to me is a huge plus because I hate hassling with hard to find batteries. It gets very bright and on the highest setting it illuminates my entire backyard. However, this is not a defensive flashlight. It's just a handy little light to always have with you. The only negative is that the brightness adjustment setting is a little unusual. When you want to change the brightness you have to turn it off and then back on. In spite of that awkwardness, I still highly recommend this flashlight and would easily purchase it again.
I have had these for a couple months, working in an orchard. They have held up well, and can take washing. Can't be beat, for the price. They are sized a little small ( I ordered large ) pretty snug.
I followed the instructions exactly. They cured and I let them sit for over 5 hours. They seemed like they shrunk. They fit and stay in my ear but loose enough to not block sound.

I ordered 1 to see what was up. Got it. Tried it. Loved it. Got 4 more. These put out incredible amounts of light. The ones I recieved are exactly the same as the one pictured. Shipping takes a little longer but who cares it's free. Incredible value, keep 1 in car, 1 in tackle box, 1 for the wife's purse and so forth. Why pay more?

This is a beautiful LED floor lamp.Assembly was as easy as 1-2-3. I first removed everything the parts from the box and plastic bags. I unscrewed two screws from the base and inserted the bottom pipe, then screwed the two screws back on with the included Allen wrench. Next, I did the same for the top part of the lamp and that was it.The lamp is made in a beautiful anodized Aluminum finish. The finish was flawless smooth. The LED light only uses 8W and is bright yet not too harsh due to the diffuser. Because of the low energy usage, it's also cool compared to an incandescent lamp of the same brightness. It's great as a reading lamp. Right now, I'm using this as a reading lamp behind an armchair. It's easily adjustable.Overall, this is the best reading lamp I've ever had, based on the quality of the workmanship and the LED light. I received this as a product sample for review purposes.

I needed a wall tap to go behind my bed.  One that would allow the bed to go all the way back to the wall.  This one did it!  And as far as I know it's the ONLY one available anywhere as I've been looking for a very long time.
summary: Exactly what I've been looking for!

reviewText: I'm satisfied for what they are; a small 5" pair of cutters with spring handles. I looked at several from Ace, Craftsman, and others and it's hard to find a pair with nice tips that close properly and line up properly for this price. Mine are also machined so that they stay closed and open with a slight force. I'm not sure if that's a feature or machined to tight but I've found I like it.The grips are good if you really need to pinch down on something but are otherwise overkill for fine work that you might normally do with this size of tool. I work with electronics and they cut wires pretty strait but can't compare to Xcelites, The handles are little to much (fat) for most of that work, but with that said, I think they would satisfy most looking for this size.
They were just right to replace some aging cords I had. The work well and seem well made. The should last a long to,e.

Very happy with this LED flashlight - it's small enough to fit in my jacket pocket, and yet it's very bright.  Even without looking right at the bulb, I still get dazzled by its intensity.  It's painfully bright.  I use this for taking my dogs outside when it's dark so I can watch where I step... there are no street lights where we live, and the ground is rather rough because of the moles that tunnel everywhere.  Works great, I wish I'd gotten this flashlight sooner.My flashlight arrived with AAA batteries already installed in it so I didn't have to use my own right away.  If there are any longevity issues with this flashlight, I'll be sure to update.The only downside so far?  The detachable lanyard is too small.  I'm guessing it's to be used as a wrist strap?  I have small/medium size slender hands.  The wrist lanyard is not a stretchy cord, and my hand can barely get through that wrist strap loop.  The lanyard cord is melted or glued together at the ends - I've only tried twice to use the lanyard and already the melted/glued part has pulled halfway apart.  If I try to use the lanyard a couple more times (and when I'm using this flashlight, I'll try to pull the strap over my hand, without thinking about it), the lanyard loop is bound to break completely.  I actually didn't dock a star from my rating for this lanyard issue because the flashlight itself is great, and it's small enough to fit in my pocket so that I don't need the lanyard.
summary: Bright and portable - lanyard is a bit small

reviewText: This is a cheap, plasticy set of tools. Its very light and when dealing with small screws, a substantial weight in the tool is helpful to give feedback to your hand. It will get the job done for small things but I wouldn't use these if I had to use them consistently. But its a fair addition to the "once in a while when I need it" tools...particularly considering its price.

I'm a Dewalt tool fan. Never had one that didn't work properly. Purchased this to aid in installing hardwood floors, good for tight spots. Haven't started my trim project yet, but don't foresee a problem.

I recently received a free 1.75 Gpm shower head from my local utility to save energy.  It was the worst shower head I've ever used!  In my search for a replacement shower head, I happened across this one.  The reviews were good & at $5 + free shipping, it was priced right!  I figured if I didn't like it, no great loss...The pros:+  Low cost with Free shipping.+  very good reviews.+  A roll of Teflon thread sealing tape is included.+  2.0 Gpm = lots of water pressure, had to turn it down! :)+  If the shower head plugs, a quick wipe with a finger will unplug it.The cons:-  Not the best looking shower head.This is by far the lowest cost & best shower head I've ever purchased!  You can bet I bought a spare one!► Update - January 15, 2014This shower head has been working perfectly since I installed it nearly 2 years ago!  I even bought a second one, just in case & I haven't had to install it.  Plenty of water pressure, have to turn it down & none of the jets have clogged. :)
These serve the purpose just fine and, thus far, no difference noted. Time, of course, will tell. For now, I do recommend these.(Plus, the price is right)

I purchased this lamp from Ikea several months ago, and thought it had been long enough that I could fairly give this product the four stars I think it deserves.PROS- Simple, yet still has the elegant Ikea aesthetic- Not too bright- Adjustable to almost any angle/height- Base is wide and heavy, very stable- Perfectly focused light for a keyboardCONS- Some major quality control issues (see negative reviews)- Wall plug is too wide for my tastes, takes up two power strip sockets- Not dimmableAs mentioned, there are serious quality control issues. I'm a bit of a tinkerer by nature - if something stops working I'll have it apart in no time to see if I can fix it. That said, I understand not everyone is, and I can empathize with the negative reviews for this lamp. I don't like the wall plug (double wide) but apart from the small issues this really is a fantastic lamp! I have it peeking around the side of my iMac, spreading light over my full-size keyboard. For this application it is perfect, and for what it's worth I have used this every day for several months with no issue whatsoever.OVERALLA very nice lamp that is highly-adjustable and gives just the right amount of light. Some QC issues, but overall easily recommended.

Bought this some time ago...Very easy to install, just two hookups, Hot & Cold.Expanded bathroom from small shower stall to a full shower with shower base etc.This shower panel added such a unique feel & taste to our project... everyone that see's itcompliments us all the time on our choice.Very expensive look... jets & shower heads have multiple settings.. pulse, straight, etc.We have been enjoying this for some months now, & there are no complaints...Our daughter comes over many times when she visits just to sit in shower & enjoy jet spraying.This is very well made, no cheap parts that can fall off.Just make sure if installing in new construction or when walls are not in... the brackets have tobe installed after you install drywall & tile... so brackets will be last. Clip panel on brackets...you're ready to go... I highly recommend this panel... you won't be disappointed.
The cable is just what it says it is at a better price.Great to have its lower resistance than 14 AWG cable
summary: Great extension cord when need its length and the low resistance of 12 AWG

reviewText: What a great invention! What a convenient product. I don't understand how I lived without it before. Really, a must-have in any household.

Needing some additional stocking stuffers this Christmas, I purchased a few of these for family members and decided to test one for myself. In short, this is an excellent LED light to leave in your trunk or have around the house. The light also makes a great high-value gift.The light is well constructed with two general means of attachment, a hook on top and magnet on the handle. Presumably the hook is to be attached to the of  hole or latch on the hood of an engine compartment. Charging is very simple and can be done with either a cigarette lighter plug or an AC wall charger.Unlike fluorescent or incandescent work lights, the array of LED emitters on this light provides a rectangular beam of light.  This can be helpful for some applications, such as illuminating an engine compartment. LED lights by their nature have narrow beams.  More, importantly, however, they last 50 times as long as incandescent bulbs or 5 times as long as fluorescent.  At the same time, they are much more resistant to shock and vibration, which is a potential issue if such a light is left in car trunk until an emergency arises.ProsBright, directional light that makes a rectangular beamLED longevity virtually ensure the light source with outlast the light itselfLong battery life (4+ hours)AC plus 12v (cigar jack) chargingMagnet on backConsUses NiMh batteries instead of lithium ionNo [additional] directional LED spot lightCould be even brighter

Solid little thing, and it is little.  For those times you just need a little help in a tight spot, this is perfect.  Nice and precise ratchet, well built little thing for the price, takes 1/4" and hex bits, which is handy.  Mine's held up perfectly after some use.
its good for small med trim compressorquieter than mostpumps fast enough for 2 trim guysthe 150 psi really helps for air  it takes  to 53 sec reach 15013 sec to rechargeonly rated for 500 hrs
Very versatile and a must have if you cut curves for any project that you have.  I use freehand all the time and was pleasantly surprised by the results.

My only suggestion is I found that sometimes I had to mix and match the 3 bits for it to work perfectly. Sometimes using a smaller drill bit and then a larger screw end. I had to figure this out with trial and error, but I never had a screw it would not work on.

After owning this drill for just over two years, both batteries are bad and I have downgraded this to a one star. This drill saw very little use so I am very disappointed. Replacement batteries are 80 bucks each so I don't think I'll be replacing them. I have owned a lot of Milwaukee tools and this one really fell short of the others.
I build and restore arcade machines and this thing has made moving everything in and out of the shop very easy.  The straps do a great job at securing whatever i am moving.

I don't have a lot of knives, but this one has features that I didn't even know I was missing in my previous ones.This knife has some weight to it. It isn't too bulky, but it feels solid.The blade has a nice edge and is sharp, and the grip is well designed to fit perfectly in my hand. The double locking mechanism is great for peace of mind - I've got an older knife that sometimes gets "stuff" stuck in it and it doesn't completely lock open. That can make it a little dangerous to use. Not so with this one. You open it and it locks, then you can engage the second lock to ensure that it stays open. The blade swings out smoothly, but doesn't feel loose, and the first locking mechanism makes an audible "click" so you know it's locked. It isn't very difficult to unlock the blade, even with one hand.I also appreciate that there are nubs on either side of the blade to facilitate single-hand operation with either hand. If you're a lefty, the belt clip may get in the way, but only slightly.The belt clip is secured to the knife with two screws and is made of a quality metal that provides good tension and a secure clip.

Incra gadgets are always well thought out with a grand marketing eye.  They are not always the better executed and as a result are usually a bit overpriced.  Their biggest fault is usually that they are not as accurate as their description  implies and the user has to gigger around to get a cut exactly where or at the angle you wish.  This certainly makes various cuts quicker to do and is fairly accurate,but no more so than a hand made jig carefully executed.  I am one that takes good care in setting up a tool and was therefore surprised that the joints weren't consistently perfect.  Like most tools, one learns its characteristics and flaws and is able to work around.  Given the price I expected a better product, but as a jig it is Ok to good.
summary: Good jig but not at the level advertised making it a bit pricey

reviewText: This handy kit of metric allen bits is perfect for the traveling tool kit for my metric mobility scooter.  The case also can be used as a handle.

Now granted, this isn't going to light an entire room up, but it's a nice accent lamp, and the ability to set different brightness is a plus.I only wish it were easier to turun on and off. You do so by touching the black bases of each of the vertical clear plastic, but this makes it a bit tippy as you operate it, and also you're likely to push it across the table this way.The better approach would have been to have the whole base be touch sensitive, this way the pressure would have been down and not lateral, and this would not move it around to the same degree.It would also be really nice if it had different color led's. Even mixing a bit of blue in there would create a less glaring and stark color temperature.
Works great, but in a normal two plug socket it is too big to be able to use both sockets once this plugged in.
summary: Works, but the size is not very well thought out

reviewText: Good quality, well marked.  Handy box to keep them organized.  Okay, the box is a little over done aesthetically, but what's the harm?  It works.  Well, the little plug-like stubs onto which the sockets each slide have a tendency to move laterally along the bar to which they're attached.  That can be a bit annoying, but only a bit.  Can't say I have a better design in mind.
Use it daily in my shop.  It's like having another pair of hands.  It is stable and I have put doors from my house in it to trim the edges.  Great Product.
Why didn't I buy it sooner? The stand makes this saw complete. If you own the saw buy the stand.
summary: Why didn't I  buy it sooner?

reviewText: Ordered two of these for replacements for my 2006 Honda VFR800 motorcycle.  They were a direct replacement for the stock headlamps, and just as bright.  For the price, I'll continue using these as long as I have the vehicle.

Small enough to fit on my keychain.  Some useful features, others less useful.Pros: I like the built-in light and tire gauge.  The glass-breaker feature is nice because you only have to press it against the window - no swinging it like a hammer required.  The seatbelt cutter is sharp and effective.Cons: The whistle is useless.  Don't bother with it at all.Overall, in an emergency this little thing could easily save your life.
summary: Small, lots of features, could save your life in an emergency.

reviewText: Great product and good price. The in-line dimmer switch is compact and can be tucked away in tight places. The rotary switch allows a wide band of light intensity, including an ON-OFF position. The cable connectors are 5mm, which is properly defined in Amazon's product advertizing.

First ordered an Amazon warehouse deal compressor. Arrived with carton intact, but had taken a low blow bending the discharge tube assembly, which in turn fractured the input side of the bronze check valve in the thread area. I was faced with trying to sweet talk Makita into about seventy dollars worth of replacement parts, but decided to just return and order a new one. Note that the warehouse deal only refunds upon return, no replacements.To Amazon's credit, the new compressor arrived two days later. If I had it to do over, I probably wouldn't go with the warehouse deal because the savings of only twenty plus dollars versus the hassle if things go wrong just isn't worth it (but that's just me). Also, I'm not sure that the warehouse looks their returns over that carefully. The broken one I received looks great, but might have been returned in that broken condition. The damage only became apparent after filling the crankcase with oil and starting up for the twenty minute break-in period. The sound of air escaping was not from the open drain valve, but from the fracture hidden in the check valve's threaded input end.As for the new compressor, very sweet indeed. Over the years, I have owned literally dozens of compressors of all types. Some purchased, some rebuilt from badly worn, some put together from parts and pieces. This little fella is very quiet, truly efficient, seems very well made, quite compact for easy storage, and while certainly not a lightweight, is indeed portable (I'm in my mid seventies). My reason for yet one more compressor is that I "need" one for my Snowbird projects at our home away from home, and this seems to be a great one!
This lock is great and surprisingly thick, heavy, and seemingly durable!! I'm quite happy with it, and it fits perfectly with the steel cable it's attached to!

THIS is a must have accessory for every camper, hiker, fly-in fisherman/hunter etc. The Friendly Swede does it again!The Grenade is 3" x 2" and less than 2 oz. Small 2" carabiner attaches the Grenade to anything you want. Back pack, belt loop - anywhere you want. And why do you need this? Stuff happens when your out there. Be prepared. In an emergency you have 7 feet of 550 paracord, Fire starter & Tinder to start a fire, a knife blade, 2 fishing lines, 2 weights, 2 swivels, 2 floats, 2 fishing hooks, tin foil for signaling, cooking or reflecting heat. Geeeez - thats a lot of stuff in that little 1.5 oz Grenade that could save your life someday.Hopefully you will never need to take it apart. In the meantime you will have something very cool hanging from your backpack.
summary: Friendly Swede Carabiner Grenade Kit - Get one

reviewText: My hubby used this tool over the weekend to alter an earring display.These were his comments:Very versatile, light weight, plenty of power to do the job, very happy with the job it did, and the bag is great; everything store in it nicely.  The only thing he didn't like was how much heat it puts out - that is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.
We wanted something unobtrusive and simple.  This fit the bill.  The horizontal bar that dispenses the soap would ideally be an inch longer.
If this is your first LED light, get ready for a very narrow beam.  I bought an adjustable after this, though no other issues with this product.

Fit and finish are fine. Looks like a Flank-drive-like design to the socket. The finish looks like black oxide...may be a little thin. The size of the socket is printed and engraved on the socket...the printing looks like it might wear off eventually. Marked: "Made in Taiwan for Michigan Industrial Tools."I bought this to use with a breaker bar for lug nuts; I have not used it with impact tools.In the future, if I need to buy a single cheap socket, I would be fine with this brand.
summary: Seems great for a 7 dollar deep impact scoket

reviewText: Just like others have echoed in these reviews, I too keep my bikes indoors to thwart thieves. But also live in an apartment and can't be drilling load bearing holes into the soft plaster. I just happened by these stands at my local Target and for the price I gave them a try. After some short assembly work I had two spaces for bikes and wasn't at all disappointed. The build quality seems pretty decent and holds up the weight of a kitted out Sirrus for commuting on the bottom and a lighter weight fixie on top. I basically placed the bike I use most often on the bottom rungs, which conveniently happens to be the heaviest which adds stability to this bike rack. Plus your back will thank you.It's been about two years now since bought this rack and have seen it go by different brands. It's holding quite well, plus it allows me to work on the bikes where both wheels are needed off the ground.
summary: Very ingenious design and it works

reviewText: Another tool that I've used for years on the job with great results. They've withstood drops and even a lift rolling over top. My only very minor complaint is that they came out of the package stiff(which is what you want) but took a little while to break in. These are a must have for any electrician and should among the first tools that you buy for your field kit. They are high quality.

These did not come in any retail packaging. On top of that the quality of finish was bad. They were scratched and dented. The mechanism didn't fit the other half well at all and there was a slight clicking noise whenever they were turned.I had bought for the entire house but I just returned them all and moved to Kwikset which were of a far higher quality.

This is what I bought after I found out that "Blackout" didn't mean "Blacklight."  (I know...  )So here's what's good:  It isn't a fluorescent tube with a two foot cord like the last one I bought.  It works just like a flashlight.  In fact, it is a flashlight  It just happens to be a blacklight flashlight.It certainly makes it abundantly clear where the dogs played their game of "I pee, you pee!"

I've had a few different type electric screwdrivers, and I just didn't like this one.  It a pain to grab with one hand and try to get the right button aligned with whether you want to screw in or out.  I have others that made it a no-look, easy job, where this one made things harder. It worked, but just wasn't good for me. I ended up giving it away.
summary: I didn't like it as much as others

reviewText: Two months ago I searched in a national chain electronic store for a product just like this to fix a cable that had pulled out of its casing and had a small portion of exposed wires. I needed something that safely insulates. I'd tried electrical tape but it didn't hold firmly to secure the pieces together. This product is precisely what I was looking for, and I am surprised the electronic store clerk looked at me like I was crazy because they certainly should be selling the stuff.I actually had three computer and video cables that had pulled out of their casings from the plug now with a little wire exposed. It was either repair or replace, and replacing the three would have been much more expensive than using this stuff. There are eight mini packets in this package and one was enough of the material to repair them all. So, although the price seems a bit high, depending on the application, the material can be sufficient to make numerous repairs.This product also provided a solution for another small problem that seemed to have no acceptable resolution. There is a large expansion joint in the concrete floor of my garage. It is stable, but it dips so low that the gasket on the garage door doesn't block it. So, snow and rain can get in at that spot. Imagine a U shape that is approximately three-quarters of an inch across and an inch deep.The only solution I could think of entailed filling the entire length of the expansion joint from garage door to the wall with flexible concrete caulk, but since it wasn't cracked I was hesitant, both because it was unnecessary for what was only a small issue, and concerned that future potential buyers of the house might think there was a problem with that area since only that one expansion joint would be filled. I hoped to remedy the situation before winter weather arrives and this product provided the solution.I formed a small thin vertical dam that fit in the space, and situated it so the garage door gasket would sit on it, closing the gap. I mixed a white packet with a small amount of the black and created an almost invisible concrete grey color. The purpose of the repair is obvious to anyone noticing it, but the repair itself isn't immediately noticeable. Forming a vertical repair with caulk or concrete repair material would have been tricky, and messy, but this worked perfectly.This stuff is also clearly a great product for people with physical limitations that would make gripping things difficult, although it would improve anything with an uncomfortable grip. I have a screwdriver that is a favorite, but it has an edge encircling the handle that always seems to dig into a callous on my finger. A small flattened blob of this material fixed it. It is now customized for my hand.I am seriously impressed with this material, but since it has a six month shelf-life past its sell by date, it may be best to time the purchase so all of it can be utilized within that period.

these are great. I have used them at work and they are perfect for use at home, especially when you want to plug into a wall socket, and then put furniture near that wall.a five pack is much cheaper then buying them one at a time, and you will bsurpriseded when you quickly use them up.

Read the reviews and was a little concerned about the buzzing mentioned when used with a dimmer.  I purchased two lights and figured if they didn't work with the dimmer I had someplace else to put them.  Put them in the two Lamps in the family room near where my wife and I sit and read and it worked great.  Did notice any buzzing when dimmed.

I had a contractor install a sliding door.  For whatever reason, they never put a door pull in so the door could get stuck in the open position and it was a pain to grab and close.  So this installed quickly and life is a bit more simple these days.  This is a quality product that will last as long as the door.
Great lights.
Very strong, built well toolboxes. Works very well as a system. A little heavy, no big deal. Has side handles, top handle. lockes are strong.

I have two framing squares that I use in the shop. But I wanted one that was not "all beat up" to use in my office for measuring and cutting photo backing boards and mats. This fills the bill. It is very light to use, and numbers are easy to read.

I first heard about Sugru some months ago when someone in a 3D printer forum suggested using it to secure a glass plate to the printer build platform. Although I didn't think that was a good application, I was intrigued and sought out more information. It was a delight to have the opportunity to test Sugru out for myself.This multi-pack has eight small packets. Each one would be enough for a small repair, such as a cable cover or maybe a small hook, but for many tasks you'd probably need multiple packets or the larger size. For what I did, though, one packet was perfect. I made two "feet" for my netbook base to raise the back a bit, allowing air to circulate and keep it cooler, since it has no fan. I saw a similar idea on the Sugru site's list of "guides". I rolled the Sugru into a long "snake", broke it in half and then rolled each half into a ball about the size of a grape. I then stuck each ball on the bottom of the netbook and pressed it down lightly against a dampened table (the water prevents the Sugru from sticking to the table. Then I turned it over and left it to cure overnight.The next day I had two firmly attached "feet" that not only lifted the back of the netbook but also provided some additional stability due to the resilience of the silicone. They were stuck on firmly, but should be removable in the future if I want.Applications for Sugru are limited only by your imagination - and wallet. As others have noted, the stuff ain't cheap. But if it's Sugru or buying a new one of whatever you can fix with it, the economics shift in Sugru's favor.

I bought this unit to use in a carpentry business I recently started.  This units quickly recovers, and has no problems supporting two framing guns working hard.  The unit is quiet enough that while it is running while located in my cargo trailer I can easily work inside the trailer and even carry on a conversation without shouting.  This is one of the most efficient and quiet compressors I have been around.

As everyone else already mentioned, and I clearly should have taken note of, this lock is junk.  I bent the cheap key trying to set my combination.  Apparently, the trick is you have to push it in really hard before turning it.  You can't just push it in and turn it, you need to use force. Also, this is brass as depicted in the picture.  It used to be a brass lock, but now it is just a cheaply painted gold color.
A good selection of Black and Decker Jig saw Blades.For cutting metal,wood,Plastic,or aluminum plus other uses I am sure.Can't go wrong

Had no idea just  how handy and space saving this item could be.  Now  I'm thinking about getting  another for me truck,  and one doe my garage too box as well.  The one in mt shop is getting a lot of use.  Great thing. !!!

These must be made for men, but I'm not sure about that either.  I got a medium though I have long fingers and rather chubby hands.  My first instinct was to get the large but reading other reviews I opted for a medium.The gloves fit well, but the fingers are too long.  I had my rather large son try them on and they were too long for his fingers too, so these are definitely made big.He's going to cut the fingertips off and resew them for me.  they are perhaps 1/2 inch long on most fingers except the thumb.I've used them a couple of times anyway - I had some broken glass to pick up and they picked it up without me getting cut.  I'm hoping to use them to help me when I process large numbers of onions and other things that I buy in bulk and freeze.The price was certainly right and I'm sure once I get those fingers cut down a bit, they'll be great.  Really I suppose if you can sew or know someone who can, that it's best these are too long than too short.

This tool is great and pretty cool. It comes with the claw but the light/magnet attachment is where it is at. It screws right onto the front of the claw and you use the handle to turn the light on and off. You just puch in on the handle to operate it. The magnet it self can hold the weight of just about any tool and claw spring was strong enough to pick up a 1" wrench. Pretty nice tool with two features that can be switched out in seconds. Would recommend
summary: Nice Double Tool For The Cause

reviewText: The grit on this cutting wheel wears off extremely quickly on engineered flooring. It cut very nicely for 1 foot or so, but bogged down after that. It still cuts, but not well enough for 1/2" of flooring (the tool just doesn't have enough power to keep cutting this thickness of board once the grit is gone). This might be practical to use if the blades were $10 for a five pack, but they are just too expensive for how quickly they wear out.
This is a good hammer and is nice to grip. Does the job and feels nice.

This is a well-constructed, powerful saw. The default 24-tooth blade that came with the saw fit well and worked well. However, when I tried to use a Diablo 60-tooth blade, I found that the blade was too thin to fit the saw. Even when the nut that holds the blade to the axle is fully tightened, there is sideways `play' in the blade, and the safety `slip' system engaged as soon as I tried to use the saw.I called Skil customer service. The guy said that `this is a tool intended for home use and is not designed to support such high quality blades'. He suggested that I return this and upgrade to a much more expensive product.I am almost 100% positive that he was bullshitting and that the problem was a manufacturing defect in this particular saw. The manual makes no reference to `minimal blade thickness'. But who am I to argue when the company representative wants me to return the product! So that is what I did.By the way, as other reviewers have pointed out, the laser sight is not perfectly aligned with the blade on this model.
summary: Does not work with thinner, high-tooth count blades.

reviewText: Great tool for the price!! I would buy again without a second thought!!
Excellent visibility without hitting by any vehicle for any parking lot, side road for mailbox, anything for safety reasons without getting hurt.

I'm replacing incandescent landscape well lights PAR36 25W with these LED fixtures. This LED fixture 3W LED is visually equal. Installation is quick; product is solid and works with my current 12V transformer system. Light is Warm White (not blue or green) I have 6 installed so far and will purchase 7 more. Excellent replacement!6/15/13 update: We've purchased a total of 13 so far and am ordering 1 more to complete replacement of our existing landscape lighting.  We are pleased with the light and installation.
It's a welding chipping hammer, there's not much to say.  It takes off slag, and works as a makeshift pry bar when needed.

Placing the first razor blade into the knife is a confusing process . No instruction what so ever . Heaven help you if you push the blade in too far ; as I did . It becomes virtually impossible to remove . DeWalt knows better than this . Instructions should be simple to explain , but they make no attempt ; therefore only 4 stars instead of 5 . Come on DeWalt !!
