reviewText: This is one of the smallest battery operated LED motion sensor lights that I've seen, but it works very well, and the four LEDs put out enough light to illuminate small areas where there are no light fixtures or AC outlets. It would be ideal for unlighted closets or pantries, or to illuminate unlighted stairs to the basement. It could also be used as a motion-activated night light in a bathroom or hallway.The control switch has three positions: Auto, Off, and On. "On" turns on the LEDs until the switch is returned to Off. "Auto" sets the motion and light sensor to turn on the LEDs when two conditions are met - the ambient lighting is dim, and the sensor detects motion within a radius of 4 meters (about 13 feet). The light remains on for about half a minute, then turns off unless motion is still detected.The light can be mounted almost anywhere it's needed with the accessory plastic bracket and screws included in the kit. With the light weighing only 3 ounces (including the 3 AAA batteries), double-sided tape should also work.This is a very useful device that has many possible applications in a house, garage, or office.A product sample was provided in return for the promise of an honest, unbiased review.
summary: A handy device for illuminating unlit or poorly lit areas of the house

reviewText: We have been using this in the basement for a while and it works great. I haven't used it for water. We have so much dust and cat hair that accumulates down the basement stairway and on the floor and this picks up the "sticky" hair that clings to the floor.

I'm repurposing an out-of-the-way corner of my oddly-shaped living room to accommodate a growing assortment of crafts supplies, and I wanted something that looked decent, could hold a lot, and, most important, was easy to assemble.Well, you can't get much easier than this unit.  It takes longer to get it out of the box than it does to set up.  It arrives already assembled.  All you have to do is unlock the clasp on the side, "unfold" it horizontally, swing the top shelf over the top and latch, then latch the "stabilizer" lock on the back.  Done.  It doesn't weight a lot, either, which makes it easy to maneuver into place after "assembly."  I opted NOT to include the wheels, because I'm not sure I'd ever need them.  If I ever need to move the unit, I would simply unload the boxes and bins of supplies, shift the unit, then reload.With a rating of 250# PER SHELF, this should hold all of my crafts supplies with no problem.  I'll try to upload a photo or two after I get things arranged.I initially purchased two of these, and may spring for one more.  I'm no spring chicken, so wresting with stuff that takes hours and an assortment of tools to assemble isn't exactly my idea of a good time.  This unit is definitely worth the money to me.
The cute is great and the look is even better. They feel great in my hand.
This crank makes it quick and easy to tension and release tension on your band saw blade.  Works great on the Jet 14" saw.  Quick and easy to install.  Built with sturdy, quality materials.
summary: Crank makes band saw fun to use again

reviewText: I like this laser so much, I want to get the newer 3 beam version!  Well worth the money if you want your work to be accurate and look good. I used it to prove a cabinet installer was out of level by 3/4" over 20'.  He bragged that his laser was worth $2,500.00.  Must have been dropped!

This simple tool is a lifesaver.  I bought it to hang my TV in my house and a whole bunch of pegboard in my garage.  Assuming your house is built with studs and nails, rather than cardboard and duct tape, I can't imagine how you could go wrong with this.  It is simple to use.  Just move it around the wall and it will stick to the nails it finds and locate your studs.  No batteries to replace or mechanical stuff to break.  Very easy.
It is almost impossible to keep 100% of shop dust out of your eyes when cutting or sanding wood with power tools.  But these goggles definitely give woodworkers a fighting chance.
good product, I like, I'm trying, and I recommend it works well, it is much easier to use, , ,

This has got to be one of the worst instruction sheets I have ever triedto follow.According to the instruction sheet, there are two locations for the input jacks:at the top (just below the readout) and at the bottom (where they really are).The instructions also say to zero the unit out, and this only works on the lower pF side (which is very touchy), as when you dial in the uF side, it is always at 000.The instructions say to insert the black sensor into the jack with the "-" signal, and the red,with the "+" THEY DON'T EXIST! After brute force logic kicked in, I ended up assuming that the middle jack was negative, and that the left and right were for uF and pF respectively, even thoughI was able to get good readings on (4) 50uF and 55uF run caps that showed values from 48uF to 52uF by inserting the black and red tester cables into any combination that included the center connector;  all three are marked as Cx.While this tester did what I wanted it to do (at least on the uF side), it will take you some fiddling around to get to where you want to go with it, as you might as well just toss the so-called instructions, and just go by your past experience.

I bought one of these a while back, just to try it out as a working tool.Well, the belt clip failed the first day, and is a raging piece of crap. Luckily, it comes off with two screws and makes a nice 'tink' sound as it's thrown into the trash can in a fit of disgust.That said, the tool is FINE for pocket carry, without the communist East German inspired piece of crap pocket clip. My Gerber Crucial multi tool has evolved into a unit I carry in a cup holder of my car. I grab it when I need it, and then it resides in my pocket the rest of the work day.I run an automotive business right now... and when I use a tool, I USE IT. The Gerber (Minus teh sucky pocket clip) manages to keep up.
summary: Clip is junk, rest is great!

reviewText: Purchased this to paint the cathedral ceilings in our house.  I over estimated how high the ceilings were and barely had to extend the pole.  This was actually a good thing since if you had to extend it out all the way I would think it would get a bit to flexible.  Really fun to try to dip roller in a tray with a 10' pole attached.  Cover everything with plastic if you are doing ceilings with this.

This very sturdy tape is set in a solid rubberized housing.  Markings are easy to read and the tape stretched (staying rigid) across my home office for measurements without any problems.  The brake button barely works (requires hard direct pressure), but I rarely use that feature, favoring the lock lever instead.I'm unclear if the rubberized housing will last as well as a traditional metal casing-- I have Craftsman metal-cased measures that I've had for 10-20 years, will see if this one stands that test of time.  The purple accents don't add anything for me-- on one side of the tape measure, they look a little like an advertising sticker that you can't peel off (kind of ugly).  Otherwise the colors are fine.The clamshell plastic packaging is a struggle to remove, as is typical for that sort of package.The lightweight casing may be better suited for carrying on your person than for longevity in your tool box.  Recommended for that purpose.

i keep buying these bulbs because they fit.  even other brands that say compact have a bigger base making it so the light cover will not fit back on, but these are smaller base so the cover can fit back on with these.

I have bought air hose from my big box store and have been very disappointed after just two years of light use because it kinked and split. This hose does not mark the floor and does not kink so for the same money and a 10 year warranty I think it's clear that I made a good choice.

This system is far easier than running wires for a hard-wired 3-way switch, but it's probably best for an occasionally used switch rather than something that's being used every day. The switches inside will wear out over time with repeated use.
These are energy savers and easy to store.  The regular lightbulbs don't store as well and don't last as long.

I got this for my husband as a "stocking gift", really because I thought it looked cute.  He has it on his key chain, and its not bigger than and small tube of chapstick.  And eveytime he has uses it, all his friends comments on how cool it is, how strong the light it, and how they wish they had one like it.  Ladies, if you're looking for a small gift, this is the one for you.  And I'm probably going to buy one for myself too.

I purchased this because I sometime need some power 75 or so feet from our house and I also run a small waterpump that take water from the lake we live by to water our lawn and garden. This works well and I don't have to worry about overloading the cord. As with everything from Amazon it came in 2 days by UPS and the price was good.
The light manufacturer designed or built the lights so that they would only take this specific Maxlite bulb. The bulbs arrived in good condition and they fit perfectly..

I got this for my wife to use around the kitchen.  She is only 4'11" and needs a little extra help reaching the higher cabinets.  This ladder is perfect, light weight and sturdy and folds up so that it fits between the wall and the frig.  A great value and handy tool.  I highly recommend it.
I used this to hold a molding on a faux fireplace i was building and ended up just hammering the pieces on because the glue alone would not hold.
Great too for cutting aluminum or hard plastic.  I use it to cut shapes from aluminum or to trim hard plastic for whatever reason.  They're a decent price and they snip well.
compact, inexpensive, with a very complete set of tools inside. the pliers work great and the straight knife edge as well as serrated edge are very sharp.

I don't know if I'll ever make my money back for the price of the switch to have my light switch off during the day, but it is super cool.  You enter in your latitude and longitude and it does the rest - sun goes down, light comes one - sun goes up, light goes off!  No batteries!

this is perfect, SAE and metric in a nice compact holder for my new small tool bag.  my father-in-law gave me a nice little set of DeWalt SAE only drivers but they do not come with any type of holder...mayhem!  these Tekton also have a nice sandblasted finish to them i like. i must also say, i was pleasantly surprised, the sizing stamps used to stamp the size of these drivers on their sides was nice and big...very easy to read for these old peepers.  although i have not figured out how the belt loop is supposed to work, user friendly, without the belt obstructing things...the loop is behind the Tekton logo you see in their picture, no biggie, didn't plan on putting it on my belt.  i wish i bought something like this a long time ago, hard to find drivers like this with nice compact cases.

Skil has made one of the greatest little saws yet.  This saw has more power than the Porter Cable Saw Boss, and is lightweight and easy to use.  Most of the time I don't need the power of a 7 1/4" worm drive, so I grab the 5 1/2" skilsaw.  I use it in my shop mostly for cutting sheets of plywood down to size, and occasionally to cut a 2 x 4 or a 2 x 6.  It has plenty of power and is so convenient to use.  You won't be disappointed in this little power house.  By the way, it is not that noisy as another reviewer has written.  If you want quiet, go back to the kitchen.

Bought this as a safeguard against a slow flowing patio drain until I could have it repaired and it worked great. Used it twice during rainstorms that would have otherwise flooded a portion of my house.

Very bright and very cheap, that's the good part.  Very flimsy switch and very flimsy tilting hinge. The hinge is a ratchet, not infinitely adjustable, so you only have a few choices as to the final angle.  Since it's flimsy, it won't easily hold that angle when you move around.  Meh.

Bought this timer to install on the outside lights on the chicken house. It isn't rated for outside use but I haven't had a problem with it yet and it works great. It isn't exposed to direct rain or snow as it's under a overhang but is still outside.

Comes with all of your basic tools all in one folding set. If you are looking for a small basic layout this is a nice inexpensive tool. I have had mine now for some time but would personally spend an extra $20 or $30 to get one with more capabilities.Pros-Basic set of tools-Quality product-Great priceCons-Limited number of tools

I like the feel of this sander, and my large hands have no problem with its proportions. The variable speed is nice.Durability is a major weakness. It ate its plastic brake after one cabinet job, and in the process destroyed the backing pad. I thought that would perhaps be tolerable, but after another short period it stopped working altogether. I'm very disappointed.I wonder how many tool manufacturers are making their products with real work in mind. If you do only a little sanding on occasion you're probably happy with this machine, but I wonder how many people use it for 50+ hours without it failing.

This is my second set of these drill bits.  My wife liked my set so much I decided to order her one too so that I could keep mine.  In one handy roll-up pouch I have the ability to drill holes up to an inch and a half.  I carry my set in my portable drill case and have it with me whenever I'm working on a project.  Good drill bits, nice set.

This item has a great selection of connectors, not perfect, but great. I also like the fact that the crimper fits inside the box of wire connectors so it is not taking up more space in the toolbox. Got to me undamaged and on time. I will remember that. Amazon is the first place to go for solutions like this one.

Revised: I have worked with trial and error to get the wheels better balanced (as they should have been from the manufacturer).The vibration out of the box was extensive. It now runs, what I would call, smooth enough. No major vibration spinning up, down or at full speed.It's not at all the bright yellow that is the usual Dewalt but a faded muted color.Other issues to resolve. The tool rests are a little out of whack, crooked in double axis, so for now, there won't be any "precision grinding" just lawn mower blades and such. The left black wheel guard is considerably bent/torqued which is making that side tool rest even more out of whack. Plenty of fixing over time, but sending it back to get another is equally a hassle. At least I know the shortcomings on this one and can hopefully resolve and improve the tool's usability.I just couldn't imagine paying full retail for this product with all the lack of detail in fit and finish. Dewalt, you need to up your game on this product. I've purchased other tools in this price range and even below which I would call exceptional, this one is not.
summary: Terribly out of balance to start with ...

reviewText: This tool is definately well thought out and well built. I replaced a Porter Cable Biscuit Joiner with this Makita and very glad I did. I like holding and pushing from the center of the machine instead of the very back as with the Porter Cable. Makita gives you a more balance control with the cut. Another Makita Great!!
Over all I was happy with these lamps but one died within a year and now a second died (within two years). I will be replacing all three at this point.
summary: 2 our of three have failed in 2 years of use.

reviewText: I wanted to take a moment and talk about the lock but more importantly since many reviews exist I wanted to share my experience with installation. When I received my first lock it did not work. When the motor engaged the deadbolt never turned so I assumed I received a defective unit and as always amazon.com was right there to replace the item with no delay. Much to my surprise and a little dismay the second lock I received did exactly the same thing so I thought to myself....maybe I'm juts doing it wrong. So first of all the lock looks sleek and when it works its exceptional and if I hadn't had this issue on installation I would have given the device 5 stars, which I will give to their support people.I decided after my second lock and subsequent failure of said lock I'd call the install help hotline and I spoke to a very nice agent (Christi I think her name was) who when hearing the lock knew exactly what the issue was and how to fix it and told me if I didnt mind to do a few steps she'd have me working in 10 to 15 minutes. A promise she kept quite well I might add. So I'm here to share with you what was wrong and how to fix it if you receive one of these issues.The Problem:The Agent told me during the first production run of this lock or so they found that one of two items was simply not pressed into place well enough as it had been done my hand and is now done my machine. So either the circuit board or the motor underneath it (in my case it was the motor) were not tightly into position.Tools required for the fix:A simple fillips-head screw driver.A good thumb for pressingYou time...about 15 minutes worth.The fix:I will put photos up in the product page (See Link Below) to go along with my fix instructions.http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/product-gallery/B00AGK9KOGStart by laying the inside housing face up with the lock handle down and removing the batteries. Then remove the 3 screws (two on the bottom and one in the middle) . Once the screws are out the circuit board assembly as a unit easily comes out. Hold the circuit board assembly with the board facing up and from right to left gently push the 4 clips (see pictures as the fourth is in the middle and not along the bottom edge) and swing the circuit board like you would opening a door. You will not need to disconnect the wiring harness. Once done simple push the motor (seep pictures) with your finger and you will most likely here and feel it click into place. Take a moment to manual turn the motor until the center gear (with the notch) is in the correct horizontal position with the notch up (see pictures). Once complete reverse the process of dis-assembly by swinging the circuit board closed and pushing the clips in left to right. Ensure the board is securely installed. Re-install the unit in the metal housing ensuring the notch is also facing up (see pictures). Insert the screws and reattach the device to the door.A reset is recommended once you have completed this. To reset the lock simply hold the Schlage Logo on the keypad while reconnecting the battery pack. you will know the reset is complete when the unit flashes the green check-mark twice on the keypad as well as inside the red alarm button will flash. Now you are ready to use the lock and you won't need to return it.I hope this helps anyone who receives a lock with this issue.
summary: Here is how you fix this lock if it does not work on arrival.

reviewText: We installed this Rubbermaid FastTrack system last night. It took about an hour to locate and mark the studs, drill pilot holes, insert wall anchors, and screw everything to the wall. This is a two-person job, so get someone to help you do all this and it will go smoothly. The one hiccup we had was working with the hollow wall anchors. They were VERY stiff and incredibly hard to insert into the drilled pilot holes. I ended up using a pair of pliers to loose them up and that helped some.I ended up purchasing all of FastTrack equipment at Home Depot because I wasn't sure what hooks I needed. Looking online it's hard to know what you're going to need, so let me tell you what tools I have in my garage and what hooks I ended up buying for them.In my garage I needed to organize the following 10 tools:- (Qty 3) shovels- (Qty 1) scoop shovel- (Qty 1) snow shovel- (Qty 1) garden hoe- (Qty 1) garden rake- (Qty 1) bush/shrub rake- (Qty 1) outdoor broom- (Qty 1) push broomOn my 84-inch FastTrack I ended up using the following hooks:- (Qty 2) Rubbermaid 5E13 FastTrack S Hook Long Handle Tool RackThis was great for the brooms, garden rake, and garden hoe. Any lighter weight tool is a great with this tool rack.- (Qty 3) Rubbermaid 1784455 FastTrack Compact Hanging HookUsed these with my shovels. Holds them very securely.- (Qty 2) Rubbermaid 1784456 Fast Track Cooler HookFor the larger scoop shovel this hook was perfect. I also used one for my shrub rake.- (Qty 1) Rubbermaid 5E11 FastTrack Multi-Purpose HookPerfect for my large snow shovel.The FastTrack and the FastTrack Hooks are good quality and I'm really happy with how easy it install and how easy it was to move hooks around and get everything coordinated and organized. The system also looks great in my garage.
summary: Professional looking upgrade to your garage

reviewText: Value dense multi-tool!Will keep this simple, as there is nothing that I can say that hasn't been said before.  One thing to note though is that as said initially, this is a value dense tool.  What is meant by that is that you are getting far more bang for the buck dollar for dollar, and the product offers a lot at that price point as well.This could easily cost $10-20 more and it would still be worth it.  The blade is wicked, the scissors work fine.  The drivers do a good job, while the nail file was pretty good.  Also the wire stripper works wonders as well.  All in all well worth the money!

they are what you pay for but do a good job.  Don't expect to drill heavy steel but for use in theses new low voltage screwdrivers that are perfect.  You now those 4.4 or 7.2 volts screwdrivers that have swelled the market.  This is what I bought this set for because of the hex shank that theses new drivers use.

I bought these blades in December, 2006, and have used them on hardwood and pressure treated decking.  They give a smooth cut with little or no tear-out, but they do deflect a little.  I would definitely recommend them though, as the cut is really clean.  I can't figure out why amazon raised their price to above what the retail big-box stores carry these for, makes no sense to me.  Amazon's price went to double what I paid just 6 months ago at amazon, yet the Marketplace sellers still have it at half the price.  The India-based customer service reps were of no help when I asked about the price change.
summary: Great product, but price is odd

reviewText: I'm sure this is excellent for cutting wood and doing lumberjack stuff and I used it for that sort of thing. You know, just to say that I did. But I was mostly looking for some fashion forward sort of head gear and this really called to me. It's sort of construction worker, meets fireplace screen meets runway guy with those funny flashlights. Yes! So comfortable I like to wear it on the bus and while driving around town.

I just received it today. It looks like it's made well and it has directions showing how to use it. It seem like it's a really good starter kit. On the directions it has a bar code you can scan and it takes you to their site and it gives you more info and if you want to get more parts or products to add to this kit you can buy them.

For clamping nothing can beat the metal C shaped clamps that you manually screw down for some hard core clamp force!  Plus, I've never had any of the old fashioned C clamps break.  These newer types of clamps have their use in the work place as well.  There is a larger range of size & they are quicker to use.  The down fall is they are cumbersome to store & have plastic parts that will eventually fail.  If you need amazing clamping force, these simply cannot provide it.  The attachments that I think of as an extra pair of hands are very useful once you get the hang of it.  The problem is you need at least 2 sets of clamps to be able to take full advantage of this feature.My husband will gladly take any clamp he can get his hands on & is thrilled to have these in the barn.  I however prefer to use the metal C clamps.  They are easy for me to transport, I can even fit them in my pocket.  They provide an amazing amount of force that can't be beat.At my old job, we had the option of C clamps or these types of "one handed clamps".  Every single employee always chose the metal C clamps over these plastic/metal one handed clamps.Overall all clamps are useful & worth having.  If you need an extra pair of hands, don't want to own lots of different sizes of C clamps, or don't need monster force you will love having a pair or two of these Cresecent clamps in your workshop!  They do the job & they do it well.

I've built 3 or 4 different coping sleds over the years, and purchased a few as well, and none is as complete as this. I like the bulk and solidity of it's build. It's styled a little different than most and has a few other quirks in design that take a bit to get used to, but once you're accustomed to them, it's a solid, smooth, quick way to cut raised panel ends, or any other coping you make have need of.
not as heat resistant as I would have liked. I used it to attach hey USB hub to my desktop case. It did not hold the hub cell off within a few days. So who knows, i was not satisfied
Works great and no false detection of studs.Very powerful little magnets grab onto nail heads and stay there so you can grab a pencil to mark the spot.I love the fact i don't need batteries!

I purchased this to replace a medical penlight that had broken.  Once I received it, the package had a warning on the back that said...Warning: Class 2 LED Radiation, Avoid Eye Exposure.That ruled out using it for the nose and eyes of my children, which is why I purchased the light in the first place.  I had to ship it back and purchase a different light.I wish someone had mentioned that in the product description.  It is a very bright light and would be useful for other things where eye injury would not result.
summary: Product Warning says to AVOID EYE EXPOSURE

reviewText: Love this cutter ! Classic look but double the force due to compound design. Use it for many jobs , like cutting thick wire and even small diameter bolts and screws. I have a heavy-duty chain-cutter but I always try this tool first for small jobs since it's easy to handle and carry.
summary: Where other cutters fail.... this cutter excels !

reviewText: March 2006.  I have a small shop and needed to replace a small Craftsman table saw.  I wanted a cast iron top for the stability.  After looking at many saws and many different prices, I came across the TS350 at Lowes for $399,99.  I compared this to Amazon and discovered I could get it for #268.99 with the discounts being offered plus no shippoing and no tax.  Lowes refused to match the price although they had a big sign saying that they would.  I was pleased to be able to get a smaller table top.  My needs were for making small items and I dont plan to be in a commercial business of ripping large pieces of wood.  I did read the complaints about the small table top and wondered why anyone who wanted a large top would buy a smaller saw and then complain ablut it.  I read the directions through before assembly and had no problems with the assembly.  I was up and running in a very short time.  Read the directions and look at the pictures and you should have no problems.  If you cant assemble this saw from the instructions, you probably shouldnt be allowed to play with tools.  My only complaint is that it is pretty heavy and I got some help to set it upright when I was through with assembling the base and putting on the dust collector, but thats a good thing I think.  Very stable and a solid table saw for a small shop.  I was prepared to pay as much as 4 times the price I paid for this unit and am very pleased at getting a quality and very stable saw with a cast iron top  and a smaller footprint in my smaller shop.  It is a direct drive and not a pully drive so I dont know how that will effect me in the long run but there is nothing sticking out the back to bump into so I am glad about that so far.March 2007.  I wrote the original review in March of 2006 and so  have had this saw for a year.  I can agree with some others that there should be some sort of way to stop the blade when the saw is turned off.  It is extremely quiet and the blade continues to spin for quite a while.  I guess on a belt drive there is much drag and on the direct drive there is little.  I have had no problems with the power or the adjustments.  I do fumble around looking for the Off On switch.  I know its there somewhere.  I even took a magic marker and marked the table top where to find it but the mark soon rubbed off of the table top... If I could only make two recommendations, it would be to put a blade brake on the saw and put the power switch in an easier to spot to see or find, or to mark the top in some way as to let you know where to find it.  I know its there but still find that I back up a step and look to find it.  The plastic handles work fine but I dont like them.  When I come across a set of metal ones I will replace the flimsy feeling adjustment handles.  With that said, I still would buy it again.  It has performed well.
very nice hose 100 times lighter than standard rubber hoses, I'll only own these polurethane air hoses in the future, also extremely durable

I love this helmet.  At first I thought it wouldn't be used much but I tell you once you have this puppy on and a big "twannng" sound happens and a chunk of wood bounces off the screen (instead of your face) you smile and are grateful you have this puppy on your dome piece.  The ear protection is solid and overall the construction is comfortable to wear.The only two negative (and they are slight) points I have is 1) Assembly is a bit tricky to snap everything together but you will figure it out and 2) The helmet size adjuster is a snap together type instead of a knob.  Could be a pain if you are constantly changing the size.  Other than those two basic points I love this helmet.
They worked well and triggered with 3 degrees of when they were supposed to, I didn't have a single problem with them and would recommend them to anyone

I just wanted a simple basic weather station to monitor indoor and outdoor temperatures and this little guy does just the trick! Simple to use and setup, the only negative point is that the display is a bit hard to read... Not a huge deal but you have to be close to the station to really be able to read in details. I kinda wish the backlit display could be turned on and stay on (auto-off after 5 seconds), hence the four stars...I like that the batter life is phenomenal! I think I only have to change the batteries once every 6-8 months!

this is the best disposal system. its super quiet. it is a very heavy disposer but that is because its not some cheap junk that will break on you. it runs smooth and grinds fast. the baffle collar does make the water go down slower than what we had but it is what helps keep the sound down, and its easy to remove to clean and clean in the cavity of the disposal too. I would recommend this to anyone who wants hassle free disposal of food waste.

I'm ashamed to admit that I've never lived in a place where I've had anything accessible in case a fire happened to start. After moving into a new construction home and seeing these pop-up in various searches of home related products I felt that it was no longer worth the gamble.I ordered a total of 4 cans and I am pleased to report that they all arrived well packaged and intact. I might test one out as it was an extra just to verify it works as I hoped and I am able to handle it without an issue. The video review that was helpfully posted previously does not give me any indication that I would have an issue.
summary: I hope I never need it!

reviewText: I just finished a very long session with the Makita: more than 250 hard maple planks that I'm milling into flooring. I'm very satisfied. The saw is very well designed, the action is smooth, and the fences were set up accurate right out of the box. I traded up from a Dewalt 12-inch (non-sliding). With the non-sliding saw, I'd have to flip wide boards and clean them up later with the table saw. With the Makita, I can cross-cut 12-inch wide planks, no table saw necessary. The trigger lock mechanism takes some getting used to, but once you've used it awhile, you get the hang of it. My only real complaint is that the saw could use a more powerful motor (how about a 15-amp like the 12-inch).
summary: Great Tool, But Could Use More Power

reviewText: I got these to stock a homemade first aid/medical kit. They are perfect for easy quick use in an emergency.

The tool is well made and will make your project go a little more smoothly. I was on Ron Hazelton's web site looking for information on my current project. His site is great, here is a link[...].  I was making two book cases and Ron used this tool in his demonstration and I decided to purchase. Amazon had the best price and I know their service and customer care is great. Well worth the money.

These flattened bits at first look incredibly silly and impractical, but after using them they prove themselves to be an extremely clever design, one that allows you to carry 40 bits around in a flat belt pouch.I have used all the bits in this kit, and can say without fear of contradiction that every bit performs as well as the more traditionally-shaped screwdrivers, Allen wrenches and torx drivers they stand-in for. I had already discovered that the flat Phillips-head bit provided a much more positive grip on a screw than my Swiss Army Knife's Phillips driver (and now use the Leatherman Wave for Phillips screws in preference to a traditional driver) but I was astounded that the larger flat Allen wrenches that are machined away so much that they are essentially just two opposed points could be so fit for purpose.The only fly in the ointment is the reversible miniature screwdriver bit (you get a spare in this kit for the one you may have broken or bent) which I've never found to be much use. The bite on a miniature fastener is simply not good in my experience, and the tool holder is often too big to allow me to use the bit.But this kit is an essential part of my belt toolage. I've fixed chairs and cube walls with these bits. I've stripped out a server rack with them. I've built a swimming pool filter with them.Highly recommended by this satisfied user.
summary: A Clever Idea Makes a Comprehensive Portable Bit Set Practical

reviewText: I bought this particular version of Hipe's Auto Motion sensing Night lights since the description said it stayed on for 30 seconds after the last motion was sensed (the other one says 10 seconds).  That is incorrect.  I just received this product and tested it - it only lasts for 5 seconds.  The light output is not bad - I would not call it super bright but for a night light its pretty good.  The Velcro strip provided is just about an inch in length and I have my doubts about whether it would hold up with 4 AA batteries installed and installed overhead (where I plan to install it), but since I have my own rolls of Velcro tape that is not an issue.After installing it overhead, I would NOT recommend that you attach Velcro to the battery cover (what seems to be the most logical placement since it is smack dab in the middle of the back) - the battery cover comes off quite easily without much pressure.  I initially placed two strips to fit into the battery cover and when testing to see what weight/pressure they would withstand, when tried pulling the unit from the Velcro, the unit came off quite easily with the battery cover stuck to the Velcro.  So I added two more Velcro strips above and below the battery cover.I have since replaced this with a Mr. Beams MB980 ceiling light, which not only lasts longer (30 seconds) but produces more light (100 lumens vs I would estimate 10-20 lumens, but then it uses 4 C batteries vs AA batteries in the Hipe).  I have repositioned the Hipe as a Hallway light and there it does quite well.  For walking in the Hallway, 5 seconds is ideal.  In addition the Hipe has a fairly long range in its sensor - a good 20 ft compared to 10-15 ft in other motion sensing battery powered lights I have tried.
summary: Only stays on for 5 seconds after last motion is sensed

reviewText: I can't speak to the battery life on this unit, but for the money this is the best little flashlight/battery/charger combination out there. I heard a few complaints about these China import Cree LED lights, but I have a dozen of them and they all perform perfectly.  The Fenix lights are thrown out as better quality, but they are also made in China, only cost 5-6x as much.  The domestic version are even higher cost.  I would only have been able to buy 1 of those for the money I spent on a dozen of these.  Also if I loose one or break it, I'm not out a small fortune.
summary: Best value Cree LED lights out there.

reviewText: Pros:Can plug into a USB port to light a laptop keyboard, or it's battery powered base for other uses.Provides a good amount of light to see to read, do bead work and other close work or remove splinters.Is light weight and portable, great for travel.Flexible neck allows you to put the light where you need it.Cons:Mine only has 15 working LED lights, one was dead on arrival, otherwise I'd have given it 5 stars.Neck length. A couple inches longer would make it more serviceable for other applications.Evaluation:A great little light that is portable, travel friendly and offers 2 different power options (USB or battery).I give it 2 thumbs up and would recommend this item to others.
summary: Great for lighting a laptop keyboard

reviewText: Nice little drill. Compact and the price was great. Use these all the time. They work well in my line of work.

First the pros: Lightweight, reversible, seems to have a good solid chuck, comes with a straight/slotted driver bit.Cons: Not variable speed, doesn't have enough power to drive a 1-1/4 inch screw into pine, even with a fresh charge. This is a big disappointment. I bought it at WM and can't find the receipt or I would return it.Did some research on Li ion batteries and learned they are only good for 2 - 3 years whether you use them or not. That includes time on the shelf before buying. Holding a charge for 18 months is nice, but once you've done that twice the batteries will no longer take a charge.
summary: Not variable speed, not enough power

reviewText: I purchased the Li2000 for general use around the house. I was mainly interseted in the small size and the Lithum Ion battery power. The spindle lock is a great idea as you can apply that little extra feel when running screws without fear of stripping. The three positions are great for tight spots (assembled a computer desk) and lock into position. I gave it four stars as the foward reverse switch is a little awkard to operate. Overall this is a great little screw driver and gave reasonable run time before recharging.
Had been having trouble for a while with the old Ni-Cd batteriesand had been nursing them along.  Sorry now I waited so long.Great batteries and charger. Fast, long-lasting.  Great.
summary: Why did I wait so long?

reviewText: I was quite surprised to see Milwaukee introduce this tool.Particularly because in their drill line up, few new items have hit the pike lately and Milwaukee really is not known for their screw guns. However, that may change with this new product. Frankly, I think that Milwaukee builds the best drill motor out there, but traditionally, I have never thought that their drills are comfortable or well balanced to use all day. This new pitol grip changes that considerably. The new grip is small enough for most hands to feel that they can control it even if your body position is not ideal. The Quick-LocK cord is really a nice feature ( if you wear out, cutor nick the cord - it can be replaced with no tools or housing disassembly ), the trigger is of good quality, the reversing switch can be toggled easily while one-handing the screw gun and has no sharp eges, and the 0-2500 rpm speed range is acceptable for many fastening applications, including self drilling/ TEK type screws into metal. This kit is a new offering so durability is not proven, but Milwaukee's reputation should alleviate most concerns. This kit is appropriately named a Remodeler's kit that will come in handy for a variety of applications on the job or around the house. It is very comfortable, well made, comes standard with a variety of bits and sockets all in Milwaukee's standard metal case. I give it five because I believe the tool will endure years of projects and I think Milwaukee broke some new ground here, look for others to follow.
summary: Super tool to have in hand

reviewText: I bought two of these bulbs to put in my garage door opener. It has a motion detector that makes the lights turn on every time I walk into the garage day or night.  So now I don't concern myself if the lights come on anymore.  I did have two 60 Watt incandescent bulbs in the garage door opener.  So the 120 Watts has been reduced to 14 Watts with generally the same illumination. I would not say the illumination is the same, however. It is a little difficult to compare because the incandescent bulbs were yellow and these LED bulbs are white light.  The LED lights are somewhat more directional, but still surprisingly broad disperse lighting. The bulbs in my garage door opener face opposite directions, so that helps a lot to make my garage lighting quite uniform. The lighting looks soft, not so bright - sort of a dim white.  For my application, they worked just fine. I am very pleased to have economical lighting in my garage door opener now. I have an over-sized two car garage and these two bulbs easily illuminate the garage well enough to walk around.  But if I want bright lighting, then I turn on the two pairs of fluorescent bulbs mounted on the ceiling(four 40 Watt bulbs).
summary: Very Good Daylight LED Light Bulb - Economical 7 Watts

reviewText: works as advertised!I wish Dewalt would make adapters for other batteries to fit this charger that I would not have to have  5 different chargers.​

I like it. Does what it's supposed do, make some unexpected noise. I love it, I actually bought several. Even if it doesn't scare someone away it let's me know something or someone is outside my door or in my space.

I bought one of these to get into tight spots. However the gear box is so large, it is no better at getting into tight areas than a regular hand drill. I've had for it 3+ years now and while I've attempted to use it several times, in the beginning because I thought it might work and of late, in hopes of justifying its purchase. I've not found an application where it helped. It's just too bulky. There are far less expensive alternatives on the market that are more useful. I now have one of them too. If you want one of these, I bet you can find a used one real cheap, in perfect, unused condition, at a pawn shop near you.
summary: Another Tool looking for an Application

reviewText: My 12 year-old daughter and I have been pleased with this product.  Although all LEDs initially come on with the same color, then they cycle a through a few colors at the same together, they soon change to different colors independently.  This is not a problem for me, but if you are expecting them always to be the same color at the same time, you will will be disappointed.  Also, the flow rate is lower than with my previous head (WaterPik).  But all in all, the fun to price ratio is good.Update: 02/10/2014...the light is failing now, and only illuminating when the pressure is high.

I bought it expecting that I can use it fo guide my work and I think it works for that.The problem is that the first numbers and marks are fuzzy, or they doesn't appear marked, so I can't use the rule it for 2 or 3 inches.. It will work only for bigger pieces.I'm really disapointed.

I bought a spyderco sharpmaker about a year ago and have tried to use it to sharpen knives, mostly pocket knives, but I never felt that I got any knife really sharp with it. Maybe because it required the knife to be held perfectly vertically to the angle stone? The MagnaGuide system finally does away with any uncertainty about how to hold the knife and stone, because it sets the angle for you. And I finally got REALLY sharp edges on my pocket knives. I only wish that it felt a little more durable, but so far it is holding up and I am very pleased with the results.

I loved this flashlight when I first got it.  But after the twist on/off did both in my pocket I'd either have a flashlight on constantly or I'd go to get change out of  my pocket and come up with a small handful of button batteries.  If it had a click-switch I'd probably still be loving it.
Mediocre at best. Very light duty and will wear out fast. I think I will replace it with the Work Sharp WS3000 Wood Tool Sharpener in the near future.B000PVHIMW

These are great for sanding/working on the house to make sure you don't breath in any particulates. It's fairly comfortable to wear and seems to have a good seal, though I agree with some of the other reviewers that if it's hot out, and you're sweating, the seal starts to loosen a bit. Overall though, it's a good product.
It's exactly what it says it is, which is JT-21 staples. And that's what I needed :) I like that size for stretching watercolor paper.
Fit my cordless lithium makita flash light that came with the impact driver, drill combo.  What can I say it's a bulb to replace the one that burned out.

This little bugger is very bright and only uses 1 AA battery. Small in size big on light and the sturdy clip comes in handy. I used it for quite a while before it required a new battery. It is made of metal and is a quality product. I would recommend it to someone that wants a bright portable light that can be stored in a small place.
summary: Small in size, Big on light

reviewText: I bought one of these a year ago. It was very sturdy and worked well. This one feels cheap in your hand and is not as nice.
Just as advertised no surprises.  I will be buying from them again in the future I think. Thanks for the honest and great service.

I'm constantly getting myself into DIY projects, and I picked up this sander to help in stripping my front door. I've used more traditional belt sanders in the past, and if needed a quality belt sander for daily use, this would not be the tool I'd select.  However, I expect to ues the tool a few times a year, and the unique belt path on this model is really nice for use in tight spaces. So for me, given my light usage, the ability to get into tighter spaces, and the low price point, this was a good buy.
summary: Not a bad tool for DIY

reviewText: The PSI Mini Turning Wood Lathe 5 piece Chisel Turning Set were sent in excellent condition, as was the packaging.  I've yet to use them, but I foresee them turning all woods with no problems.  Friends that bought this set, said they were outstanding turning chisels.  I'll let you know how they work as soon as I use them.  My first project will be a chess set.Thanks you PSI for sending them in a timely manner and perfect packing.  And thank you to Amazon for backing up PSI's tools.
summary: PSI Mini 5-Piece HSS Wood Lathe Chisel Turning Set

reviewText: I purchased these after I was able to find gloves that would fit me. Their sizing guide is great and they fit like a..... a well fitting glove. They were comfortable and moved well. I wore them as winter gloves and they breath far too much so my hands are freezing in them. The good news is that I have a great pear of work gloves for the summer, the bad is that I still don't have good winter work gloves or just normal winter gloves.
summary: Not very warm which might be OK in the summer.

reviewText: These bulbs are a bit brighter than the 25 watt bulbs that they replaced.  I purchased four of these from Amazon (first one to confirm it fits, and then 3 more to fill up the lamp).  The color is whiter/cleaner than the traditional old bulbs that I had.  I now burn only 8 watts instead of 100... so I don't have to be angered when my wife leaves the lights on for hours at a time, even when exited from the room/house.  I like these a lot and they will easily pay for themselves within a year or two.

I put some Gladiator tracks on my garage walls, which I love.  But, they looked a bit 'rough' on the edges.  These end caps are not cheap, but you need them to really square away the appearance of your geartracks.  So, I coughed up the dough to get everything squared away.They do take away about a little bit of track on the ends, and they can not be used if you have your geartracks stacked on top of one another.
summary: Pricey - But, Needed To Really Square Away Appearances

reviewText: Very easy to use and little clean up required. It makes it much easier and quicker to desolder all the batteries that I need to in my line of work.
I use these for automotive use to compress my brake calipers. They work well and the rubberized bar helps keep from damage.
Kreg makes some really good products and these bits center and do not move around when drilling.  Great product for cabinet building.
My husband and i were able to install this disposal easily and it does the job at a very good price.

It has a decent bowl gouge, that will work for you bowl/platter needs.  Decent scrappers for fine cuts and clean up.  Parting tool.  The spindle gouge and roughing gouge are ok as well.  The skews are decent but are a little tricky for the beginner to get the hang of.I figured out what I liked from these and then bought higher quality version after I learned a bit.Amazon has the best price on them and free shipping as well.
summary: Great starter set, with most every tool you would use.

reviewText: This does a great job on my patio furniture. Seals well and applies easily. I also like that fact that it doesn't darken or otherwise change the woods color. I had seen that with other oils out there.
summary: Great on my wood patio furniture

reviewText: Fixing a printed circuit board can be a pain when you have to unsolder an electrical component.  You have to get the old solder off the component and the PC board so you can fit the new component into place.  You also want to do it quickly and cleanly so you don't use too much heat and possibly damage the PC board pad.This desoldering braid is ideal as it is pure oxygen free copper and you simply hold it against the PC board solder joint and touch it with your soldering iron.  The heated copper braid wicks the solder into it and out of the component lead hole.  The component can usually easily be lifted out of the hole and off the board.  If you need to you can retouch up the PC board to make sure that the component lead hole is clear of solder for the replacement part.With a roll of this and $12 worth of capacitors I fixed my wife's 46 inch LCD TV that the electronics store wanted $1,000 to repair.  Sorry Geek Squad!  This is a handy tool if you work on electronics or fix computers.  When you need it, it is worth its weight in gold!I highly recommend it!
summary: Best solution for removing bad components from printed circuit boards!

reviewText: this pigtail has light on the ends so it is easy to find in a totally dark place, under our house, and allows us to plug in extension cords to go in 3 different locations.
summary: lights up so easy to find in the dark

reviewText: Works as stated. This tailstock accessory replaces the live centers that tend to wear downrather quickly. I use this for my Pen Turning Mandrels. It does save wear and tear on the mandrelas well and also stiffens the mandrel when turning pen blanks. This is worth every penny and itsPenn State quality.

While I only tested the saws on wood (4x4 for the large saw, 2x4 for the small one), I have to support the assertion that these saws will cut through anything with ease. The teeth are such that only on a pull stroke do you actually cut, which basically makes these an American version of the Japanese saw many might have seen on (Ask) This Old House. The blades are not as thin as some saws I've seen and used, but they are quite flexible. They can be bent to a significant curve to make difficult cuts, but not like a coping saw. Rather, they allow you to access difficult to reach areas but they are not suited for making curved cuts as the blades are not narrow like a coping or hack saw. I'd saw for woodworking the large saw is top notch, while for trouble spots like cutting pipe in a crawl space, the shorter saw will serve more than adequately.

I ordered this lathe for the purpose of making pens. It is used at my second home since my primary home has a very nice Jet mini-lathe. The PSI lathe is considerably bigger, but seems about the same weight as the Jet. The PSI unit is cast iron and seems to work exceptionally well, considering that it was half the cost of the Jet machine. I have two concerns, however: (1) the drive head makes a "clacking" noise that makes me wonder if there is a bad bearing. I haven't had enough run time on it to find out the answer, but I did note that it has a very long warranty (either 2 or 3 years), so I am not going to worry about it very much. The second problem is that the ball-bearing tailstock squeals. I think this is due to the fact that when you turn a pen, it is on a metal mandrel that only contacts the tailstock on the center spur, and the squealing is from the outside ring being "left behind" as it rotates.  I went to Woodcraft and bought a 60-degree cone tailstock which works much better anyway, highly recommended.  The tool rest on this one is much better than the one with the Jet lathe, as the former is nice and smooth whil ethe latter seems very rough and will need a little "tuning" with a file.  Packaging was OK, but was in pretty bad shape by the time UPS got it to my house. Nothing missing, and the equipment itself was in perfect condition. I rated this a 4-star for the ominous noises, but I feel I can honestly say I would buy it again.  I actually like working on it better than the Jet lathe.
summary: Nice product, possible problems ahead though?

reviewText: I had initially looked at the Skylink garage door indicator, but poor reviews made me look a little harder for another alternative.  The LiftMaster is it.  Instead of a magnetic push switch which is used on the Skylink, the LiftMaster uses a gravity switch to indicate the door is open or shut.  Basically, when the sensor goes from vertical to horizontal, it sends a signal to the receiver to illuminate a red blinking light.  We placed the receiver (AC powered) in our bedroom and it receives the door signals (CR2032 battery each) very well (about 200 feet through two walls).  The receiver will not be able to differentiate between two different doors, but all I really need to know is if either is open...I could care less which one.  The receiver comes with one transmitter and is significantly less expensive than it's Skylink competitor.  Additional receivers are also significantly less expensive.  If you have ever left your garage door open all night and woke up to missing bicycles or mowers, then this is the product for you.  My kids are always telling me the status of our garage doors now.  This is a great product.
These flashlights are bright and has so far worked very well.  It's been a few months and no problems.  Would buy again.
This is a better alternative to buying a new lamp but at low settings the light flickers a bit and eventually turns off completely.

I'm a big fan of flashlights that take AA and AAA batteries, so I tried one of these due to the price and I'm very happy with it. I ended up buying some of those high-voltage AA batteries to get the extra brightness and they definitely make a difference, though the batteries I bought (cheap ones here on Amazon) don't seem to hold a charge as long as I'd like. Overall though, for this price, it's a great flashlight and I now own two. Beware, though, I thought I ordered two of the same but they are slightly different in both looks and performance, so there are multiple versions of this same light out there. Regardless, they're bright and pretty darn durable. I have one mounted on my shotgun and one I keep at my bedside as my primary light when things make nose at night. I don't think you can go wrong with this light.

This screwdriver performed flawlessly in the disassembly of a GameBoy Advance and a DS. The metal is obviously not tempered and is therefore not very hard, so I imagine that it would be very easy to damage, but if you turn the screw slowly and carefully the driver should last long enough to get you through the project you bought it for.
summary: Cheaply made, but gets the job done if you're careful.

reviewText: Very nice bulb and perfect fit in my range hood. What a change compared to the standard 50W burning hot bulbs.

I bought one of these early this year for work. I loaded it with 150' of extension cords, 150' of air hose, my skillsaw, framing nailer and all the small items I use every day and I roll it right to my job site, sometimes over rough terrain.It has held up excellently, with not a single shortcoming. The top is well designed and can be used as a portable cut stand, just make a cut table and mount it however you like.This thing is a beast and an excellent investment.EDIT:I've been using this as a cut table and tool storage for over 2 years now and it still works great. Some numnutz did cut through the lid a year ago with a skillsaw, but a little silicone and it was water tight again.The price they're asking these days, $133, is absurd. I think I paid $60 for mine, and I see them at home depot all the time for $80...which they're well worth.

I bought a one of these units (refurbished) a few months ago.  After using it for a while, I'm quite disappointed.  It shipped with two batteries.  One had both battery to tool locking lugs broken off.  Within a few uses, one of the lugs on the other battery disappeared.  The only way I can find to keep the batteries in place is to use tape.  Electricians or masking tape both seem to work but it's a very poor substitute for quality.  Battery charge life is terrible.  It's almost impossible to do any kind of job with one charge.  The tool is dreadfully underpowered and constantly bogs down and stops.  You have to turn it off and on again to get it going.The concept is sound but Bosh should be ashamed for selling such junk.
summary: Poor Battery Attachment/Charge Life, Light Duty

reviewText: Its heavy duty. Yellow Jacket makes great cables overall. I prefer them over Husky and other brands in Home Depot. This is a heavier guage so it allows more current to flow with ease. I would recommend it for a contractor or even for doing projects around the house. You never know how much flow you need when running multiple devices.

My garage only had two single bulb outlets.. very very little light for 440sq ft'.I purchased two of these and then went and got 23watt CFL's 5k.  I now have roughly 12,000+ lumens in my garage...This was JUST the perfect thing that I didn't have to install new fixtures or call an electrician to wire up more lights.These felt very solid to me.. there is another product on Amazon and people complain about it feeling cheap and or not working.All 4 sockets work with mine and there is some weight to these.  Make sure your fixture can handle the weight of this plus 4 bulbs..Overall this has transformed my garage from something that you could hardly see to something that looks like the sun is above your head...  EXCELLENT!!A+ on these.  I will try and edit this with a review a couple months with some pictures of my setup.-Nigel
summary: Excellent!  Light where you need it!

reviewText: I purchased 4 of these for use in my electronics work shop for parts storage bins.  And for this purpose they are perfect.  The clear covers are nice as you can clearly see what's inside and it keeps dust and debris out of the bins.  Construction is heavy plastic, with a very sturdy "feel" to it.  Nicely balanced handle on top should you wish to use them in a "move around" kind of way instead of on the wall.  Very good unit - would most definitely recommend and would buy again.
summary: Exactly as described and well made

reviewText: I bought this set when it was a gold box deal price. At the regular price, it may be cheaper to buy the tools separately since they do not come with that many accessories in the kit but they come with a lot when bought separability. The tools themselves are great and very useful. The build quality is what to be expected from the name brand Dremel.
summary: great tools, not so good price

reviewText: 280 lumens.... checkbright as hell... checkonly thing i can even come up with that is less than desirable is the color... id perfer black
summary: friggin bright, and alot smaller than i thought.

reviewText: They snapped right onto the 16.4Ft 5m 3528 LED PINK 300LEDs/pc Non-Waterproof(IP-44) Flexible Strip and worked great. The wires were easy to solder and redesign for a custom install.
summary: Connectors worked great as they were designed to,

reviewText: I bought this tote to transport and hold all the items I use in cosmetology school:  mannequin heads, hair dryer, and multiple small items like clips, combs, etc.  It's great for that purpose - small items go in the top toolbox area, and the larger stuff goes in the bottom.  However, I would be afraid to use this tote for tools.  All the items I carry are lightweight so it works for me, but I shudder to think what would happen if I swapped hairbrushes and curlers for wrenches and hammers.  I really don't think it would stand up to that kind of use, unless perhaps you kept it stationary, which of course defeats the entire whole purpose of a wheeled tote.  The plastic it's made of is very lightweight, the clasps are functional but flimsy, and the bottom door goes off its track frequently.  If you're looking for a wheeled tote to transport heavy tools to a job site and back, I don't think this particular tote will suit your needs.  If you want to carry lightweight items like crafting supplies or mannequin heads, however, this works nicely.
summary: Handy tote, but probably not for tools

reviewText: Don't seem to hold the charge as long as some other batteries I own only get a few hours on a charge.
I love this item specifically because I no longer have to haul out 600' of electrical cord to use it on my property. Hooray no more long cords.Every tool is top quality

Well over a year ago, I purchased the HiPurformer kit that is overpriced at $100.  At the cost of the glue tubes, they should give you the gun.  Anyway, I needed some kind of super glue and this seemed like it was it.  The glue does work and is excellent for trim where you really can't screw or nail or air nail.  Problem is, the gun no longer feeds.  I read reviews about this before I bought this kit - the feed mechanism breaks and then the whole thing is useless.  The guy at the Woodcraft store where I bought my kit said that two had been returned for this problem.  Nevertheless, I bought the kit and it worked well and I didn't force the plunger.  A year later, it doesn't feed.  The plunger works okay, nothing looks broken, but the glue doesn't flow no matter how long I let it heat up.  I sent an email to the company for help but they didn't reply.  So, in reality, it cost me about $25 per tube rather than the 6 to $8 they charge for it.  Good idea, poor execution.  Go for it if you don't mind throwing the whole thing away after you use it.

This is a Great flashlight that is small and compact but offer a great amount of light. First, this flashlight comes in a black box that is great for storage. It's power requirements are met with 2 AA batteries and it runs for 2 plus hours. This is an LED flashlight that has 121 lumens and is able to light a large area. It is really impressive for it's small size, less than 7 inches. The body of the flashlight lights so that you can adjust the beam to focus or flood. I use the flood a lot more as it lights a bigger area. The flashlight is beyond sturdy as it is water resistant and Impact resistant. thi is my second go-to-flashlight. The other one is also and LED. I just love the capabilities and white light of LEDs.

Without a doubt the best safety glasses I ever bought.  In addition to being a nice looking (secondary when wearing safety glasses), this pair is ultra-comfortable. When absorbed by my favorite pastime, namely landscaping, whether trimming lawn edges, felling and cutting up trees, theses glasses do not fog up, nor does dirt get on the inside of the glasses as a result of the foam lining encircling the lenses.  In comparison to a considerable collection of previously worn safety glasses, these win top prize hands down.  All the more, given a more than respectable price.  This pair makes wearing safety glasses a joy rather than a must.
summary: Makes wearing safety glasses a pleasure rather than a must!

reviewText: i was having a tough time getting this to work. I learned to press the button and then wait about 2 seconds for it to work. I could not get it programmed until i had more patience. If you are programing the remote press the button and wait 2 seconds before pressing it again in the learn mode of your garage opener!!

This is a well-made utility knife.  The auto-loading squeeze handle snaps the blade out firmly, and the release button retracts the blade into the knife housing.  The knife is well-constructed and should stand up to daily abuse.  The easily-accessed spare blades compartment is also a plus.  There are however two shortcomings - (1) the knife is quite heavy, so if you use the knife a lot it will fatique your hand and arm quicker than other utility knives, and (2) the blade only snaps out all the way, you cannot release the blade just a little bit at all, it is all or nothing at all.
summary: A Tank of a Utility Knife

reviewText: Four Stars due to the gun's plastic casing finishThe Gun's plastic case could be better quality controlled the seams have sharp edges I had to scape them to make it smooth.Received the gun quickly and the case is a nice touch.Plugged it in to check it out and it heated very quickly and the lights work.Trigger power range selection could be better with a more pronounced dent feel could not detect the change in heat selections.Also while Weller is purportedly an American Company the Soldering Gun is made in Mexico not in the USA as stated.I will do a future update on the continuing use and quality.
This works ok but it does not take much to make it slip.  I would use something else to hold the workpiece.

I was riding on a brand new Michelin bike tire got a slice in it big enough for the inner tube to squeeze out and pop... oh joy!  Took off the tire and put a piece of this tape over the slice (on the inside of course), and now the tire is like new again.  This tape is like thick rubber, as good or better than those expensive tire patches in cycling stores, and so far works just fine.  Imagine how many tire patches one can get from a single 30 foot roll of this stuff and for only three clams!
summary: Gotta flat bike tire, no problem...

reviewText: This is no teeny-weeny deal. neither is it cute, if some one wished for one.. It is pretty sturdy, easy to fold , good height and support for the thigh.. very stable.I wished it was slightly smaller, so it can get in to narrow places, however I wouldn't hold it as a reason not to get one...

The LED outpu, 110 lumens beam shines very clear and very brightand shines a long distance, approximately 200 ft plus.The beam is actually clear ~ how very nice to find a light that is1. NOT yellow-sh like the old flashlights2. NOT blue-sh like many LED flashlights3. Doesn't have the dark center like 'mag' lights do.Both DeWalt batteries ~ the 20 volt 1.5 Ah and 20 volt 3.0 Ah Li-ioncan be used with this light-weight flashlight.It's head is pivoted to turn down some or straight up.It has a very rugged metal hook for hanging, that also locks down out of the way.And of course it sits firmly, flat on the battery.This light is all around rugged!I bought the light only, it wasn't in a kit, about two months ago at Lowe's for $50.00 plus tax,and have used it nearly every day, several times a day ~ since.Initially I fully charged a 20 volt 1.5 Ah DeWalt batteryand the light is still bright and shows no signs of needing charged yet.Because of the price, it's best if you can get the light included in a kitor already have other DeWalt cordless tools.It's a wonderful light, but it would be ridiculously expensiveif you didn't already have a DeWalt charger and some Li-ion batteries.I initially thought this light was very expensive and almost didn't buy itsince the light alone cost $50.00.But since I already have the batteries and a charger, I thought I'd try it.And now that I see what an all around great light it is ~even for how expensive it is ~I absolutely love this flashlight and wouldn't want to be with-out it.

I do work every now and again for a family member's rental properties. These are old houses I'm talking about, and every year one or two of them need something big done. This includes removing old grates, vents, porches, ducts, furnaces, light fixtures, hinges, etc. Because of the age of the properties, I've often been forced to fight in tight spaces against corroded screws, latches and fasteners.This DeWalt driver gets into those unconventional spaces and really extracts those old parts and pieces. I don't use this tool all the time, but I've found after only a couple of uses it's well worth me having. I'm guessing it's saved me up to a couple of hours on a recent "octopus" furnace-removal job.Is it worth the price? You probably know already if you need this tool or not. If you don't often run into the kind of situations I describe above, than no worries; however, if you spend a lot more time than necessary dealing with screw removal or insertion, then you'll get a lot out of this driver.P.S. The fact that the thing has its own lights is great.
summary: Solid torque for a lightweight tool

reviewText: Spectracide makes powerful and long lasting insecticides. They are concentrated, easy to mix, and can be applied with a standard sprayer tank. The label says "Where to use: Outdoors." And that pretty much sums it up. Although the label mentions lawns and landscapes, it's more versatile and can be used as a perimeter spray around your house. It will dry and leave a protective coating. It's not the type of thing that will kill insects immediately. But bugs will get it on their feet, and it will get into their system. So if you see ants walking across a dry area where it was sprayed, don't expect them to drop dead on contact. This spray can also be used on lawns and on vegetables if you follow the directions and wait the appropriate stated period before consumption.I can attest to the fact that this works, but I can't say whether it lasts as long as stated, since I'm obligated to review it within 30 days. However, I've used both Spectracide Termite and Carpenter Ant killer as well as their Bug Stop product, both of which last as long as claimed. All of these disrupt the central nervous system of insects, causing death.The others I mentioned use lambda-cyhalothrin. This product uses gamma-cyhalothrin, and the two are different isomers of the same chemical. Since the gamma form is a single stereoisomer that lacks the less active and inactive isomers in the other formulas, it should be effective at lower concentration levels. So I expect that in the long run this will prove to be at least as effective as the other formulas, and if not I will update this review. It's fair to say that when used as a perimeter spray, I haven't had any recurrence of indoor bugs after spraying with any of the formulations.
Works very well and I like the plug-in advantage, never have to worry about replacing the battery. Like it very much.

reviewText: I just switched from my DeWalt 423K to this Makita. The Makita definitely takes off more than the DeWalt. After reading all the non-plunge router reviews I could find, and looking at each model in local stores, several tool features sold me on this unit.  It helps living in a large metropolitan area, as numerous local stores sell professional-grade routers.1. This is the only mid-sized router I could find that is designed to be controllable with one hand, with quick access to the off/on switch using your right thumb.  (If you hold the router in your left hand, the switch won't be in the right place for your thumb.)  This is important to me, because when routing dovetails, I hold a vacuum hose in my left hand, and the router in my right hand, so a two-hands-needed router won't work.2. Router bits stay in the precise center of the base, even when bit depth is adjusted.  This may sound pretty basic, but this is the only (non-plunge) router I could find where this was true.  E.g., in ALL of the units I looked at where height adjusts via the motor assembly screwing into the base, the router bit shaft is hardly ever in the very center after you tighten the motor housing clamp.  While this may not be critical for most router applications, it is whenever using template guides.  E.g., to make dovetail joints or use door hinge templates.3. Router is relatively light and easy to handle.4. Model 5615-21 comes with a well-designed case and a clever built-in removable router base (click on customer photos above).  There is no need to remove the bit from the router - as it is protected from damage while sitting right side up on the base, either with the base in the case, or with the base removed from the case.  The case provides outstanding tool protection and has extra space around the tool for storage.  Model 5615-20 is JUST the router - no case and no router base.Soft-start was not important, although that would have been a nice plus.  In fact, fast stopping of the bit would have been even more useful - i.e., it takes several seconds for the bit to stop after switching the tool to off.I bought this router primarily to use with a Leigh 24" dovetail jig, although it's used for other purposes.  It hasn't been used enough to testify to its longevity, but so far, it's just what the doctor ordered.  The micro-adjusting screw is perfect for doing dovetails or door hinge routing, where you're typically moving the bit in or out, but 1/100" at a time.  As with any well-designed router, you can set it upside down, because nothing sticks out.Owning 5 routers of various types, I can assure you that there is no "perfect" router for all purposes.  For example, I use a 3 hp plunge unit in a large router table - it's soft-start and variable speed, with plenty of power for those super-large panel door cutters, and bit changing needs but ONE wrench from the table top - because the tool's drive shaft can be locked.  This Milwaukee unit needs TWO wrenches (included) to change bits; and while it's amazingly simple to insert or remove bits with the router sitting on a bench, that wouldn't be so if it was under a [router] table.  Besides, it would be underpowered and too high-speed (for large bits).The reviewer whose unit vibrated too much might have had a defective router - mine hardly vibrates at all.  If I sit my router flat on a bench (with no bit), and turn it on and let go, it just hums, doesn't wander at all - and runs smooth as silk, although it's hardly quiet.Since through dovetails need two routers to be set up (for productivity), I'm thinking of buying another one of these...
Just as good as a new oneI have wanted one of this tool for a long time, but didn't want to pay full pricegood alternative

A great product if you know how to use it correctly. Make sure you thoroughly clean an areas where this is going to be applied--use something like denatured alcohol (not paint thinner, as that leaves residue behind.) Also, don't apply it where there will be a lot of friction, i.e. where it will actually rub up against the door or against the window frame. The adhesive and foam aren't really strong enough for that. Use foam just thick enough to fill virtually all of the gap without having it rub up against the other surface.

Either way BE CAREFUL.UPDATE 8-11-11:  I ordered another unit with the assurance from Amazon that I would get the correct item this time.  Sure enough, Amazon was true to it's word.  The new unit is just as pictured.  I plan to add a power cord to the unit so I can plug it in where ever needed.  I have one in the living room out of sight on top of our hutch.
