reviewText: I am so pleased with this item.  It holds 4 paper rolls and a box of tissues which pop up from the top.  If you forego tissues, it will hold five rolls.  It is "skinny" so it fits nicely in my tight bathroom, just to the side of the toilet where it is easily accessed.  This is an attractive piece and very useful.

GE Soft White 3-Way Light Bulbs are perfect for any "three-way" lamp in your household that needs a light bulb that can be adjusted to low, high or very high strength. (That's 50, 200 or 250 watts.)Each bulb lasts just about 1,500 hours--very good!Insert a new light bulb into the socket of the lamp (or whatever needs the light bulb) and screw it in until you feel that the bulb is snug and secure in the socket. Then turn on the lamp or whatever device you're using and--voilà! Your bulb works for the next 1,500 hours. That can be months if you're careful with your energy bill.The bulbs stay fresh for several months at least after you buy them; this is a great feature if you need to stock up on light bulbs for any reason. Obviously, these electric light bulbs must never go near water and or any other liquid. Dispose of them carefully so that any glass won't break and hurt anyone if they walk around barefoot in the house. If you have any additional questions, you should be able to go to the GE website for information or a way to contact the company directly.Just one thing: please remember, these are regular, incandescent light bulbs. They are not energy saving compact fluorescent light bulbs. If you need a CFL light bulb this is not it; you will have to keep looking--sorry!Overall, these "three-way" 50/200/250 watt light bulbs by GE fit the bill very nicely even if they don't truly have a "medium light" capacity. They are economical, easy to install and remove and they stay "fresh" for months after you purchase them. They take up very little room in any closet while you're waiting to use them, too.I highly recommend these light bulbs for any lamp or light fixture that uses bulbs of three strengths.
summary: good light bulbs for three way light fixtures

reviewText: I wasn't sure about a plastic hand truck, but it's as strong as any light duty steel cart I've ever used. Moved a few hundred pounds of machinery down stairs without issue thanks to the stair climbers. Rolls well on grass and gravel. It's a little difficult to convert from the vertical to horizontal configuration, but pounding on it with your fists a few times should do the job. Only complaint is the smell. Had to let it air out in the garage for a week or two, but whatever.

I used these bulbs to replace in our Malibu garden landscape lights and they work great.  The light is crisp and clean and bright.  Our garden looks beautiful.  I am very happy with the purchase and the the price is fantastic.
summary: Great Replacement for our Malibu Garden Landscape lights

reviewText: For 12 volts, this unit has plenty of power. As long as you are not looking to use this for something that requires a commercial application, these are great. I use these for securing dock hardware or other DIY products. The set was purchased on sale and even came with a third battery. They are a convenient size, and fairly lightweight. They fit nicely into an AWP tool belt I bought at Lowe's. They also come with a belt clip, so if you don't have a third hand, you can secure to you waistband or back pocket. People often ask if they can borrow them. The impact drill makes projects effortless, a little loud, but it sounds like you really know what you are doing :) I would definitely purchase again.

This screwdriver works great. Because of the gyroscope, there's no switch to determine the direction of spin. But it works great for all uses. There are no bits included, but you can use any 2" or larger bit with a hex end. Build quality is excellent, similar to the typical Dewalt power tool quality. There are two LED lights at the front near the chuck that illuminate your task. Torque is also adjustable.Switching from the upright to a straight long tool is easy too. Press the two unlock buttons at the top, and turn the handle counter-clockwise. It only goes in one direction and locks into place.The unit comes in a nice bag, sized about 11" W x 9" D x 3" H.  It's a medium-duty bag, with a single storage area, zippered, and no other pockets.  The battery charger base is 5" W x 4" D x 1.75" H. The cord for the charger is 6 feet long. The screwdriver dimensions are 7" front to back, 4.5" tall, and 1.5" wide.Two batteries are included (DCB080 Type 1 8V Battery Pack).  They charged in less than 45 minutes. You can keep the battery in the charger or in the screwdriver.  There is a lock switch under the trigger to keep the screwdriver from turning on accidentally. The lock switch is good, but I think it can be improved by making it slightly easier to lock into place.Setting and removing bits is easy. Push bits in and they lock in place. Pull the chuck forward to release the bit and pull the bit and release the chuck.  Preferably you want to use 2" bits and longer. You can use 1" bits, but they barely stick out of the chuck. They still work, but use the 2" bits instead. Any bit with a hex end can be used.To use the screwdriver, hold it in its initial position, press the trigger, and within two seconds after the LED ready lights on, turn your hand either clockwise or counter-clockwise. The gyroscope senses the movement and automatically turns the bit. The speed depends on how far you move your hand in the direction. A less than 45 degree turn is slow, and a full 90 degree turn is fast. There are varying speeds along the way.GRIP: The grip on the handle is rubber, so it is comfortable and grips well. The trigger is hard plastic, but I would have preferred some rubber on the trigger itself. It's not uncomfortable though. I have medium-sized hands and can grip the handle perfectly and comfortably. But vertically, when the tool is upright, the base of the screwdriver barely reaches the bottom of my hand since the handle is only 2.75" tall (where the hand wraps around the handle/trigger). But this is only when holding it in the 90 degree position (L shape/upright position). when it is straightened, it's no problem. And it is comfortable to hold with two hands where one hand holds the top shaft and the other on the handle.  Rating 4.75 of 5.
summary: Great gyroscopic screwdriver. Handles most jobs. Comfortable to use. Storage bag provided.

reviewText: Handles 410a pressures, 800PSI hoses. Gauges have been an industry standard for years. Accurate and simple, gets the job done.
Been using the kreg system for a couple of years now. It works well and these screws are good connecting hardwood 3/4" thick.

Don't expect more than the 8v SCREWDRIVER that it is. I wanted something that would not have as much power as my drill driver. This is an excellent choice for so many applications around the house. I really like how my wife (who hates anything related to tools) wants to use it. If you have a screw or small nut going on a long bolt, this is a great item. It has enough speed, battery power, and control to allow you to cut your time in half. It's hard to explain all the uses I have found for it; however if you have ever put something from IKEA or Sauder together you will appreciate this. This was never meant to replace a drill so don't get mad when it doesn't drive a screw through a 2x4. I looked several places for the best price and the only place selling the kit (2 batteries instead of 1) was Amazon and CPO tools. I ordered through Amazon to get the prime free shipping; but CPO was who fulfilled it.

This is a decent sharpener. Don't get me wrong, it gets the job done and is great for touch-ups in the field. Where it really shines is portability. Handy to simply drop in a pocket of your pack or pants, and BAM! there it is when you need it.Good deal for the price, and handy to have around. I'm happy with my purchase.
I use this in a Chandelier,  It works well and looks nice.  A bit wider than some older bulbs; Has curved glass top.

I own several conventional Streamlight flashlights, but wanted more of a work light for those occasions where you want hands-free light on something. Like all the other Streamlights I own, this one is fairly rugged, easy to use, and designed to be practical under a wide range of situations. I find you can park it on just about any surface and since the batteries make it a little "bottom heavy", it tends to stay put. From there, you can bend or swivel the head to any angle and viola - you've lit up whatever area you like. It even comes with a built-in hook so that you can dangle  it from a line, pipe or whatever...very convenient.The unit seems quite waterproof. During a recent plumbing repair, it got quite drenched and didn't seem any worse for it.With the head pointed straight up, you can also use the knucklehead as a conventional flashlight. The light quality isn't super bright, but instead is spread over a fairly large area...a floodlight more than a spotlight. Still, I prefer this and a longer run time than a brighter light that only lasts an hour.Definitely recommended.

I baught this remembering how hitachi mades such good drills before. I really loved them. 1 month after I baught it the charger went bad.. 1 year warranty... LOL. Ya if you can get hold of the people or try to get a return call I would be amazed. Waranty is worthless without someone to take it.. By Something else with a trustworthy company.

Great saw blade, I'm using it on my 10" table saw and it's just as smooth as can be. I am using it for fine cuts, you would think it has more than 60 teeth the way it cuts. I didn't want to flip for higher tooth count, glad I purchased this one. I have some Dewalt 60 tooth 10" blades on one of my miter saws, I would rather have this blade on my Miter too.
Not much to review with this item. They work as advertised, seem to be well made, and are available at a reasonable price.

This rechargeable LED work light has nice features, and also weak points, including a primitive NiCd battery system.PROs:* Lots of hanging, pointing and mounting options* 3 brightness levels + Strobe. Nice! (see Note 1)* Adapter for AA batteries (extended wilderness use)- Water resistant (IPX4 - can take rain and gentle splashes)- Nylon housing - 2 meter impact-resistance- 2-year warranty (Lifetime warranty on non-electrical defects. See Note 2)- Looks like a high-end flashlightOKs:* It's a work light - optimized for close range. It does not throw a concentrated beam. (See Note 3.)- This model (90627) includes the Steady (slow) 120v AC or 12v DC charger. It does NOT include the 1-hour FAST charger.CONs:* NiCd battery - Not Li-Ion (1990's technology, self-discharges or wants 24x7 trickle charge. Other issues -- see Note 4.)* Dumb charger - wastes energy, no charge status indicator. (See note 5)* Very expensive for what you get* Ergonomics - Not great. (see note 6)- Not very comfortable when hand held- Super-strong magnet: A pointless design element with multiple hazards (see note 7).- Owner manual: Some carelessness and missing information. (see note 8)Note 1: 3 brightness levels + Strobe: From very bright, to "moonlight," which lasts 20 days. Nice!Note 2: Limited Lifetime Warranty: "Streamlight warrants this product to be free of defect, including the LED, for a lifetime of use. We will repair, replace or refund the purchase price, at our option, of any Streamlight product that does not work as a result of a manufacturing defect for as long as you own it. This limited lifetime warranty excludes abuse, batteries, chargers, switches, electronics and normal wear and tear. Rechargeable batteries, chargers, switches and electronics have a two (2) year warranty with proof of purchase."Note 3: It's a work light: It's good for lighting up whatever is 3 to 20 feet away. It does not throw a concentrated beam; it does a poor job lighting up distant objects.Note 4: NiCd battery: In addition to weight, self-discharge, and memory effect issues, the following applies: a.) "Several charge and discharge cycles may be needed to achieve full battery capacity."  b.) "A small leakage of liquid from the battery cells can occur under extreme usage or temperature conditions. This does not necessarily indicate a failure. [ <--Really, not a failure??!! ] However, if the outer case seal is broken and the chemical leakage gets on your skin...Any liquid chemical must be flushed off the skin with a generous amount of water. Brush any dry or powdered chemicals thoroughly, before flushing the area with profuse amounts of water."Note 5: The included Steady Charger (works off 12v DC or 120v AC) is not a smart charger. It can't tell you if the battery has reached a full charge, because it has no idea. You're supposed to just trickle charge your Knucklehead 24x7 as a tribute to energy waste. If you remove the Knucklehead from the charger, the red light will stop shining as way of confirming the obvious: The Knucklehead is not in the charger. However, the wall wart (transformer plug) will continue to radiate heat (waste electricity) and the Knucklehead's primitive NiCd battery will self discharge at a rate of maybe 20% per month. This is to be expected from a $30 flashlight sold at Wal-Mart or a state-of-the-art flashlight circa 1990. Not today's $140 flashlight.Note 6: Not very ergonomic: No show stoppers, just little things. It's not very comfortable when hand held. The battery latch is a pain to open. The AA battery adapter is a slight pain to open. The markings for AA battery direction are hard to see. You can't switch to moonlight without enduring the strobe mode for 6 seconds. The charger's bright red pilot light (which tells you nothing) could be an eyesore in a dark room. If you want to take the magnet off, (and you will -- see note 7), get yourself a 9/64" Allen wrench. Really? They couldn't have gone with a common 1/8"?Note 7: Super-strong magnet: 135 pound pull strength. Really? To hold up a flashlight? Or is this about affirming my manhood? It's a pinch hazard, a painted surface hazard, a pacemaker hazard...and who knows what it will do to your smartphone or camera?Note 8: Owner's manual: a.) very small font.  b.) Vague about what's included (Fast Charger is not included, but manual describes it as if it is.) c.) Gives very few specifications (but lots of specs are available at Streamline's Web site.) d.) Says it ships with magnet detached, but the opposite is true.Summary: Nice idea, but they didn't finish the job. Wal-Mart battery technology at a Brookstone price.

I saw several people that had some not work out of the box, and I had the same experience with one.  The battery had leaked and destroyed the contacts inside.  But, still 9 small flashlights for that price isn't bad at all.  Not super bright, but they work pretty well and are handy to have throughout the house, car, and office.
summary: Great value on the ones that work

reviewText: Bought this product specifically to replace burnt out bulbs in the ceiling light fixture of my bathroom. Make sure you specifically check the model/serial # because all these compact fluorescent bulbs are very similar and some are "lefty" vs "right" with the insert portion. NOT a universal replacement so check before ordering.

I bought a similar 10 WATT Led light from another seller on Amazon.  That light is half as bright as this one.  That one was about $10 less.  Also the other one did not have a ground wire, just a positive and negative wire, which was quite short.  Brighter light, more money.  But worth it to me.
summary: Much better than another LED light I bought

reviewText: I just receive Ingersoll Rand SK4H13L 1/2" Drive 13-piece SAE Deep Impact Socket Set. And I'm very impressed with this set, is simply the best I ever see in my life. I just did place order for metric set to because is not very often to see that quality and beautiful socket set. I give 5 stars, but this product deserve 10 stars. Thank you Amazon for having this product at that price range.
summary: Wow this Ingersoll Rand SK4H13L 1.2" are beautiful.

reviewText: This is just what I needed to fix up an old lamp. Looks just like what came off good sturdy feel no shaking.I would recommend

using this with inline duct fan, VenTech IF6 6" Inline Duct Fan 440 CFM. chose due to the "Frequently bought together" listing, with no complaints in the associated reviews. The controller works, but it's weird. you have to turn it to 80% before the fan even starts to hum. the full range of control is then between 80-90%, so it works, and does what it should, but it's touchy. And as a result, I'm not really sure I can expect it to hold up--- pretty obvious design goof.
summary: spent a lot of dough for so-so performance

reviewText: This lock looks great and is functional. It was just what I was looking for. The codes were easy to set and rekeying to my old house key could not have been easierI have one caution, actually it applies to the lever/door handle with combo lock. If you have a deadbolt and want to install the lever/door handle combo lock you will not be able to change the batteries without removing the deadbolt first - the cover that has to be slid up will not clear the deadbold. I understand the batteries will last a year or more so this may not be a big deal for you.This is why I went with the combo deadbolt and not the combo door handle lock.

I bought a couple of these lights about a year ago.  I keep one on my car keys and one on the boat key with the included quick disconnect.The lights are amazingly bright.  The variable output is handy when you don't want a lot of light.  Just hold the switch down until it ramps up to the intensity you want.  After it fully ramps it goes to strobe.  A simple click without holding it gives full bright.The charging system works well from any 1.2 - 1.5v battery.  I usually use rechargeable NiMH batteries, but it works well with any type.  When the dim strobe stops blinking it is fully charged.  You can charge it twice with an alkaline AA and about 20 times with a D cell.  Don't try recharging with a higher voltage battery for a quicker charge.  Someone over on the Candlepower forums tried it with a rechargeable Lion battery and damaged the light.The light color is fairly warm and the pattern is floody with a little bit of throw.  You probably get around 20 minutes of full bright with a fully charged battery.  That has always been plenty for me.  I've had several Photon products over the years and they have always worked well and been reliable.

This chop saw is made as strong as other Chop Saws at a good price.  I tried it for a few cuts and it performed very good.  I sell and install Satellite Internet and have to cut pipes for holding dishes and other things.  Also have a tractor and tools so I need to cut steel to fix the equipment sometimes.
These are OK.  The EZ Lock system makes changing the wheels easy, which is needed more often than expected.  They have been used mostly to cut mild steel rod and wear out quicker than expected.
summary: Still looking for a more durable cut-off wheel

reviewText: I ruined one of these on one of my trailers and paid $23 for 1 at the local parts store.  I ordered this one to make a rear power supply for my truck.  (Just plug it in to get 12 volts plus ground).  This one had no packaging but other than that it was the exact same item at a little over $4.  If you need an extra (and I recommend keeping one around if you have a trailer) grab this before they raise the price

This bulb does not emit 'warm white' light, it emits a garish blue - particularly when juxtaposed with a soft white incandescent flood lamp which by itself looks bright white.I have two ceiling cans in the kitchen about 4' apart.  I put this bulb in one.  The unnatural light emitted from the led fixture is hideous.  I am a cook.  Part of being a GOOD cook is to have good presentation with good color.  This light will change your food to something unrecognizable, and unappetizing.  I moved it so that it is in the can over the dish-rack and it is still hideous.  My cabinets, which are an off white show up as green.  The light, as I said, appears blue.  Turn off the incandescent and it is still blue.Rant on:  To me, walking around in the dark is better than fluorescent lighting.  I spent years working in buildings where you had little choice except to bring in your OWN incandescent lamp - and most people don't have that option.  The Good Thing about the LED bulbs vs. fluorescent is the LED bulbs are probably safer.  The majority of fluorescent bulbs end up in a land fill.  Why?  Because most people are NOT going to carefully package their fluorescent tubes/bulbs and mail them back to the mfg for 'recycling'.  OR carefully drape haz-mat tape around their living room when a lamp falls off the table and breaks on the carpet and then call the Mercury Removal Service.  (But the expense will be minimal!!!  Sure.  Right.  You betcha! No problemo!)  They'll take up your old carpeting (and dump it in a land-fill ;->) and you get to replace it!  But you wanted to redecorate anyway, right?.  All this and more Jobs too!  The current (and the last) administration would take credit for creating jobs in the booming Mercury Removal Industry!  Rant off.I have hope for LED technology, unfortunately this bulb does not make a passing grade.  I've ordered a different one that is listed as 2700k, and perhaps that will be a little better (although some folks say it is garish yellow.  We'll see, and I will write a review).  I will not use nor keep bulbs that make my home uncomfortable to be in.3 stars?1 star for accuracy in the description and I don't care WHO set the standard.  Simply defining 3000k as 'warm white' does NOT make it warm white.1 star for using this in a food prep area.  (I wouldn't use fluorescent either, I wouldn't use it in ANY area.)4 stars for packaging, the bulb itself, the life expectancy (which should be something like 10 years, but who knows for sure?), brightness and power consumption.  I rounded down because I hate the color.  Sue me.Guess I better get out there and hoard a few hundred incandescent floods!I'm returning this bulb for 'false advertising'.
summary: Should have done a little more research on LED's.

reviewText: This controller works perfectly with my new inline fan. With a single click, I can go from full power back to the desired level of controlled air flow, which comes in handy.

I ordered this to replace an existing 6" cap that was damaged by a recent hail storm.  I was also looking for an improvement over my current vent cap.  The cap is right at deck level allowing little critters perfect access to the house.  That is the main reason I purchased this cover since it has a wire mesh insert.  First the bad news as others have pointed out the holes are about 1/4" square which some critters can still manage to get thru.  Now for the good news, I was hoping that the louver part of this vent was a removable insert and it is.  The even better news is there is room between the louvers and back plate for additional screen!  I was able to insert 2 more layers of metal mesh at different angles and still snap the louvers back in place without issue.  I would like to see any critters try to get in thru this now!  Gave 4 stars due to the need for additional engineering.  Going to try to upload a picture of the finished modifications.
summary: Room for improvement ... Literally  (read full review for details)

reviewText: I have 5 cordless Hitachi tools now, and some like the drills work fine with the standard LI-ION batteries.  But if you plan on using the jigsaws or sawsalls, then you MUST have this battery.  The difference??  When using my reciprocating saw on some fence posts, I was able to saw only about 4-5 posts with the standard battery before it died.  With this bad boy, I was able to saw through 18 posts.

This saw is a monster.  It is literally huge.  I mounted it to the MSUV from Home Depot which makes it very portable.  The saw has plenty of power.  Stock blade is ok.  Slides are ultra smooth.  The laser is handy.  I find that the LCD has little value.  I just don't ever look at it.  Dust extraction is minimal as stated by many others.  For $429 at Amazon I could not go wrong.
Awesome blade, using it on my Miter saw and even low grade white pine is coming out with cleaner cuts.

I bought this saw to replace a 10" Delta double bevel miter saw that served me well for many years, but was too small for a lot of work that I do.What I like:It's heavy enough to stay still without being bolted down.The digital display is a joke to some people, but I found it helpful when the scales were covered in sawdust, if I wanted to double check my settings, or when there's dark shadows on the scales.It glides very nicely and all the adjustments were dead on from the factory.The saw does not need to be running for the laser to be activated.Lots of power, it cuts almost anything without getting bogged down.Detents are nice and tight.The fine tuning knobs help tweak settings so they're dead on.The vertical handle is comfortable when the saw is at bench height, though I could see it becoming an issue if the saw is placed on the floor.What I didn't like:The weight.  It's great for keeping it still, but this sucker is a back killer to move around.This saw can't make a cut when placed at a 45 right miter and 45 left bevel - a tab sticking up from the left fence is too high and doesn't allow the saw to move.The laser is a tad narrow, and doesn't go a full 1/8" for most blade kerfs.There's no detent override.It makes a mess with sawdust.  The collection port is really high, and the bag is angled downwards, so when it becomes over full it'll drop a big clump of dust if the saw is lowered when not running.The deck is 4-1/4" high.  This is taller than some miter saw bench support brackets, and may become an issue.Side supports arms are not included, unlike most lower-end saws.Something that's a little silly is that unless the digital readout is turned on, the laser can't be turned on.  The readout resets itself to zero every time it's shut off and turned back on, so unless the saw is set back to 0's, the display will be incorrect, though it can be reset.Overall, it's the best saw for stationary work, unless you're a workout junkie and want something heavy to lug around instead of joining a gym.

I have used this saw for about a year now and I absolutely love it. It takes less space behind the saw than any other sliding saw, which in a small shop can make a big difference. The digital read out gives precise angle readouts and the laser is easily adjusted for right or left side cutting. I tried out the Ridgid and the Craftsman before buying this saw and I could not get either the Rigid or Craftsman to cut a square line and I love Ridgid tools. I don't know if it was the saw blade or the saws or maybe me, but they would not stay set up on square. This one was pretty easy to set up and has stayed setup. Great saw, a little pricey but I got mine at Lowes on sale for 30% off.
This tool is great. Use it all the time for every thing from grinding callesses off my heals to polishing gun parts for a smoother action.

This is a very impressive powerful 1aa light. Great build quality. I love the dual switch configuration. 4 brightness levels up to 120 lumens (very bright) and the 3 lumen low is perfect for midnight snack runs. On low it will run for 4 days straight! Nice! The only thing I wish it did was tail stand but the performance and quality outweigh that shortcoming. I orderd this light from edisonbright and I received it before the eta date in perfect condition and good packaging. I thought I was getting the 115 lumen model but got the 120 lumen one. Cool.  Good seller!If you need a small multi-function aa light you will not be disappointed!5 star light and seller!

A tight tool aquisition budget and anticipated light use influenced my decision to buy this lower priced tool.This is my first experience with a belt/disc sander so I have nothing to compare it with.Better instructions and better quality photos would have speeded up assembly.The plastic parts are flimsy.  The plastic guard at the end of the belt arrived cracked although the exterior of the box showed no damage.Tracking the belt is tricky.  The belt slowly goes out of adjustment and must be re-set from time to time.  I don't have that problem with my Makita portable belt sander.The unit is noisy and vibrates a lot.I would not recommend this sander to a friend, rather I would encourage buying a more expensive machine of hopefully better quality.
blade works as designed and certainly a must for the blade selection for fein multimaster, great for fine cut shipped fast
Good quality fixture - haven't put it up yet, but like the heavy quality and look of the light.  Am going to place in my guest bath.  Has a timeless look!
summary: Good quality - not a bad price

reviewText: I expected this to look better in the picture... but to my surprise these books are put together very well. I actually now have to get some nicer hardback books for my library so these don't stand out LOL. I would definitely suggest these to anyone wanting a nice hiding spot.

this is a great shelf!!!!  small enough to fit in limited space, large enough to hold all my toaster oven pans and lids that i use on my nuwave cooker, too.  nearly doubled the storage space i had.  i attached the lower shelf about midway and put lids in it.  very happy with this purchase

I have been using mine for about 3 years in my router table. The first one I received failed after the first days use. It took a few weeks for a Warranty replacment to arrive.I agree with all the top reviews for this router. I have cut molding to raised panels in all types of hard and soft wood, It does a great job. My only wish is that you could make fine adjustments from above the table.I gave 4 stars for the failed fist unit, but it has worked fine ever since.
This ratchet works great and is a quality tool. I would recommend this tool to anyone. Buy this ratchet you wont be sorry.

I bought this specifically as a shotgun mounted light with the Elzetta mount.  I'm shooting a Remington 870 with Federal Premium 2 3/4" 00 Buckshot loads.  The flashlight does NOT cycle on and off like some of the other reviewers are discussing.  Works great, stays on.
summary: Light does NOT cycle with shotgun recoil for me

reviewText: Ok, this is no Lee Valley, Lie Neilsen plane etc, and the title marks it as contractor grade anyway (not fine cabinetmaker) so I wasn't expecting a perfect tool. out of the box the product seems strong and quite well made. The sole is as flat as it needs to be for the type of work the block plane is used for. All adjustment features seem to work well, although a little stiff out of the box until you use them a little more, then they start to free up a little and are easier to adjust etc.The blade itself is ground at 25 degrees and mine actually had a bit of a ding in it out of the box, however, the manual states the blade should be honed to 30 degrees anyway, so after about 20 minutes with a diamond sharpening stone and plane blade sharpening jig, I was able to remove the ding at 25 degrees and then hone a nice sharp edge at 30 degrees. A few quick tests of the product and it worked great.The secret is in the sharpness of the blade. Hone a very sharp edge on this block plane's blade and it will work just as well as a block plane costing 10x as much. The block plane makes a great addition to any contractors/carpenters kit bag, or even for the fine woodworker too as long as you are prepared to spend that 20-30 minutes tuning it up to shape straight from the box.

I like the Energizer Flameless Wax LED Votive Candles. Their beauty lies in their real, vanilla scented wax construction for visual appeal, crowned with elegant curvature to mimic an actual candle.These provide candlelight without the hassle of matches, the danger of open flame and the need to burn through traditional candles. For such a small investment, the value goes a long way. These run for about seventy-five hours on each of their easily replaceableCR2032type batteries.The convincingly amber-colored ambient light matches the intensity of a small votive candle. The vanilla scent is mild and pleasant.The only thing left open to criticism is the flicker pattern; it constantly goes. In a still-air indoor environment, the effect can appear, somewhat humorously, out of sync. If there were either air moving in the home or a breeze present outdoors, the fact that the light comes from an LED would go unnoticed.Overall, I am very pleased with these beautiful, scented wax Energizer LED votive candles.

Overall I'm very pleased with this dual photoelectric and ionization smoke alarm.  We bought two of these for our bedrooms along with smoke and CO combo detectors for our main level and one for our basement  to bring our house up to current residential fire codes.  Prior to this our house only had plain battery operated smoke detectors (one in the basement and one in the main floor hallway.You'll need basic household wiring skills and if you are retrofitting into an existing home you'll have to plan out how you will run the wiring in the walls carefully.  Fortunately, we live in a ranch so I could access the center of the walls from the basement fairly easily and once I came up with a reliable way to fish the 14-3 wiring installation moved along quickly.If you aren't comfortable doing household wiring, you should hire an electrical contractor to install these for you.
summary: Installation fairly straight forward. Seems to work just fine.

reviewText: I recently upgraded to a Dewalt 18V drill, so I bought this bare saw to go with it.  I just spent a good part of the weekend building a deck and stairs for my spa.  This saw rocks.  Very light, very easy to handle both right and left handed.  The trigger safety is an easy reach.  I can't say enough good things about this saw.

I really like these Ridgid 1-5/8" ratcheting pipe cutters. I used the General brand cutters for several years and was never really able to get consistently straight cuts with them, but the Ridgid work so good that the General cutters now just stay in the shop.  These Ridgid cutters cut very clean and straight and the ratcheting action is smooth and positive. With the General cutter, I sometimes had to assist them through the last click of the cut by pressing down on the top of the blade with my thumb to engage the final tooth of the ratchet. The Ridgid cutters on the other hand, will complete the cut from start to finish without any additional assistance on my part.The cutters are well made and feel very solid in your hand. The blade is replaceable without having to dissemble the tool or remove any screws. You just remove the center pin which is held in place with an O-ring. There is a notch on the back of the blade that I find can be used for reaming and deburring plastic pipe in a pinch. The internal handle lock on these actually works and keeps the cutters securely closed when you drop them into your tool bag or bucket. The external locking ring on the General's would often slip off and allow the cutters to pop open in your bag, leaving the sharp blade exposed. From my own experience, ratcheting pipe cutters have made installation of small diameter PVC pipe and conduit a lot faster and easier over the years. Before they were around I normally used a Lenox PVC hand saw or a cordless reciprosaw to cut PVC pipe. I see that Ridgid also makes a similar ratcheting cutter with a 2-3/8" capacity, which no doubt would be useful for working with larger 2" PVC pipe.
summary: Ridgid 23498 Ratchet Action Plastic Pipe and Tubing Cutter

reviewText: Sturdy with an adjustable mouth and blade tilt.Understand you will need to prep this before use. The sole is not precision ground but machine rough, so you will need a granite block and sandpaper or a set of flat block diamond hones. Once you have your sole (and sides) honed and flat you will need to sharpen the blade. There are several jigs and sharpening tools to assist in this. After all is done apply an anti-rust agent such as wood wax or Boeshield.Once prep'd this is a great plane.

I bought this pulley to use with a solar shower so that the bag of water could be pulled up by young and old and at a height comfortable for all to use.  The solar bag is pretty heavy when full of water and the pulley works great although my overall design needs some help. No regrets with this pulley.

My home was about 20 years old and had five pocket doors.  The standard (cheap) pocket door hardware can easily bind up, especially after it jumps the track and damages the track in the process.  The biggest problem in a pocket door retrofit application is removing the old track and replacing it with a new track because it is almost impossible to reach into the door opening to remove all of the old track attachement screws and then attach the new track with new mounting holes.  I solved this problem by cutting a retangular access hole in the drywall near the end of the track where I couldn't otherwise reach.  I chose to cut on the side of the door that would need the least amount of repair and repair expertise or otherwise would show any repair imperfections the least.  In two rooms, there was wallpaper so after I patched the wall, I simply applied a new strip of wallpaper for an invisible repair.  In another room, that I was completely renovating, I had the patch and the rest of the drywall textured (by a professional who knew how to do a good job.)  Another patch was behind the kitchen refrigerator and completely hidden by kitchen cabinetry.  I could have also chosen to cut the wall in a closet that backed up to this door.  As noted by another, this hardware cannot jump the track and the doors operate very smoothly.  It is easy to adjuse the roller mechanisms to square up the door with the door frame.  One should expect that the door molding will have to be removed and replaced on both sides of the door to both remove the old door and track and to install or replace the door.  I replaced the old, beat up, molding at the same time which really looked nice.  While I was there, I replaced the DOOR as well.  The old ones were the smooth-sided brown mahogany type.  New, 6 panel, doors are cheap and readily available at your local big box hardware store and really update an older home.  I also purchased new sliding door locking hardware.  The end result looks great and works great.  I'm looking at this hardware again for a garage application.  I'd like to hang a tool holding pegboard, about 2' x 4', from this track.  The track would be mounted in front of some shelves with the track allowing me to move the pegboard out of the way if I needed access to the shelves behind.  Perhaps this is overkill, but when you're trying have a complete workshop in a two-car garage, space is at a premium.  Good quality, good price, and works great!
summary: Great for Pocket Door retrofit and other applications

reviewText: MY wife and I have gone through a lot of expensive sunglass reeaders.  These Dewalt glasses are better that any one of the much more expensive glasses.  The Dewalts are clear and tough.  Our home budget will be greatly improved by eliminating the need to buy new, costly and flimsy sunglasses every 6 months or so.  Sorry, Italy.
summary: These Dewalt glasses are better that any one of the much more expensive glasses

reviewText: These are the best safety goggles I have purchase to date.  So good I picked up a pair of the tinted ones also.  Great field of view and very comfortable to wear.
summary: Safety that is clear and comfortable

reviewText: I bought one of these mainly because it looked cool and instead actually found it to be pretty valuable. First of all, the EatN Tool feels like a solid piece of metal. I had half expected this to be a flimsy and cheaply made. It definitely doesn't feel like a sub-$10 piece of hardware.The wrench part of the EatN Tool confuses me. In all honesty, I don't know when this would come in handy. I'd rather it come with Phillips Screwdriver or something else. The screwdriver and bottle opener are the best tools on this. The spork itself is pretty cool and works well for a quick eating utensil. The carabiner is pretty small and will clip onto a bag.Overall for $6.50, it's a pretty neat camping accessory. I subtracted a star because of the relative uselessness of the wrenches and that I received a defective EatNTool.
Very well constructed 10 out of 10 ,came early in just the right size packaging. Was just what I was looking for now I have a kool bracelet and some 550 paracord if needed on Me.

This works as it describes, holds the shower head either for ever, or temporarily, depending on when you move the shower head. If you never move it, yes, it's permanent , but if you move it, not so permanent. If you use the suction cup it came with it may come loose but when screwed to the wall or shower it will not. I like it and was planning  on buying a back up , but seeing how it hasn't moved in over a month, I see no need for a back up.
I was looking for something to consolidate all my gun parts and pieces that I has scattered over multiple shelves... This box is perfect for storing extra gun locks, grips, tools, holsters, etc...

I purchased one of these a few years ago because I had a lot of  3x21"  sanding belts laying around that I though I could make use of with this machine. I also have a Ryobi spindle sander as well and in using them side by side,the Ryobi is actually more powerful. This is Ok for a hobbyist, but isn't built well enough ,nor is it powerful enough for serious woodworking tasks, so I wouldn't recommend it for any one but the occasional user. I find myself using the Ryobi more often because it gets the job done faster.
The best thing about this product is that it is very light, but very sturdy. Over 6-feet high so you can pile on tons of crap. Tools, carwash supplies, paint. Whatever you have it can hold.
This battery lasts much longer than the original that came with our weed eater.  Fery pleased with this purchase. You won't be disappointed with this product.,
I have no idea why thesse bulbs are so hard to find, but Amazon  has them and and they fit the 6V rechargeable mag and stream lights.
Good for groups of light switches where you don't want people to keep turning one of them off by habit or guessing.  Accessible on the side when you want to.
summary: Prevents unnecessary switching while allowing you to reach it

reviewText: I bought this item thinking it was a pressure SWITCH in which, you would press it once, and the light would stay on, but NO! It's a pressure PAD in which you have to keep it pressed down for your light to stay on. This is false advertisement and a rip off. I was mislead into purchasing this thinking it was going to do exactly what the title of this product says.
summary: Pressure PAD, Not A Pressure SWITCH

reviewText: I'm a remodeler and have found tons of uses for this little level.  First off, it's extremely solid and reliable, so I'm more likely to use it.  I previously owned a torpedo level that was partially plastic and didn't give very accurate readings (so I often didn't even bother using it).  The large bubble on the Stabilia is very easy to read.  The magnets are so powerful that the level can stick to corner bead that's being hit with a pneumatic stapler or ductwork that I'm tapping into place.  I love being able to stick it onto ducts when I'm in cramped attics or on roofs and know that it won't fall off.  It frees up my hands to hold tools, move materials, or balance myself when I'm in precarious locations.  The Stabilia's shape makes it easy to put into my toolbelt as well.

First, I bought this from a local big box store but it's the same brand and model number.  I'm leaving review to help prospective buyers in their decision making.This model require access to the attic in order to be able to install it properly.  It's definitely not doable from  the bottom side of the ceiling alone.  This is the kind that the housing requires direct screwing onto the ceiling joist.  Other models have separate brackets from the housing.  This model however doesn't have that separate bracket/mount that makes installation from the bottom possible.Installation was a breeze.  It was my first time installing an exhaust fan but I did my homework though before I went for it.  It took me, a handy amateur, 2 & 1/2 hours to complete the installation.  That includes opening the box, reading the installation guide, googling clarifications, getting in and out of the attic, planning placement of the hole, sawing the holes, wiring, screwing the housing, connecting ducts, then from the bottom, installing the covers.  I had help though as eyes from the bottom while doing my sawing and also occasional handing me forgotten tools while in the attic.  I used only basic amateur tools in the entire process.After initial assembly it had some rattle/vibration noise.  Like what others have mentioned here, this model makes some annoying noises.  The pieces/parts are partly loose after assembly.  These loose joints rattle like tin can when not addressed.  I was able to eliminate 95% of the rattling by adding/placing dots of rubber material here and there.  I used white caulking as my rubber material and placed about 6 dots of it here & there.After loose joints were tightened, it became a true 2.5 sones exhaust.  Not the quietest neither the loudest.  For the price, it's the best you can buy.Recommendation:NOT RECOMMENDED for people not willing to troubleshoot after installation.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for people willing to troubleshoot the rattling after installation.

Previously I purchased and installed two of these and have not had a clog in years. Finally got around to replacing toilet #3.Immediately noticed that it is nowhere near as good as the older two.  Took me a while to figure out why. I had used a new fangled wax ring so thought that was the problem so reinstalled with no improvement.  Noticed that hang time during which flapper remains open is less than the other two but it is not adjustable.  If you hold the handle a couple extra seconds it is closer but then you use more water.  Finally noticed that AS went from 1.6 gpf to 1.28.  It makes a BIG difference as it is essentially same original design with less water.  Not good. Just ordered a toto 1.6.I suspect that many of the reviews here are for the 1.6.  Looking at them, it is hard to easily spot the difference. Using them is another story.
summary: Older 1.6 great. The new 1.28 not so much

reviewText: Excellent led flashlight.  If you drop it there is no breakage.  It is also waterproof.  It provides a very bright light with led bulbs that are rated at 10,000 hours of use.  It has a very reasonable price.
as having a need for lighting in an area where ther is no elec. avail this night light sure is handy
It could be better, as it has a very short step water, what I did was take a screw to bring him full circle and thus have greater water flow still works well and has a nice appearance.

This drill is remarkedly comfortable to use.  It is smaller and more powerful that an older DeWalt 9.6 volt drill I have.  The major draw back is the battery charging system.  With the DeWalt you put a battery in the charger and leave it until you need it.  Not with the Hitachi.  It says to take it out when charged.  Therefore you got to watch it.  Also, if you are using the drill alot and the battery gets low on power, it is also warm and the charger will not charge it until it cools off.  Can't get the battery to charge until it cools off????  If you need to charge right away, you are out of luck.I guess for the price, I can live with this flaw.  But sure like the DeWalt charging system much better.

This requires a small 12 volt battery (many of these things do; I think It could have been made to operate with an easy-to-find 9v battery).  The battery compartment of the remote has a flimsy lid and installing the battery between two metal retainer prongs had me get out my swiss army knife.The main unit seems to be solidly constructed.  It's not 100% solid sate -- you can hear a relay click when switching it on and off. It takes about a second to recover form an on OR off state.  In other words, you must wait one second to turn it on again after it's been switched off.  And vice versa.

This little flashlight is amazing! I use it every night at work. The adjustable beam feature is very helpful. The narrow beam reaches very far. It uses 3 AAA batteries, which is much more onvenient than the specialty batteries used by most high-performance flashlights. I also have an $80 Fenix flashlight. I find this inexpensive flashlight to be more useful and just as well-built. This flashlight truly is an excellent value! Why pay more?
Powerful sander at a great price! More for the DIY guy rather than a general contractor.

This case has lots of drawers and room for labels on the front of the drawers--exactly what I needed to organize my "shop supplies" in my shed.  It has solid mounting brackets accessible by pulling a drawer out on each of the corners.  It's strong, durable and fully met my expectations.

I thought this was a GREAT hedlight when I got it.  It is super bright, and the beam is focusable.  I really liked it.  The only downside was that it is not water resistant.  Then it just stopped working.  Too late to return it.  It makes me realize that it is worth spending a bit more on items made from quality components.

I have several waterfalls in my yard and control them with this remote control.  I have used several wireless switches over the years and this is the best one.  Don't pay more as this is a quality well built device.  Cheaper models I've tried would randomly turn on and off or quit working entirely.  If you need to control more than one item please note there is a channel A and channel B model, get one of each for independent control.  To avoid water infiltration the item must be hung vertically as depicted in the instructions and as noted by other reviewers.

reviewText: LOVE this sucker. By FAR the brightest light for the money. The optics are so good on this light, that when it's fully zoomed in, you can actually see the shape of the Led CHIP projected on the wall!!! Amazing. For 14 bucks, it simply cannot be beat. Also, it's exactly 1 inch in diameter, so when combined with the $4.95 tactical weaver mount that Amazon sells, you have a tactical light for you AR that is better than ANYTHING streamlight sells for 10 times the money!! Amazing! I bought 10 of these and gave them out as gifts. Everyone thinks I spent $75 per light. WRONG. The only thing i see with this light that kinda sux a little is that it does not seem to accept the P60 upgrade engine, although I don't see why you'd want to go that way. I wanted to to turn this thing into a cheap IR illuminator. Oh well, can't have it all!

This has a nice assortment of all the major types of Dremel accessories you might need. This will save you quite a bit over buying these things individually. As for the "pieces" the majority of them are the sanding drums. The case is actually an OK design and is nice for holding these particular accessories and might even be worth keeping around to refill those you must replace after use, but there isn't any room for any additional accessories you might get. I did appreciate this also comes with a wrench to tighten the collet so you can store it right there with your accessories instead of having to track down the one that came with your Dremel. It should also be noted this comes with a collet for the EZ Lock system that some accessories accept.
Good quality pocket light, Light weight, very bright, switch is sturdy, and its a Pelican. they always back their products.

reviewerName: H S Truman "The buck stops here"
reviewText: CMT blade cleaner really works. I just spray a little, wait a minute and lightly scrub.  All the rust, dirt, pitch and even burn marks come right off.

Finally took the advice of a co-worker and purchased this light. He was right on with that recommendation. I've owned this long enough now to have put it through it's paces and have experimented with all of the functions. Very nice! The pushbutton on/off switch located at the base is much more functional than having to do a two-handed twist required on other lights. The lack of focus seems of no concern partly due to the handy dimming function. This light is bright and sometimes you don't need full beam! Battery life is good which I credit to the quality of the LED which is the heart of any flashlight. There's no pocket clip which I don't mind, allows for easy placement in a holster, but the body of the light is round so it will tend to want to roll if laid on a flat surface. To top it all off, a good warranty and made in the USA!

reviewText: This thing sticks most places (when you try to stick it directly horizontal on a surface, it seems to barely hold on, but guess that's good enough).. Love the magnetic end with a bright LED light, comes in handy alot!
I have 4 of these.  I have used them for years.  The first thing I do is saw the handle off so it will fit in my tool box.  I like them a lot.  Color is wrong in the photo; it really green.

Bought it to use on my outside porch light fixture, which is open on the bottom, and glass on the sides, assuming it would still be able to see me through the glass. It didn't. I think part of the issue was the glass sides, and part was the height of the fixture, at 10-11 ft, it just wasn't seeing me. I jumped, I waved, and nothing made it come on, until I went back up the stairs, and then it came on. Not really what I needed, so I took it down.I put it in my basement, as the ceilings are lower, and the fixtures are all bare bulb, with no glass surrounds. It works like a charm there. Comes on every time - no matter which way I approach it, and stays on for about 5 min after I leave.  I think the 5 minutes might be a bit long, but not a biggie. There's no way to adjust that, that I could find, but I'll take it.It is pretty big and clunky, and wouldn't fit in any fixture with a glass globe, anyway, so this is primarily a bare bulb fixture kind of thing.  If you buy it for that purpose, I think you'll be happy with it. If you want it for a fixture with any sort of surround, or really high ceilings, I think you may be disappointed.

Finally an LED bulb that behaves like a good old incandescent bulb at a fraction of the energy consumption.  Most LED bulbs for household use are very directional, that is to say the light goes in more of a beam than the glow in all directions of a traditional frosted glass bulb.  This one comes very close to being omnidirectional.  I found a version in a color temperature (2700 Kelvin) that is closer to the warm white of a tungsten filament or halogen capsule filament bulb.Note: The listed example is color temperature 5000 K, and the higher the number, the more blue-white it looks. In a home environment the blue-white color can seem harsh, sort of like an old fluorescent light tube.The light output of the 2700K example under review is 800 lumens, about the same as a CFL or incandescent rated at 60 watts.  Power consumption of the LED array is just 9.5 watts at 120 volts. This unit is said to be dimmable, but I have it in a conventional hooded desk lamp so that feature has not been tested.Two things are curious about this bulb -- the outer "glass" is coated in clear plastic like a shatterproof industrial shop bulb. It is sticky to the touch, and in an exposed lamp the surface might be attractive to dust.  The other characteristic is that the vertical flanges seen between the metal base and the frosted glass run quite hot for a 9 watt bulb.  It feels more like how hot a 60 watt bulb would get.  Those flanges are designed to dissipate heat created by the LEDs as they produce light, and I have to assume it gets hot, thermally, as a normal running condition.One other characteristic to note -- the bulb is about a half-inch longer than a traditional incandescent bulb. See customer photo. It should fit in most fixtures.I am delighted to see on the packaging that this bulb is "assembled in U.S.A."  There is no country of origin on the bulb itself, but that's me being a skeptic.The heat issue is significant, which is why I've marked it at 4-stars instead of five.  With the heat concentrated near the socket, some sockets could eventually suffer damage from prolonged temperatures that were not envisioned with bulbs where most of the heat was up in the glass and away from the electrical contacts.  In my application, the bulb is horizontal rather than upright (base down, glass up), and the metal shroud on my lamp may aggravate the amount of heat that can build up.  But so far, in the first hour of operation, the metal shroud is COOLER than with the 40 watt halogen it replaced.----------UPDATEI have improved the rating to 5-star after observing that the section between the metal base and the flanges is acting as a thermal insulator.  The flange area gets quite warm -- too hot to touch, really -- but the heat does not spread to the base.  So, there is less basis for concern about potential damage to the electrical socket into which this bulb is placed.
summary: Finally - a glow instead of a spotlight

reviewText: I needed a new jig saw and bought this one based on my experience with Makita tools and reading reviews. It seems to work well and my only complaint is not with the excellent saw but the rather poor quality plastic case that the clasps continually fall off of.
PERFECT for the Refrigerator!!  Gives a pure white light that illuminates every corner of the fridge!Obviously NOT FOR OVENS!

This is a really beautiful faucet. The instructions are easy to follow and anyone who can read well should be able to follow them for an easy installation. It works great. The handles turn on and off easily and the spray nozel shuts off easily. Love this beautiful chorme Kitchen faucet. "Renita"

reviewText: Stanley TR-250 Sharp-Shooter Plus Heavy-Duty Staple/Brad Nail GunI bought this staple gun for home use, mainly for items like molding, picture frames, light carpentry, hobby projects, insulation, ceiling tile, carpet padding repairs, upholstery, low voltage wires and holiday lights. The Stanley TR-250 Sharp-Shooter Plus works very well for these types of jobs.The all-metal drive channel ensures better penetration, with less force to squeeze and more driving power. The heavy duty aircraft-aluminum housing is engineered for long-lasting durability. There is a Hi/Lo power lever for hard and soft materials and the flush-nose design solves the problem of stapling in tight spots, with a lock-down handle for safe storage. Designed into this tool is a quick-view window which simplifies staple identification and an easy-slide full-stick staple load, uses Stanley Sharp-Shooter TRA700 series or Arrow T-50 heavy duty narrow crown staples 1/4-Inch (6mm), 5/16-Inch (8mm), 3/8-Inch (10mm), -Inch (12mm), 9/16-Inch (14mm) and 1/2-Inch (12mm), 9/16-Inch (14mm), and 5/8-Inch (15mm) Brads. There is an internal wire guide function that can be controlled with your thumb ( control function for not driving staple into wires in error), palm control function to control your staples and brads, and with a 30-percent easier squeezing function your hand doesn't get as tired as with other harder to squeeze staplers.Some of the product features are:* Easy-squeeze product works overtime as a staple gun, brad nailer, cable tacker, and wire tacker* All-metal drive channel ensures better penetration* Less force to squeeze and more driving power* Heavy duty aircraft-aluminum housing for long-lasting durability.* Hi/Lo power lever for hard and soft materials.* Flush-nose design solves the problem of stapling in tight spots* Limited Lifetime WarrantyStanley makes a heavy duty staple assortment for different uses around the house TRA700BN and has 5/8-Inch (15mm) brads included. You can order, go to your local home improvement big box store, or hardware store where you will find refills for your needs. These are common and easy to find so you shouldn't have trouble finding them. It is important to use the correct staple for the job, as the problem of the staple not embedding completely in different wood types maybe the staple and not the gun.I've have good luck with this particular staple gun for my home needs and would recommend it for light to moderate home use. This staple gun does require some hand and wrist strength, so if you have some problems with this, due to arthritis or tendon strength, you may have to use a different type of staple gun. The Stanley TR-250 Sharp-Shooter Plus is made in Taiwan.Stanley warrants this product to the original purchaser for its useful life against deficiencies in material and workmanship. This LIMITED LIFETIME WARRANTY does not cover products that are improperly used, abused, altered or repaired. Deficient products will be replaced or repaired.Always wear safety goggles to protect your eyes.
summary: Stanley TR-250 Sharp-Shooter Plus Heavy-Duty Staple/Brad Nail Gun

reviewText: I bought this for my son along with the Craftsman Drill/Driver as he moves into his own home. All men love power tools. We are passing the Craftsman tradition onto the next generation.  Also liked the case to hold all the bits.
these are nice and do not block the 2nd outlet like some of these. I don't like the remote button layout, wish they where all side by side or better yet on off toggle like some I have. Good range.

I do wish solar lighting had the brightness of regular low voltage landscape lighting, but they are much simpler to use.

reviewText: I use these pliers for occasionally adjusting the frames of my several pairs glasses.The jaws prevent damage to the frame, and work just like an oculist's pliers.

I have used my saw to install about 600' of complex tile so far...another 550 to go.  The saw & stand combination has been fantastic!  Thanks to the open-framed stand, I can place an elevated 5-gallon water-catch bucket under the drain on the saw.  It's really clean...no splash mess whatsoever.  Highly recommended!
summary: Excellent stand for your D24000 Tile Saw

reviewText: Just to let you know, this "may" be an ok product.  What I received was far from it.  When received from FEDEX I looked at it and said "Damn, I can put this together in about 5 minutes".  Not so, very poor quality control on the product that they shipped out.  It was suppose to have 6 space washers, it came with 4 (the parts list initially said four and was crossed out and updated to six).  The wheels were suppose to simply slide on the axel (one did, one didn't).  The cotter pins seem to come in two different sizes, three long, one short.  Seeing that one of the wheels slides fine on either end of the axel, I can only assume that the bearing race on one wheel, was either the incorrect one or out of round. So, I thought maybe it was just a metalic burr, which could be easily corrected with a rubber mallet (used gently of course).  Nope, seems I had to place it in a vice and use a drift pin to knock out the axel, which also knocked out the inner bearing race.  This created another problem, "reinstalling the race with the bearing intact".  Way to much crap to go through for no particular reason.  Sigh . . .This happened on a Saturaday night so there was no one to call, although I did have use for this product at this time, I guess I just place everying thing on hold or buy a mule.  So . . . now it's sitting in my garage anxiously waiting for Monday to come about.  Seeing that I have a few options, other than calling the company and expecting them to "overnight" the correct parts (which I doubt), I will probably be returning the product to Amazon "if" what I get is "static" from Harper.  I will, however, edit this fine review if the company handles this in a expedient manner and update the rating, if not . . .well I did rate it one, didn't I?  So . . .I guess time will tell.Update:  March 10,2010  I eventually had to return the first one for a same product replacement.  And I was impressed with the expedient manner Amazon handled the return and sent me another one (that worked).  Long story made short, all the parts fit this time, however there were still two space washers missing as in the first order.  That ok, I figured this could possibly happen and I saved two spacers on the hand truck I returned.  I would have probably given this product a five star rating if part one of this review never happened.As far as the assembled product is concerned.  It only took a few minutes to put together.  Removing the handle to convert it to a four wheel truck is easily done with just two pins that lock into place.  I'm sure this will work just fine and appears to be made well.

This could be a bit more powerful. My miter saw, band saw, sanders, are ok with this. The router I will know more when I get my new attachment that does both the fence and the motor. It is about worthless on my joiner planer. I have to see if there are any better attachments then the factory dust nozzle as shavings go all over the place. I am going to run a test on some scrap wood and have the planer hooked up to my regular shop vac and see if there is any difference. I have a Porter Cable bench mount joiner planer, so it may be the design of the planer itself that is causing the problem. I will report more after the experiment.Deliver was on time and the packaging was fine. Assembly was no problem as everything lined up just right. The hook piece that holds up the bag when deflated should be of a sturdier build. After it breaks, and it will, I will make something stronger. It can bend easy where it attaches to the center ring.Use some sealing tape around the intake as it is a source of air leakage.
summary: IT WORKS BUT COULD BE BETTER

reviewText: This works better than the old 18 Volt Milwaukee batteries.  This charger is more versatile than the old one I had.  It does both 18 and 12 Volt batteries.  It is not backwards compatible from M18 to 18V , connector is different.

This steamlight has lasted me for almost three years now which is good, if I ever used it, but it hasn't been what I really wanted, because for one, the 27 lumens this light puts out is just not bright enough for me, and the other thing that sucks about this light, is the belt clip.I wanted a key ring flashlight and the belt clip doesn't have anyway to connect to my key ring without it just falling off.So look at the Inova xs or Fenix LD01 before you make your final purchase decision. Also look at the Photon micro lights, but only buy the white led version, if you want the brightest Photon.
summary: Look at these other lights on the market first

reviewText: I have never seen a light that out performs this one.  It's about as bright as a carbon arc.  It's great!

It's a leatherman wave. With all its bells and whistles, it's one of the most versatile tool you'll ever own. It gets 4 stars because a week after I purchased it on Amazon for $60 I saw Walmart selling them at $35..

No problems for over a year even after my grand kid pulling it off the wall and dropping it several times. I have bought 26 of them for my rental properties and none have been returned or repaired. I like it because it doesn't need a battery. Just plug it into the wall and forget about it.

Easy to install, looks very nice, & heavy duty. High quality lock that should last a long time. I did a lot of research & read several Amazon reviews and am very pleased with this choice. It's easy to change the lever from left- to right- handed.

Bought these for undercabinet use in the kitchen.  Installation was extremely easy although I would suggest using the included screws instead of the double stick tape.  The double stick tape only held for a couple of weeks before starting to release.  The light strips are very lightweight, so failure of the tape can only be attributed to the tape itself, and not the weight of what they are holding in place.  The screws are teeny, so intrusion into your cabinets are not a problem, but their small size makes them a little tedious to install.I don't understand other reviews that critique these lights for not being very bright.  Perhaps if their hope was to use these as a substitute for overhead lighting, then yes, they will never take the place of my recessed kitchen lights that are necessary for major meal preparations, but I don't believe that's what they are intended for in the first place.As task lights, they are very bright and serve my intended use perfectly.  Without turning on any other lights in the kitchen, one (3 strip) string of these under the cabinets provide ample illumination for light kitchen duties in the area ie: loading/unoading the dishwasher, prepping my morning cereal or oatmeal, making coffee or a cup of tea . . .The light it puts out is a warm light; not the typical bluish bright light usually associated with LED's.I am very pleased, and have since ordered 3 more sets - - - two more for other areas of my kitchen, and one set for the inside an old armoire which has been reconfigured as a liquor cabinet.
summary: Small, bright and easy to install

reviewText: These worked well for connecting concrete reinforcing wire into cages around tomato plants.  I wrapped the wore around the barrels and then guided the tomatoes up the middle of the cylinder.
Hardly moves any air. relatively noisy. Made absolute no difference between the two adjoining rooms.  Ended up throwing it away. Only gave it a 1 star because I couldn't give it zero.

This product is working very well, I thought distance would become and issue, but the fact is it isn't. Since it's mobile and are having a pool party and very loud outside, you can take it with you and hear it, to be able to hear when your guest have arrived.

I like to get the boxes of sand paper so I don't run out.  These match my Dewalt DW421 just like they are suppose to.They line up easily and are easy to attach and detach later.  But they stay put while in use.It is  much easier to get a smooth finish if you step your way up through the  grits.  Get them all and work your way up and you will get a nice smooth  finish.
Good build quality and you can take each wrench out indivudually if you need to easily, I really liked this product.

Solar powered motion senseor light, very easy to install, only needs to use two screws.  There are two settings for one the light will come on.  When it is night time, the light will be on a very low power setting, and when motion is detected it will go into a bright light setting for thiry seconds.  The light is not as bright as your standard halogen flood lights, but it's bright enough to know where you are walking and better to save on electricity costs.  If you have several of these installed along your wall, the low light setting gives a pretty nice effect, sort of like seeing those solar powered garden torches.
